brings offers peace honor reſpect may take purpoſe preſently leaue warre baſt rather well defence sal nay manner done already many carriages hee hath diſpatch'd put cauſe quarrell diſpoſing cardinall lords thinke meete afternoone poaſt conſummate buſineſſe happily baſt let noble prince princes may beſt shall waite vpon fathers funerall hen worſter muſt bodie interr'd will'd baſt thither happily decke theſe iriſh warres come gentlemen let's go viſit pray heauen may make haſt come late exit actus secundus scena prima enter gaunt yorke gau king come may breath laſt wholſome counſell vnſtaid youth yor vex breth vaine comes counſell eare gau oh tongues dying men inforce attention like deepe harmony words vaine breath truth breath words paine muſt liſten'd youth eaſe haue taught gloſe mens ends markt liues sun muſicke cloſe laſt taſte laſt writ remembrance things long paſt though richard liues counſell would heare deaths tale may yet vndeafe eare yor flatt'ring praiſes laſc ious meeters▪ whoſe venom open eare youth doth alwayes liſten report faſhions proud italy whoſe manners tardie apiſh nation limpes baſe imitation doth world thruſt forth vanity new there's reſpect vile quickly buz'd eares late comes counſell heard doth mutiny wits regard direct whoſe way himſelfe chooſe tis breath lackſt breath wilt looſe gaunt thinkes prophet new inſpir'd thus expiring foretell raſh fierce blaze ryot cannot laſt violent fires burne themſelues small laſt long tyres betimes faſt betimes eager feeding food doth choake feeder light vanity inſatiate cormorant conſuming meanes preyes vpon royall throne kings iſle earth maieſty mars eden demy paradiſe fortreſſe built nature againſt infection hand warre happy breed men little world precious office wall moate defenſiue houſe againſt enuy leſſe happier lands bleſſed plot earth realme england nurſe teeming wombe royall kings fear'd breed famous birth renowned deeds farre home chriſtian true chiualrie iury worlds ranſome bleſſed maries sonne land deere deere-deere land deere reputation world leas'd dye pronouncing like tenement pelting farme england bound triumphant whoſe rocky beates backe enuious watery neptune bound inky blottes rotten parchment bonds england wont conquer others hath made conqueſt ah would vaniſh life happy enſuing death enter king queene aumerle buſhy greene bagot ros willoughby yor king come deale mildly youth young hot colts rag'd rage qu fares noble vncle lancaſter ri comfort man iſt aged gaunt ga oh name befits compoſition old gaunt indeed gaunt old within greefe hath kept tedious faſt abſtaynes meate gaunt england long time haue watcht watching breeds leanneſſe leanneſſe gaunt pleaſure fathers feede vpon faſt meane childrens lookes therein faſting haſt made gaunt gaunt graue lay armes power prouided baniſhment repeal'd lands reſtor'd againe freely graunted ile vſe th' aduantage power lay summers duſt blood rayn'd wounds engliſhmen farre mind bullingbrooke crimſon tempeſt bedrench freſh greene lap faire king richards land dutie tenderly goe much march vpon graſſie carpet plaine let's march without noyſe threatning drum caſtles tatter'd battlements faire appointments appeach villaine dut matter yorke peace fooliſh woman dut peace matter sonne aum good mother content poore life muſt anſwer dut life anſwer enter seruant boots yor bring boots vnto king dut strike aumerle poore boy yu art amaz'd hence villaine neuer come yor giue boots dut yorke wilt wilt hide treſpaſſe thine owne haue sonnes like haue teeming date drunke vp time wilt plucke faire sonne mine away fond woman hee twenty times son would appeach dut hadſt groan'd haue done wouldeſt pittifull know minde do'ſt haue bene diſloyall bed baſtard sonne sweet yorke husband minde like man may bee like kin yet loue yorke make way vnruly woman exit dut aumerle mount vpon horſe spurre poſt get king begge pardon ere accuſe ile long behind though old doubt ride faſt yorke neuer riſe vp ground till bullingbrooke haue pardon'd away gone exit scoena tertia enter bullingbrooke percie lords bul man tell vnthriftie sonne full three monthes laſt plague hang ouer vs would heauen lords might found enquire london tauernes dayly doth frequent vnreſtrained looſe companions euen narrow lanes rob watch beate paſſengers yong wanton effeminate boy takes point honor diſſolute crew per lord two dayes prince told theſe triumphes held oxford bul gallant per anſwer would vnto stewes common'ſt creature plucke gloue weare fauour would vnhorſe luſtieſt challenger bul diſſolute deſp'rate yet better hope elder dayes may happily bring forth comes heere enter aumerle aum king bul meanes coſin hee lookes wildely aum god grace beſeech maieſty haue conference grace alone bul withdraw leaue vs alone matter coſin aum euer may knees grow earth tongue cleaue roofe within mouth vnleſſe pardon ere riſe bul intended committed fault firſt heynous ere bee win loue pardon aum giue leaue may turne key man enter till tale done bul haue deſire yorke within yor liege beware looke haſt traitor preſence bul villaine ile make aum stay reuengefull hand haſt cauſe feare yorke open doore foole-hardy king shall loue treaſon face open doore breake open enter yorke bul matter vnkle recouer breath tell vs neere danger may arme vs encounter yor peruſe writing heere know reaſon haſte forbids aum remember read'ſt promiſe paſt repent reade name heart confederate hand yor villaine ere hand downe tore traitors boſome king feare loue begets penitence forget pitty leaſt pitty proue serpent heart bul oh heinous bold conſpiracie loyall father treacherous sonne immaculate fountaine whence muddy paſſages hath current defil'd himſelfe ouerflow good conuerts bad abundant goodneſſe excuſe deadly blot digreſſing yorke vertue vices bawd mine honour shame thriftleſſe sonnes fathers gold mine honor liues diſhonor dies life diſhonor lies kill'ſt life giuing breath traitor liues true man's put death dutcheſſe within dut hoa liege heauens let bul suppliant makes eager cry dut woman thine aunt great king speake pitty open dore begger begs neuer begg'd bul scene alter'd thing chang'd begger king dangerous coſin let mother know come pray foule yorke pardon whoſoeuer pray forgiueneſſe proſper may feſter'd ioynt cut reſt reſts let alone reſt confound enter dutcheſſe dut king beleeue hard-hearted man loue louing none yor franticke woman doſt yu make shall old dugges traitor reare dut sweet yorke patient heare gentle liege bul riſe vp good aunt dut yet beſeech euer kneele vpon knees neuer day happy till giue ioy vntill bid ioy pardoning rutland tranſgreſſing boy aum vnto mothers prayres bend knee yorke againſt true ioynts bended dut pleades earneſt looke vpon face eyes drop teares prayres ieſt words come mouth breſt prayes faintly would denide pray heart beſide weary ioynts would gladly riſe know knees kneele till ground grow prayers full falſe hypocriſie true zeale deepe integritie prayers out-pray heere's mappe shall wee diuide right according three-fold order-ta'ne mort arch-deacon hath diuided three limits equally england trent seuerne hitherto south eaſt part aſſign'd weſtward wales beyond ten thouſand men muſt bide touch sir shrewsbury truly giuen vnderſtand king mightie quick-rayſed power meetes lord harry feare sir michell northumberland whoſe power firſt proportion owen glendowers abſence thence rated firmely comes ouer-rul'd prophecies feare power percy weake wage inſtant tryall king sir mich good lord need feare dowglas lord mortimer arch mortimer sir mich mordake vernon lord king loſers let nothing foule thoſe win trumpet enter worceſter king lord worſter well meet vpon tearmes meet haue deceiu'd truſt made vs doffe eaſie robes peace cruſh old limbes vngentle steele well lord well againe vnknit churliſh knot all-abhorred warre moue obedient orbe againe giue faire naturall light exhall'd meteor prodigie feare portent broached miſcheefe vnborne times wor heare liege mine owne part could well content entertaine lagge-end life quiet houres proteſt haue day diſlike king haue comes fal rebellion lay way found prin peace chewet peace wor pleas'd maieſty turne lookes fauour selfe houſe yet muſt remember lord firſt deareſt friends office breake richards time poaſted day night meete way kiſſe hand yet place account nothing fortunate selfe brother sonne brought home fairely wonne came till dignifie times since caeſars fortunes deriu'd saw field came shrewsbury bar one came frō thence gentleman well bred good name freely render'd theſe newes true heere comes percies dead confeſſion thine eye head hold'ſt feare sinne truth tongue offends reports death doth doth belye dead dead aliue yet firſt bringer vnwelcome newes hath looſing office tongue sounds euer bell remembred knolling departing friend bar cannot thinke lord dead mor force beleeue would heauen theſe mine eyes bloody rend'ring faint quittance wearied out-breath'd henrie monmouth whoſe wrath beate downe neuer-daunted percie earth whence life neuer vp death whoſe lent fire euen dulleſt peazant campe bruited tooke fire heate away beſt temper'd courage troopes▪ mettle party abated reſt turn'd themſelues like dull heauy lead thing that's heauy vpon enforcement flyes greateſt men heauy hotſpurres loſſe lend weight lightneſſe feare arrowes fled toward ayme soldiers ayming fly field noble worceſter ta'ne priſoner furious scot bloody dowglas whoſe well-labouring three times th' appearance king gan vaile grace thoſe turn'd backes flight stumbling feare tooke king hath wonne hath power encounter lord vnder conduct yong lancaſter weſtmerland newes full north haue time enough mourne poyſon phyſicke newes hauing beene well would haue made haue meaſure made well wretch whoſe feauer-weakned ioynts▪ like hindges buckle vnder life impatient fit breakes like fire keepers armes euen limbes weak'ned greefe inrag'd greefe thrice themſelues hence therefore nice crutch gauntlet ioynts steele muſt gloue hand hence quoife art guard wanton head princes fleſh'd conqueſt ayme hit binde browes iron approach ragged'ſt houre time spight dare bring frowne vpon th' enrag'd northumberland let heauen kiſſe earth let natures hand keepe wilde flood confin'd let order dye let world longer feede contention ling'ring act let one firſt-borne caine reigne boſomes heart bloody courſes rude scene may end darkneſſe burier dead bar sweet earle diuorce wiſedom honor mor liues louing complices leane-on health giue o're paſſion muſt perforce decay caſt th' euent warre noble lord accompt chance let vs make head preſurmize dole blowes son might drop knew walk'd o're perils edge likely fall get o're aduis'd fleſh capeable wounds scarres forward spirit would lift moſt trade danger rang'd yet go forth none though apprehended could reſtraine action hath befalne hath bold enterprize bring forth like bar engaged loſſe knew ventur'd dangerous seas wrought life ten one yet rebellion froze vp fiſh pond biſhop turnes inſurrection religion suppos'd holy thoughts he's follow'd body minde doth enlarge riſing blood faire king richard pomfret deriues heauen quarrell cauſe tels doth beſtride bleeding land gaſping life vnder great bullingbrooke leſſe flocke follow north knew truth preſent greefe wip'd minde go councell euery man apteſt way reuenge get poſts letters make friends neuer neuer yet need exeunt scena tertia enter falſtaffe page fal sirra giant doct water pag water good healthy water party ow'd might haue diſeaſes knew fal men take pride gird mee braine fooliſh compounded clay-man able inuent thing tends laughter inuent inuented onely witty cauſe wit men doe heere walke like sow hath o'rewhelm'd litter one prince put seruice reaſon mee haue iudgement horſon mandrake art fitter worne cap wait heeles neuer mann'd agot till neyther gold siluer vilde apparell backe againe maſter iewell iuuenall prince maſter whoſe chin yet fledg'd haue beard grow palme hand get one cheeke yet face face-royall heauen may finiſh haire amiſſe yet may keepe face-royall barber neuer earne pence yet crowing writ man euer father batchellour may keepe owne grace almoſt mine aſſure dombledon satten cloake slops pag procure better aſſurance bardolfe wold take bond lik'd security fal let bee damn'd like glutton may tongue hotter horſon achitophel raſcally-yea-forſooth-knaue beare gentleman hand vpon security horſon doe weare nothing high bunches keyes girdles man honeſt taking-vp muſt vpon securitie liefe would put rats-bane mouth offer security look'd hee haue two twenty yards satten true knight security well may security hath horne abundance lightneſſe wife yet cannot though haue owne lanthorne light where's bardolfe pag he's gone smithfield buy worſhip horſe fal bought paules hee'l buy mee horſe smithfield could get mee wife stewes mann'd hors'd wiu'd enter chiefe iuſtice seruant pag sir heere comes nobleman committed prince bardolfe fal wait cloſe ch iuſt what's goes ser falſtaffe and't pleaſe lordſhip iuſt queſtion robbery ser lord hath done good shrewsbury heare going charge lord iohn lancaſter iust yorke call backe againe ser sir iohn falſtaffe fal boy tell deafe pag muſt lowder maſter deafe iuſt hearing thing good go plucke elbow muſt ser sir iohn fal yong knaue beg wars imployment doth lack rebels want soldiers though one worſe begge worſt worſe name rebellion tell make ser miſtake sir fal honeſt man setting knight-hood souldierſhip aſide lyed throat ser pray sir knighthood souldier-ſhip aſide giue mee leaue tell lye throat honeſt man fal giue leaue tell lay a-ſide growes get'ſt leaue hang tak'ſt leaue wer't better hang'd hunt-counter hence auant ser sir lord would iuſt sir iohn falſtaffe word fal good lord giue lordſhip good time day glad lordſhip abroad heard lordſhip hope lordſhip goes abroad aduiſe lordſhip though clean paſt youth hath yet age relliſh time moſt humbly beſeech lordſhip haue reuerend care health iuſt sir iohn expedition shrewsburie fal pleaſe lordſhip heare maieſtie return'd diſcomfort wales iuſt talke maieſty would come fal heare moreouer highneſſe falne whorſon apoplexie iuſt well heauen mend pray let fal apoplexie take kind lethargie blood horſon tingling iuſt tell fal hath originall much greefe perturbation braine haue read cauſe effects galen kinde deafeneſſe iuſt thinke falne diſeaſe heare fal well lord well rather an't pleaſe diſeaſe liſtning malady marking troubled withall iuſt puniſh heeles would amend attention eares care phyſitian fal lawes land-ſeruice come iuſt wel truth iohn liue great infamy fal buckles belt cānot liue leſſe iuſt meanes waſt great fal would otherwiſe would meanes greater waſte iuſt haue miſled youthfull prince whores ruffe bawdy-houſe hee captaine hang rogue hee liues vpon mouldie dry'de cakes captaine theſe villaines make word captaine odious therefore captaines neede looke bard goe downe good ancient falſt hearke hither miſtris dol pist tell corporall bardolph could teare ile reueng'd page goe downe piſt ile damn'd firſt pluto's damn'd lake infernall deepe erebus tortures vilde alſo hold hooke line downe downe dogges downe fates haue wee hiren hoſt good captaine peeſel quiet late beſeeke aggrauate choler piſt theſe good humors indeede shall pack-horſes hollow-pamper'd iades aſia cannot goe thirtie miles day compare caeſar caniballs troian greekes nay rather damne king cerberus let welkin roare wee fall foule toyes hoſt troth captaine theſe bitter words bard gone good ancient grow brawle anon piſt die men like dogges giue crownes like pinnes haue hiren hoſt word captaine there's none good-yere doe thinke would denye pray quiet pist feed fat faire calipolis come giue sack si fortune tormente contente feare wee broad-ſides let fiend giue fire giue sack sweet-heart lye come wee full points et cetera's nothing fal pistol would quiet pist sweet knight kiſſe neaffe wee haue starres dol thruſt downe cannot endure fuſtian raſcall piſt thruſt downe know galloway nagges fal quoit downe bardolph like nay hee doe nothing nothing hee nothing bard come get downe piſt wee haue inciſion wee embrew death rocke aſleepe abridge dolefull dayes let grieuous gaſtly gaping wounds vntwin'd siſters three come atropos host here's good toward fal giue rapier boy dol prethee iack prethee doe draw fal get downe hoſt here's goodly tumult ile forſweare keeping houſe ile theſe tirrits frights murther warrant alas alas put vp naked weapons put vp naked weapons dol prethee iack quiet raſcall gone ah whorſon little valiant villaine host hurt i' th' groyne thought hee made thruſt belly fal haue turn'd doores bard yes sir raſcall's drunke haue hurt sir fal raſcall braue dol ah little rogue alas poore ape come let wipe face come whorſon chops ah rogue loue art valorous hector troy worth fiue agamemnon tenne times better nine worthies ah villaine fal raſcally slaue toſſe rogue blanket dol doe dar'ſt heart doo'ſt ile canuas betweene paire sheetes enter muſique page muſique come sir fal let play play sirs sit knee dol raſcall bragging slaue rogue fled like quick-ſiluer dol followd'ſt tokens home reſtored loue amitie biſh take princely word theſe redreſſes iohn giue maintaine word thereupon drinke vnto grace haſt goe captaine deliuer armie newes peace let haue pay part know well pleaſe high captaine exit biſh you▪ noble lord weſtmerland west pledge grace knew paines haue beſtow'd breede preſent peace would drinke freely loue ye shall openly hereafter biſh doe doubt weſt glad health lord gentle couſin mowbray mow wiſh health happy ill biſh againſt ill chances men euer merry heauineſſe fore-runnes good euent weſt therefore merry cooze serues thus good thing comes morrow biſh beleeue paſſing light mow much worſe owne rule true iohn word peace render'd hearke mow chearefull victorie biſh peace nature conqueſt parties nobly neither partie looſer iohn goe lord let army diſcharged good lord pleaſe let traines march vs wee may peruſe men exit wee haue coap'd withall biſh goe good lord haſtings ere diſmiſs'd let march exit iohn truſt lords wee lye night together enter weſtmerland couſin wherefore army west leaders hauing charge goe vntill heare iohn know duties enter haſtings haſt army diſpers'd like youthfull steeres vnyoak'd tooke courſe eaſt weſt north south come piſtoll vtter mee withall deuiſe good boote boote maſter shallow know young king mee let vs take mans horſfes lawes england command'ment happie haue beene friendes woe vnto lord chiefe iuſtice piſt let vultures vil'de lungs alſo life late led heere welcome thoſe pleaſant dayes exeunt scena quarta enter hoſteſſe quickly dol teare-ſheete beadles hoſteſſe arrant knaue would might dy might haue hang'd haſt drawne ioynt conſtables haue deliuer'd ouer mee haue whipping cheere enough warrant hath beene man two lately kill'd dol nut-hooke nut-hooke lye come ile tell damn'd tripe-viſag'd raſcall childe go miſcarrie had'ſt better had'ſt mother paper-fac'd villaine hoſt sir iohn come hee would make bloody day body would fruite wombe might miſcarry officer haue dozen cuſhions againe haue eleuen come charge go man dead piſtoll beate among dol ile tell thin man cenſor haue blew-bottel'd rogue filthy famiſh'd correctioner ile forſweare halfe kirtles come come come hoſt right thus o'recome might wel comes eaſe dol come rogue come bring iuſtice hoſt yes come blood-hound dol goodman death goodman bones hoſt anatomy dol come thinne thing come raſcall well exeunt scena quinta enter two groomes groo ruſhes ruſhes groo trumpets haue twice groo two clocke ere come coronation exit groo enter falſtaffe shallow piſtoll bardolfe page falſtaffe stand heere robert shallow make king grace leere vpon inferre zeale shal doth falſt earneſtneſſe affection piſt doth fal deuotion piſt doth doth doth fal ride day night deliberate remember haue patience shal moſt certaine fal trauaile deſire thinking nothing elſe putting affayres obliuion nothing els bee done piſt idem obſque hoc nihil est euery part shal indeed piſt knight enflame noble liuer make rage dol helen noble thoghts baſe durance graue doth gape thrice wider men reply foole-borne ieſt preſume thing heauen doth know world perceiue haue turn'd away former selfe thoſe kept companie doſt heare haue bin approach was't tutor feeder name eſpouſe haue hold quondam quickely onely pauca there's enough go enter boy boy mine hoaſt piſtoll muſt come mayſter hoſteſſe would bed good bardolfe put face betweene office warming-pan faith brotherhood ile liue nymme nymme liue iuſt surler vnto campe profits accrue giue mee hand nym haue noble piſt caſh moſt iuſtly payd nym well humor of't enter hoſteſſe hoſt euer come women come quickly iohn poore heart hee burning quotidian tertian moſt lamentable behold sweet men come nym king hath run bad humors knight that's euen piſt nym haſt right heart fracted corroborate nym king good king muſt bee may paſſes humors carreeres piſt let vs condole knight lambekins liue enter exeter bedford weſtmerland bed fore god grace bold truſt theſe traitors exe apprehended weſt euen bear themſelues treachery sound trumpets enter king scroope cambridge gray king winde fane aboord lord cambridge kinde lord maſham gentle knight giue thoughts thinke powres beare vs cut paſſage force france execution acte haue head aſſembled scro doubt liege man beſt king doubt well perſwaded carry heart vs hence growes faire conſent leaue one behinde doth wiſh succeſſe conqueſt attend vs cam neuer monarch better fear'd lou'd maieſty there's thinke heart-greefe vneaſineſſe vnder gouernment kni true thoſe fathers enemies haue gauls hony hearts create duty zeale king therefore haue great cauſe thankfulnes forget office hand sooner quittance deſert merit according weight worthineſſe scro toyle labour refreſh hope grace inceſtant king iudge leſſe vnkle exeter inlarge man committed yeſterday ayl'd againſt perſon conſider exceſſe wine aduice pardon scro that's mercy much let puniſh'd soueraigne leaſt example breed kind king let vs yet mercifull cam may highneſſe yet puniſh grey sir great mercy giue life taſte much correction king alas much loue care heauy oriſons poore wretch little faults proceeding diſtemper shall wink'd eye capitall crimes chew'd digeſted appeare vs wee'l yet inlarge man though cambridge scroope gray deere care tender preſeruation perſon wold haue puniſh'd▪ french cauſes late commiſſioners cam one lord highneſſe bad aske day scro liege gray royall soueraigne king richard earle cambridge lord scroope maſham sir knight gray northumberland reade know know worthineſſe lord weſtmerland vnkle exeter aboord night gentlemen thoſe papers looſe much complexion looke ye change cheekes paper reade haue cowarded chac'd blood apparance cam confeſſe fault highneſſe mercy gray scro appeale king mercy quicke vs late owne counſaile kill'd muſt dare talke mercy owne reaſons turne boſomes dogs vpon maiſters worrying see princes noble peeres theſe engliſh monſters lord cambridge heere know apt loue accord furniſh appertinents belonging honour man hath light crownes lightly callice without impeachment though wiſdome confeſſe much vnto enemie craft vantage people much enfeebled numbers leſſen'd thoſe haue almoſt better many french health tell herald thought vpon one payre engliſh legges march three frenchmen yet forgiue god doe bragge thus ayre france hath blowne vice muſt repent goe therefore tell maſter heere ranſome frayle worthleſſe trunke army weake guard yet god tell come though france himſelfe another neighbor stand way there's labour mountioy goe bid maſter well aduiſe himſelfe may paſſe hindred tawnie ground red blood diſcolour mountioy fare well anſwer liberie le franchiſement fre sur mes genoux vous donnes milles remercious et ie eſtime heurex que ie intombe entre les main d'vn cheualier ie peuſe le plus brane valiant et tres diſtinie d' anglererre fighting helmet blood exe array braue soldier doth lye larding plaine bloody yoake-fellow honour-owing-wounds noble earle suffolke alſo lyes suffolke firſt dyed yorke hagled ouer comes gore lay inſteeped takes beard kiſſes gaſhes bloodily yawne vpon face cryes aloud tarry coſin suffolke thine keepe company heauen tarry mine flye a-breſt glorious well-foughten field kept together chiualrie vpon theſe words came cheer'd vp face raught hand feeble gripe deere lord commend soueraigne turne ouer suffolkes necke threw wounded arme kiſt lippes eſpous'd death blood teſtament noble-ending-loue protector lookeſt command prince realme wife prowd holdeth awe god religious church-men may gloſt name religion lou'ſt fleſh ne're throughout yeere church go'ſt except pray againſt foes bed ceaſe ceaſe theſe iarres reſt minds peace let's altar heralds wayt vs gold wee'le offer vp armes since armes auayle henry's dead poſteritie await wretched yeeres mothers moiſtned eyes babes ile made nouriſh teares none women left wayle dead henry fift ghoſt inuocate proſper realme keepe ciuill broyles combat aduerſe planets heauens farre glorious starre soule make iulius caeſar bright— enter meſſenger meſſ honourable lords health sad tidings bring france loſſe diſcomfiture guyen champaigne rheimes orleance paris guyſors poictiers quite loſt bedf man dead henry's coarſe speake loſſe thoſe great townes make burſt lead riſe death glost paris loſt roan yeelded vp henry recall'd life againe theſe news would cauſe yeeld ghoſt exe loſt trecherie vs'd meſſ trecherie want men money amongſt souldiers muttered maintaine factions whil'ſt field diſpatcht fought diſputing generals one would haue lingring warres little coſt another would flye wanteth wings third thinkes without expence guilefull faire words peace may obtayn'd awake awake engliſh nobilitie let dimme honors new begot cropt flower-de-luces armes englands coat one halfe cut away exe teares wanting funerall theſe tidings would call wherein lord talbot o'rethrown circumſtance ile tell large tenth auguſt laſt dreadfull lord retyring siege orleance hauing full thouſand troupe three twentie thouſand french round incompaſſed vpon iohn falſtaffe play'd coward vauward plac't behinde purpoſe relieue follow cowardly fled hauing one hence grew generall wrack maſſacre encloſed enemies baſe wallon win dolphins grace thruſt talbot lord hungerfor moſt reſt tooke likewiſe bedf ranſome none pay ile hale dolphin headlong throne crowne ranſome friend foure lords ile change one farwell maſters taske bonfires france forthwith make dyeted like mules haue prouender ty'd mouthes pitteous looke like drowned mice reigneir let's rayſe siege liue idly talbot taken wont feare remayneth none mad-brayn'd salisbury may well fretting gall hereafter ages may behold ruine happened reuenge within chiefeſt temple ile erect tombe wherein corps interr'd vpon which▪ euery one may reade shall engrau'd orleance trecherous manner mournefull troupes armed men leape o're walls refuge field burg farre could well diſcerne duskie vapours night dolphin trull arme arme came running like payre louing turtle-doues could liue aſunder day night modeſtie admiring renowne entreats great lord would'ſt vouchſafe viſit poore caſtle lyes may boaſt hath beheld man whoſe glory fills world lowd report burg euen nay warres turne vnto peacefull comick ladyes craue encountred may lord deſpiſe gentle talb ne're truſt world men could preuayle oratorie yet hath womans kindneſſe ouer-rul'd therefore tell returne great thankes attend honors beare company bedf truly manners haue heard vnbidden gueſts often welcommeſt gone talb well alone there's remedie meane proue ladyes courteſie come hither captaine perceiue minde whiſpers capt doe lord meane alas child dwarfe cannot weake writhled terror enemies talb madame haue beene bold trouble ladyſhip leyſure ile time viſit count meanes goe aske whither goes meſſ stay lord talbot lady craues know picture hangs endure like chayne theſe legges armes thine haſt tyrannie theſe many yeeres waſted countrey citizens sonnes husbands captiuate talb ha ha ha count laugheſt wretch mirth turne moane talb laugh ladyſhip fond thinke haue ought talbots whereon practiſe count art man talb indeede count haue talb deceiu'd part leaſt proportion humanitie tell madame whole frame loftie pitch roofe contayn't count riddling merchant nonce yet theſe contrarieties agree talb preſently winds horne drummes vp peale ordenance enter souldiors madame perſwaded talbot himſelfe theſe armes yoaketh rebellious neckes razeth cities townes moment makes deſolate count victorious talbot pardon abuſe finde art leſſe fame hath bruited may gathered let preſumption prouoke wrath reuerence entertaine art talb diſmay'd faire lady miſconſter minde talbot miſtake outward compoſition body haue done hath offended doe craue onely patience may taſte wine cates haue souldiers alwayes well count heart thinke honored feaſt great warrior houſe exeunt enter richard plantagenet warwick somerſet poole others yorke great lords gentlemen meanes dare man anſwer caſe truth suff within temple hall lowd garden conuenient york maintain'd truth elſe wrangling somerſet th' error suff faith haue beene traunt law neuer yet could frame therefore frame law vnto som iudge lord warwicke betweene vs war two hawks flyes higher pitch two dogs hath deeper mouth two blades beares better temper two horſes doth beare beſt two girles hath merryeſt eye haue perhaps judgement theſe nice quillets law good faith wiſer daw york tut tut mannerly forbearance truth appeares naked purblind eye may find som well apparrell'd cleare euident glimmer blind-mans eye york since tongue-ty'd loth dumbe proclayme thoughts let true-borne gentleman vpon honor birth haue pleaded truth bryer pluck white roſe som let coward flatterer dare maintaine partie truth pluck red roſe thorne war loue colours without colour baſe inſinuating flatterie pluck white roſe plantagenet suff pluck red roſe young somerſet withall thinke held right vernon stay lords gentlemen pluck till conclude vpon whoſe feweſt roſes cropt tree shall yeeld right opinion som good maſter vernon well obiected haue feweſt york vernon truth plainneſſe caſe pluck pale maiden bloſſome giuing verdict white roſe som prick finger pluck leaſt bleeding doe paint white roſe red fall againſt vernon lord opinion bleed opinion surgeon hurt keepe som well well come elſe lawyer vnleſſe studie bookes falſe argument held wrong whereof pluck white roſe yorke somerſet argument som scabbard meditating shall dye white roſe bloody red yorke meane time cheeks counterfeit roſes pale looke feare witneſſing truth som plantagenet anger cheekes bluſh pure counterfeit roſes yet tongue confeſſe error yorke hath roſe canker somerſet som hath roſe thorne plantagenet yorke piercing maintaine truth whiles conſuming canker eates falſehood som well ile find friends weare bleeding roſes maintaine haue true falſe plantagenet dare yorke maiden bloſſome hand faſhion peeuiſh boy suff turne way plantagenet york prowd poole suff ile turne part thereof throat som away away good william de la poole grace yeoman conuerſing warw gods wrong'ſt somerſet grandfather lyonel duke clarence third sonne third edward king england spring creſtleſſe yeomen deepe root yorke beares place's priuiledge durſt crauen heart thus som made ile maintaine words plot ground chriſtendome father richard earle cambridge treaſon executed late kings dayes treaſon attainted corrupted exempt ancient gentry treſpas yet liues guiltie blood till reſtor'd art yeoman yorke father attached attainted condemn'd dye treaſon traytor ile proue better men somerſet growing time ripened partaker poole ile note booke memorie apprehenſion looke well well warn'd som ah finde vs ready know vs theſe colours foes theſe friends weare yorke soule pale angry roſe cognizance blood-drinking hate euer faction weare vntill wither graue flouriſh height degree suff goe forward choak'd ambition farwell vntill meet next exit som haue poole farwell ambitious richard exit yorke brau'd muſt perforce endure warw blot obiect againſt houſe shall whipt next parliament call'd truce wincheſter glouceſter created yorke liue accounted warwicke meane time loue againſt prowd somerſet william poole vpon partie weare roſe prophecie brawle day growne faction temple garden shall betweene red-roſe white thouſand soules death deadly night yorke good maſter bound behalfe would pluck flower ver behalfe weare lawyer yorke thankes gentle come let vs foure dinner dare quarrell drinke blood another day exeunt enter mortimer brought chayre iaylors mort kind keepers weake decaying age let dying mortimer reſt himſelfe euen like man new haled wrack fare limbes long impriſonment theſe gray locks purſuiuants death neſtor-like aged age care argue end edmund mortimer theſe eyes like lampes whoſe waſting oyle waxe dimme drawing exigent weake shoulders ouer-borne burthening griefe pyth-leſſe armes like withered vine droupes branches ground yet theſe feet whoſe numme vnable lumpe clay swift-winged deſire get graue witting comfort haue tell keeper nephew come keeper richard plantagenet lord come vnto temple vnto chamber anſwer return'd come mort enough soule poore gentleman wrong doth equall mine since henry monmouth firſt began reigne whoſe glory great armes loathſome haue euen hath richard beene obſcur'd depriu'd honor inheritance arbitrator deſpaires iuſt death kinde vmpire mens miſeries enlargement doth diſmiſſe hence would troubles likewiſe expir'd might recouer loſt enter richard keeper lord louing nephew come mor richard plantagenet friend come rich noble vnckle thus ignobly vs'd nephew late deſpiſed richard comes mort direct mine armes may embrace neck boſome latter gaſpe oh tell lippes doe touch cheekes may kindly giue one fainting kiſſe declare stem yorkes great stock didſt late wert deſpis'd rich firſt leane thine aged back againſt mine arme eaſe ile tell diſeaſe day argument vpon caſe words grew somerſet among tearmes vs'd lauiſh tongue vpbrayd fathers death obloquie barres tongue elſe like requited therefore good vnckle fathers honor true plantagenet alliance declare cauſe father earle cambridge loſt head mort cauſe faire nephew impriſon'd hath detayn'd flowring youth within loathſome dungeon pyne curſed inſtrument deceaſe rich diſcouer large cauſe ignorant cannot gueſſe mort fading breath permit death approach ere tale done henry fourth grandfather king depos'd nephew richard edwards sonne firſt begotten lawfull heire edward king third deſcent whoſe reigne percies north finding vſurpation moſt vniuſt endeuour'd aduancement throne reaſon mou'd theſe warlike lords young richard thus remou'd leauing heire begotten body next birth parentage mother deriued lionel duke clarence third sonne king edward third whereas hee iohn gaunt doth bring pedigree fourth heroick lyne marke haughtie great attempt laboured plant rightfull heire loſt libertie liues long henry fift succeeding father bullingbrooke reigne father earle cambridge deriu'd famous edmund langley duke yorke marrying siſter mother againe pitty hard diſtreſſe leuied army weening redeeme haue inſtall'd diademe reſt fell noble earle beheaded thus mortimers title reſted rich lord honor laſt mort true iſſue haue fainting words doe warrant death art heire reſt wiſh gather yet wary care rich graue admoniſhments preuayle yet thinkes fathers execution nothing leſſe bloody tyranny mort nephew pollitick strong fixed houſe lancaſter like mountaine remou'd vnckle remouing hence princes doe courts cloy'd long continuance place rich vnckle would part young yeeres might redeeme paſſage age mort do'ſt wrong yt doth giueth many wounds one kill mourne except good onely giue order funerall farewell faire hopes proſperous life peace warre dyes rich peace warre befall parting soule priſon haſt pilgrimage like hermite ouer-paſt dayes well locke councell breſt doe imagine let reſt keepers conuey hence buryall better life exit dyes duskie torch mortimer choakt ambition meaner thoſe wrongs thoſe bitter iniuries somerſet hath offer'd houſe doubt honor redreſſe therefore haſte parliament eyther reſtored blood make th' aduantage good exit actus tertius scena prima flouriſh enter king exeter gloſter wincheſter warwick somerſet suffolk richard plantagenet gloſter offers put vp bill wincheſter teares winch com'ſt deepe premeditated lines written pamphlets deuis'd humfrey gloſter canſt accuſe ought intend'ſt lay vnto charge doe without inuention extemporall purpoſe anſwer canſt obiect glo preſumptuous prieſt place cōmands patiēce finde haſt dis-honor'd thinke although writing preferr'd manner vile outragious crymes therefore haue forg'd able rehearſe methode penne prelate audacious wickedneſſe lewd peſtiſerous diſſentious prancks infants prattle pride art moſt pernitious vſurer froward nature enemie peace laſciuious wanton well beſeemes man profeſſion degree trecherie what's manifeſt layd'ſt trap take life well london bridge tower beſide feare thoughts king soueraigne quite exempt enuious mallice heart winch gloſter doe defie lords vouchſafe giue hearing reply couetous ambitious peruerſe haue poore haps aduance rayſe keepe wonted calling diſſention preferreth peace doe except prouok'd good lords offends hath incens'd duke becauſe one hee one hee king engenders thunder breaſt makes rore theſe accuſations forth know good glost good baſtard grandfather winch lordly sir pray one imperious anothers throne gloſt protector prieſt winch prelate church glost yes out-law caſtle keepes vſeth patronage theft winch vnreuerent gloceſter gloſt art reuerent touching spirituall function life winch rome remedie warw roame thither lord dutie forbeare som biſhop ouer-borne thinkes lord religious know office belongs warw thinkes lordſhip humbler fitteth prelate plead som yes holy state toucht neere warw state holy vnhallow'd grace protector king rich plantagenet muſt hold tongue leaſt speake sirrha muſt bold verdict enter talke lords elſe would haue fling wincheſter king vnckles gloſter wincheſter watch-men engliſh weale would preuayle prayers might preuayle ioyne hearts loue amitie oh scandall crowne two noble peeres ye iarre beleeue lords tender yeeres tell ciuill diſſention viperous worme gnawes bowels common-wealth noyſe within downe tawny-coats king tumult's warw vprore dare warrant begun malice biſhops men noyſe againe stones stones enter maior maior oh good lords vertuous henry pitty citie london pitty vs biſhop duke gloſters men forbidden late carry weapon haue fill'd pockets full peeble banding themſelues contrary parts doe pelt faſt one anothers pate many haue giddy braynes knockt windowes broke downe euery street feare compell'd shops enter skirmiſh bloody pates king charge allegeance hold hands keepe peace pray' vnckle gloſter mittigate seruing nay forbidden stones wee'le fall teeth seruing doe ye dare reſolute skirmiſh againe gloſt houſehold leaue peeuiſh broyle vnaccuſtom'd fight aſide seru lord know grace man iuſt vpright royall birth inferior none maieſtie ere prince kinde father common-weale diſgraced inke-horne mate wee wiues children fight haue bodyes foes seru parings nayles shall pitch field dead begin againe gloſt stay loue doe let perſwade forbeare king oh diſcord doth afflict soule lord wincheſter behold teares relent pittifull preferre peace holy church-men take delight broyles warw yeeld lord protector yeeld wincheſter except meane obſtinate repulſe soueraigne deſtroy realme miſchiefe murther hath beene enacted enmitie peace except ye thirſt blood winch neuer yeeld gloſt compaſſion king commands would heart ere prieſt euer get priuiledge warw behold lord wincheſter duke hath baniſht moodie diſcontented fury browes doth appeare looke tragicall gloſt wincheſter offer hand king fie vnckle beauford haue heard preach mallice great grieuous maintaine thing teach proue chiefe offendor warw sweet king biſhop hath kindly gyrd lord wincheſter relent child inſtruct doe winch well duke gloſter yeeld loue loue hand hand giue gloſt feare hollow heart see friends louing countreymen token flagge truce betwixt followers helpe god diſſemble winch helpe god intend king oh louing vnckle kinde duke gloſter ioyfull made contract away maſters trouble vs ioyne friendſhip lords haue done seru content ile surgeons seru seru phyſick tauerne affords exeunt warw accept scrowle moſt gracious soueraigne right richard plantagenet doe exhibite maieſtie glo well vrg'd lord warwick prince grace marke euery circumſtance haue great reaſon doe richard right eſpecially thoſe occaſions eltam place told maieſtie king thoſe occaſions vnckle force therefore louing lords pleaſure richard reſtored blood warw let richard reſtored blood fathers wrongs recompenc't winch reſt willeth wincheſter king richard true alone whole inheritance giue doth belong vnto houſe yorke whence lineall deſcent rich humble vowes obedience humble till point death king stoope knee againſt foot reguerdon dutie done gyrt valiant sword yorke riſe richard like true plantagenet riſe created princely duke yorke rich thriue richard foes may fall dutie periſh grudge one thought againſt maieſty welcome high prince mighty duke yorke som periſh baſe prince ignoble duke yorke gloſt beſt auaile maieſtie croſſe seas crown'd france preſence king engenders loue amongſt subiects loyall friends diſ-animates enemies king gloſter word king henry goes friendly counſaile cuts many foes gloſt ships alreadie readineſſe senet flouriſh exeunt manet exeter exet may march england france likely enſue late diſſention growne betwixt peeres burnes vnder fained aſhes forg'd loue laſt breake flame feſtred members rot degree till bones fleſh fall away baſe enuious diſcord breed feare fatall prophecie time henry nam'd fift mouth euery babe henry borne monmouth winne henry borne windſor looſe plaine exeter doth wiſh dayes may finiſh ere hapleſſe time exit scoena secunda enter pucell diſguis'd▪ foure souldiors sacks vpon backs pucell theſe citie gates gates roan pollicy muſt make breach take heed wary place words talke like vulgar market men come gather money corne haue entrance hope finde watch weake ile giue notice friends charles dolphin may encounter souldier sacks meane city lords rulers ouer roan therefore wee'le knock knock watch che la pucell peaſauns la pouure gens de fraunce poore market folkes come corne watch enter goe market bell rung pucell roan ile bulwarkes ground exeunt enter charles baſtard alanſon charles saint dennis bleſſe happy stratageme againe wee'le roan baſtard entred pucell practiſants beſt paſſage reig thruſting torch yonder tower diſcern'd meaning way weakneſſe entred enter pucell top thruſting torch burning pucell behold happy wedding torch ioyneth roan vnto countreymen burning fatall talbonites baſtard see noble charles beacon friend burning torch yonder turret charles like commet reuenge prophet fall foes reig deferre time delayes haue dangerous ends enter cry dolphin preſently doe execution watch alarum alarum talbot excurſion talb france rue treaſon teares talbot trecherie pucell witch damned sorcereſſe hath wrought helliſh miſchiefe vnawares hardly eſcap't pride france exit alarum excurſions bedford brought chayre enter talbot burgonie without within pucell charles baſtard reigneir walls pucell god morrow gallants want ye corn bread thinke duke burgonie faſt hee'le buy againe rate full darnell doe like taſte burg scoffe vile fiend curtizan truſt ere long choake thine owne make curſe harueſt corne charles grace may perhaps time bedf oh let words deedes reuenge treaſon pucell doe good gray-beard breake launce runne a-tilt death within chayre talb foule fiend france hag deſpight incompaſs'd luſtfull paramours becomes taunt valiant age twit cowardiſe man halfe dead damſell ile haue bowt againe elſe let talbot periſh pucell ye hot sir yet pucell hold peace talbot doe thunder raine follow whiſper together counſell god parliament speaker talb dare yee come forth meet vs field pucell belike lordſhip takes vs fooles try owne talb rayling hecate vnto alanſon reſt ye like souldiors come fight alanſ seignior talb seignior hang baſe muleters france like peſant foot-boyes doe keepe walls dare take vp armes like gentlemen pucell away captaines let's get vs walls talbot meanes goodneſſe lookes god b'uy lord came tell wee exeunt walls talb ere long elſe reproach talbots greateſt fame vow burgonie honor houſe prickt publike wrongs france either get towne againe dye engliſh henry liues father conqueror late betrayed towne great cordelions heart buryed get towne dye burg vowes equall partners vowes talb ere goe regard dying prince valiant duke bedford come lord beſtow better place fitter craſie age bedf lord talbot doe diſhonour walls roan partner weale woe burg couragious bedford let vs perſwade bedf gone hence read pendragon litter came field vanquiſhed foes thinkes reuiue souldiors hearts becauſe euer found talb vndaunted dying breaſt heauens keepe old bedford adoe braue burgonie gather forces hand vpon boaſting enemie exit alarum excurſions enter sir iohn falſtaffe captaine capt whither away sir iohn falſtaffe haſte falſt whither away flight like haue ouerthrow againe capt flye leaue lord talbot falſt talbots world life exit capt cowardly knight ill fortune follow exit retreat excurſions pucell alanſon charles flye bedf quiet soule depart heauen pleaſe haue enemies ouerthrow truſt fooliſh man late daring glad faine flight themſelues bedford dyes carryed two chaire alarum enter talbot burgonie reſt talb loſt recouered day againe double honor burgonie yet heauens haue glory victorie burg warlike martiall talbot burgonie inſhrines heart erects noble deeds valors monuments talb thanks gentle duke pucel thinke old familiar aſleepe where's baſtards braues charles glikes amort roan hangs head griefe valiant company fled take order towne placing therein expert officers depart paris king young henry nobles lye burg wills lord talbot pleaſeth burgonie talb yet goe let's forget noble duke bedford late deceas'd exequies fulfill'd roan brauer souldier neuer couched launce gentler heart neuer court kings mightieſt potentates muſt die that's end humane miſerie exeunt scaena tertia enter charles baſtard alanſon pucell pucell diſmay princes accident grieue that▪ roan recouered care cure rather corroſiue things remedy'd let frantike talbot triumph like peacock along tayle wee'le pull plumes take away trayne dolphin reſt rul'd charles haue guided hitherto cunning diffidence one foyle neuer breed diſtruſt baſtard search wit pollicies make famous world alanſ wee'le statue holy place haue reuerenc't like bleſſed saint employ virgin good pucell thus muſt doth ioane deuiſe faire perſwaſions mixt words entice duke burgonie leaue talbot follow vs charles marry sweeting could doe france place henryes warriors nation boaſt vs extirped prouinces alanſ euer expuls'd france haue title earledome pucell honors perceiue worke bring matter wiſhed end drumme farre hearke drumme may perceiue powers marching vnto paris-ward engliſh march goes talbot colours troupes engliſh french march rereward comes duke fortune fauor makes lagge behinde summon parley talke trumpets parley charles parley duke burgonie burg craues parley burgonie pucell princely charles france countrey-man burg charles marching hence charles speake pucell enchaunt words pucell braue burgonie vndoubted hope france stay let humble hand-maid burg speake ouer-tedious pucell looke country look fertile france cities townes defac't waſting ruine cruell foe lookes mother lowly babe death doth cloſe tender-dying eyes see pining maladie france behold wounds moſt vnnaturall wounds haſt giuen wofull breſt oh turne edged sword another way strike thoſe hurt hurt thoſe helpe one drop blood drawne countries boſome grieue forraine gore returne therefore floud teares waſh away countries spots burg either hath bewitcht words nature makes relent pucell beſides french france exclaimes doubting birth lawfull progenie ioyn'ſt lordly nation truſt profits talbot hath footing france faſhion'd inſtrument ill engliſh henry lord thruſt like fugitiue call minde marke proofe duke orleance foe england priſoner heard thine enemie free without ranſome pay'd burgonie friends see fight'ſt againſt countreymen ioyn'ſt come come returne returne wandering lord charles reſt take armes burg vanquiſhed theſe haughtie wordes haue batt'red like roaring cannon-ſhot made almoſt yeeld vpon knees forgiue countrey countreymen lords accept heartie kind embrace forces power men farwell talbot ile longer truſt pucell done like frenchman turne turne againe charles welcome braue duke friendſhip makes vs freſh bastard doth beget new courage breaſts alanſ pucell hath brauely play'd part doth deſerue coronet gold charles let vs lords ioyne powers may preiudice foe exeunt scoena quarta enter king glouceſter wincheſter yorke suffolke somerſet warwicke exeter souldiors talbot talb gracious prince honorable peeres hearing arriuall realme haue giuen truce vnto warres doe dutie soueraigne whereof arme hath reclaym'd obedience fiftie fortreſſes twelue cities walled townes beſide fiue hundred priſoners eſteeme lets fall sword highneſſe feet loyaltie heart aſcribes glory conqueſt got firſt god next vnto grace king lord talbot vnckle glouceſter hath long beene reſident france glost yes pleaſe maieſtie liege▪ king welcome braue captaine victorious lord young yet old doe remember father champion neuer handled sword long reſolued truth faithfull toyle warre yet neuer haue taſted reward beene reguerdon'd much thanks becauſe till neuer face therefore vp theſe good deſerts create earle shrewsbury coronation take place senet flouriſh exeunt manet vernon baſſet vern sir hot sea diſgracing theſe colours weare honor noble lord yorke dar'ſt maintaine former words baſſ yes sir well dare patronage enuious barking tongue againſt lord duke somerſet sirrha lord honour baſſ good man yorke vern hearke ye witneſſe take ye strikes baſſ villaine knoweſt law armes drawes sword preſent death elſe blow broach deareſt bloud ile vnto maieſtie craue may haue libertie venge wrong ile meet coſt vern well miſcreant ile meete would exeunt actus quartus scena prima enter king gloceſter wincheſter yorke suffolke somerſet warwicke talbot gouernor exeter glo lord biſhop crowne vpon head win god king henry name glo gouernour paris take oath elect king eſteeme none friends friends none foes pretend malicious practiſes againſt state ye helpe righteous god enter falſtaffe fal gracious soueraigne rode calice haſte vnto coronation letter deliuer'd hands writ grace th' duke burgundy tal shame duke burgundy vow'd baſe knight meete next teare garter crauens legge haue done becauſe vnworthily was't inſtalled high degree pardon princely henry reſt daſtard battell poictiers thouſand french almoſt ten one met giuen like truſtie squire run away aſſault loſt twelue hundred men diuers gentlemen beſide taken priſoners iudge great lords haue done amiſſe whether cowards ought weare ornament knighthood yea glo truth fact infamous ill beſeeming common man much knight captaine leader tal firſt order ordain'd lords knights garter noble birth valiant vertuous full haughtie courage growne credit warres fearing death diſtreſſe alwayes reſolute moſt extreames furniſh'd doth vſurpe sacred name knight prophaning moſt honourable order worthy iudge quite degraded like hedge-borne swaine doth preſume boaſt gentle blood staine countrymen hear'ſt doom packing therefore was't knight henceforth baniſh paine death lord protector view letter sent vnckle duke burgundy glo meanes grace hath chaung'd stile plaine bluntly king hath forgot soueraigne doth churliſh superſcription pretend alteration good what's heere haue vpon eſpeciall cauſe mou'd compaſſion countries wracke together pittifull complaints oppreſſion feedes vpon forſaken pernitious faction ioyn'd charles rightfull king france monſtrous treachery alliance amity oathes found falſe diſſembling guile king doth vnckle burgundy reuolt glo doth lord become foe king worſt letter doth containe glo worſt lord writes king lord talbot talk giue chaſticement abuſe lord content tal content liege yes yt preuented haue begg'd might haue bene employd king gather march vnto let perceiue ill brooke treaſon offence flout friends tal go lord heart deſiring may behold confuſion foes enter vernon baſſit ver grant combate gracious soueraigne baſ lord grant combate yorke seruant heare noble prince som mine henry fauour king patient lords giue leaue say gentlemen makes thus exclaime wherefore craue combate ver lord hath done wrong baſ hath done wrong king wrong wherof complain firſt let know ile anſwer baſ croſſing sea england france fellow heere enuious carping tongue vpbraided roſe weare saying colour leaues repreſent maſters bluſhing cheekes repugne truth certaine queſtion law argu'd betwixt duke yorke vile ignominious tearmes confutation rude reproach defence lords worthineſſe craue benefit law armes petition noble lord though forged queint conceite gloſſe vpon bold intent yet know lord prouok'd firſt tooke exceptions badge pronouncing paleneſſe flower bewray'd faintneſſe maſters heart yorke malice somerſet left som priuate grudge lord york wil though ne're cunningly king good lord madneſſe rules braineſicke men friuolous cauſe factious aemulations ariſe good coſins yorke somerſet quiet pray peace yorke let diſſention firſt tried fight highneſſe command peace som quarrell toucheth none vs alone betwixt let vs decide yorke pledge accept somerſet ver nay let reſt began firſt baſſ confirme mine honourable lord glo confirme confounded periſh ye audacious prate preſumptuous vaſſals aſham'd immodeſt clamorous outrage trouble diſturbe king vs lords thinkes well beare peruerſe obiections much leſſe take occaſion mouthes raiſe mutiny betwixt let perſwade take better courſe exet greeues highneſſe good lords friends king come hither would combatants henceforth charge loue fauour quite forget quarrell cauſe lords remember france amongſt fickle wauering nation perceyue diſſention lookes within diſagree grudging prouok'd wilfull diſobedience rebell beſide infamy ariſe forraigne princes certified toy thing regard king henries peeres cheefe nobility deſtroy'd themſelues loſt realme france oh thinke vpon conqueſt father tender yeares let vs forgoe trifle bought blood let vmper doubtfull reaſon weare roſe one therefore incline somerſet yorke kinſmen loue well may vpbray'd crowne becauſe forſooth king scots crown'd diſcretions better perſwade able inſtruct teach therefore hither came peace let vs continue peace loue coſin yorke inſtitute grace regent theſe parts france good lord somerſet vnite troopes horſemen bands foote like true subiects progenitors go cheerefully together digeſt angry choller enemies selfe lord protector reſt reſpit returne calice thence england hope ere long preſented victories charles alanſon traiterous rout exeunt manet yorke warwick exeter vernon war lord yorke promiſe king prettily thought play orator yorke yet like weares badge somerſet war tuſh fancie blame dare preſume prince thought harme york wiſh let reſt affayres muſt managed exeunt flouriſh manet exeter exet well didſt richard voice paſſions heart burſt feare haue decipher'd rancorous furious raging broyles yet imagin'd howſoere man iarring diſcord nobilitie court factious bandying fauourites doth preſage ill euent much scepters childrens hands enuy breeds vnkinde deuiſion comes ruine begins confuſion exit enter talbot trumpe drumme burdeaux talb go gates burdeaux trumpeter summon generall vnto wall sounds enter generall aloft engliſh iohn talbot captaines call forth seruant armes harry king england thus would open citie gates humble vs call soueraigne homage obedient subiects ile withdraw bloody power frowne vpon proffer'd peace tempt fury three attendants leane famine quartering steele climbing fire moment eeuen earth shall lay ayre-brauing towers forſake offer loue cap ominous fearefull owle death nations terror bloody period tyranny approacheth vs canſt enter death proteſt well fortified enough iſſue fight retire dolphin well appointed stands vpon chriſtian engliſh talbot loe breathing valiant man inuincible vnconquer'd lateſt glorie praiſe enemy dew withall ere glaſſe begins runne finiſh proceſſe houre theſe eyes well coloured shall withered bloody pale dead drum farre harke harke dolphins drumme warning bell sings heauy muſicke timorous mine ring dire departure exit tal fables heare enemie light horſemen peruſe wings negligent heedleſſe diſcipline park'd bounded pale little heard englands timorous deere maz'd yelping kennell french curres engliſh deere blood raſcall-like fall downe pinch rather moodie mad deſperate stagges turne bloody hounds heads steele make cowards aloofe bay sell euery man life deere mine finde deere deere vs friends god george talbot englands right proſper colours dangerous fight enter meſſenger meets yorke enter yorke trumpet many soldiers yorke return'd againe dog'd mighty army dolphin meſſ return'd lord giue march'd burdeaux power fight talbot march'd along eſpyals diſcouered two mightier troopes dolphin led ioyn'd made march burdeaux yorke plague vpon villaine somerſet thus delayes promiſed horſemen leuied renowned talbot doth expect ayde lowted traitor villaine cannot helpe noble cheualier god comfort neceſſity miſcarry farewell warres france enter another meſſenger meſ princely leader engliſh neuer needfull earth france spurre reſcue noble talbot girdled waſte iron hem'd grim deſtruction burdeaux warlike duke burdeaux yorke elſe farwell talbot france englands honor yorke god somerſet proud heart doth cornets talbots place wee valiant gentleman forteyting traitor coward mad ire wrathfull fury makes weepe thus dye remiſſe traitors meſ diſtreſt lord yorke dies looſe breake warlike word mourne france looſe dayly get long vile traitor somerſet meſ god take mercy braue talbots sonne yong iohn two houres met trauaile toward warlike father yeeres talbot meete liues done yorke alas ioy noble talbot haue bid yong welcome graue away vexation almoſt breath friends greete houre death lucie farewell fortune curſe cauſe cannot ayde man maine bloys poytiers toures wonne away long somerſet delay exit meſ thus vulture feedes boſome great commanders sleeping neglection doth betray loſſe conqueſt conqueror euer-liuing man memorie henrie fift whiles croſſe liues honours lands hurrie loſſe enter somerſet armie som late cannot expedition yorke talbot raſhly plotted generall force might towne buckled ouer-daring talbot hath gloſſe former honor vnheedfull deſperate wilde aduenture yorke fight dye talbot dead great yorke might beare name cap heere sir william lucie set ore-matcht forces forth ayde som sir william whether lu whether lord bought talbot ring'd bold aduerſitie cries noble yorke somerſet beate aſſayling death weake regions whiles honourable captaine drops bloody warre-wearied limbes aduantage lingring lookes reſcue falſe hopes truſt englands honor keepe aloofe worthleſſe emulation let priuate diſcord keepe away leuied lend ayde renowned noble gentleman yeeld vp life vnto world oddes orleance baſtard charles burgundie alanſon reignard compaſſe talbot periſheth default som yorke yorke haue ayde luc yorke faſt vpon grace exclaimes swearing with-hold leuied hoaſt collected expidition som york lyes might haue horſe owe little dutie leſſe loue take foule fawne lu fraud england force france hath intrapt noble-minded talbot neuer england beare life dies betraid fortune som come go diſpatch horſemen within houres ayde lu late comes reſcue tane flye could would haue fled flye would talbot neuer though might som dead braue talbot adieu lu fame liues world shame exeunt enter talbot sonne tal yong iohn talbot thee▪ tutor warre talbots name might reuiu'd age weake vnable limbes bring father drooping chaire malignant ill-boading starres art come vnto feaſt death terrible vnauoyded danger therefore deere boy mount horſe ile direct eſcape flight come dally gone iohn name talbot sonne flye loue mother diſhonor honorable name make baſtard slaue world talbots blood baſely fled noble talbot talb flye reuenge death iohn flyes ne're returne againe talb dye iohn let father doe flye loſſe great regard worth vnknowne loſſe knowne vpon death french little boaſt hopes loſt flight cannot honor haue wonne mine exploit haue done fled vantage euery one bow they'le feare hope euer firſt howre run away knee begge mortalitie rather life preſeru'd infamie talb shall mothers hopes lye one tombe iohn rather ile mothers wombe talb vpon bleſſing command goe iohn fight flye foe talb part father may iohn part mee talb neuer hadſt renowne canſt loſe iohn yes renowned name flight abuſe talb fathers charge cleare yt iohn cannot witneſſe death apparant flye talb leaue followers fight dye age neuer tainted iohn youth guiltie blame twaine diuide stay goe doe like doe liue father dye talb take leaue faire sonne borne eclipſe life afternoone come together liue dye soule soule france heauen flye exit alarum excurſions wherein talbots father twice sonne life gau'ſt firſt loſt done till warlike sword deſpight fate determin'd time gau'ſt new date talb frō dolphins creſt sword fire warm'd fathers heart prowd deſire bold-fac't victorie leaden age quicken'd youthfull spleene warlike rage beat downe alanſon orleance burgundie pride gallia reſcued irefull baſtard orleance drew blood boy maidenhood firſt fight encountred ranſome muſt pay paſſe perceiue priſoner suf canſt tell deny make triall loue ranſom muſt pay suf she's beautifull therefore wooed woman therefore wonne mar wilt accept ranſome yea suf fond man remember haſt wife margaret paramour mar beſt leaue heare suf marr'd lies cooling card mar talkes randon man mad suf yet diſpenſation may bee mar yet would would anſwer suf ile win lady margaret king tuſh that's woodden thing mar talkes wood carpenter suf yet fancy may peace eſtabliſhed betweene theſe realmes remaines though father king naples duke aniou mayne yet poore nobility match mar heare ye captaine leyſure suf diſdaine ne're much henry youthfull quickly yeeld madam haue reueale mar though inthral'd knight way diſhonor suf lady vouchſafe liſten mar perhaps reſcu'd french need craue curteſie suf sweet madam giue hearing cauſe mar tuſh women haue bene captiuate ere suf lady wherefore talke mar cry mercy quid quo suf say gentle princeſſe would bondage happy made queene mar queene parentage yorke argues kinde life hath beene wicked vile death concludes shep fye ione wilt obſtacle god knowes art collop fleſh haue many teare deny prythee gentle ione pucell pezant auant haue man purpoſe obſcure noble birth shep true gaue noble prieſt morne wedded mother kneele downe take bleſſing good gyrle wilt curſed time natiuitie would milke mother gaue breſt bin little rats-bane elſe didſt keepe lambes a-field wiſh rauenous wolfe eaten doeſt deny father curſed drab burne burne hanging good exit yorke take away hath liu'd long fill world vicious qualities puc firſt let tell haue condemn'd begotten shepheard swaine iſſued progeny kings vertuous holy choſen aboue inſpiration celeſtiall grace worke exceeding myracles earth neuer wicked spirits polluted luſtes stain'd guiltleſſe blood innocents corrupt tainted thouſand vices becauſe want grace others haue iudge thing impoſsible compaſſe wonders helpe diuels miſconceyued ione aire hath beene virgin tender infancie chaſte immaculate thought whoſe maiden-blood thus rigorouſly effus'd cry vengeance gates heauen yorke away execution war hearke ye becauſe maide spare faggots let enow place barrelles pitch vpon fatall torture may puc nothing turne vnrelenting hearts ione diſcouet thine infirmity wartanteth law priuiledge childe ye bloody homicides murther fruite within wombe although ye hale violent death yor heauen forfend holy maid child war greateſt miracle ere ye wrought preciſeneſſe come yorke dolphin haue bin iugling imagine would refuge war well go we'll haue baſtards liue eſpecially charles muſt father puc deceyu'd childe none alanſon inioy'd loue yorke alanſon notorious macheuile dyes thouſand liues puc oh giue leaue haue deluded neyther charles yet duke nam'd reignier king naples preuayl'd war married man that's moſt intollerable yor here's gyrle think knowes wel many may accuſe war it's hath beene liberall free yor yet forſooth virgin pure strumpet words condemne bra vſe intreaty vaine pu lead hence leaue curſe▪ may neuer glorious sunne reflex beames vpon countrey make abode darkneſſe gloomy death inuiron till miſcheefe diſpaire driue break necks hang exit enter cardinall yorke breake peeces conſume aſhes fowle accurſed miniſter hell car lord regent greete excellence letters commiſſion king know lords states chriſtendome mou'd remorſe theſe out-ragious broyles haue earneſtly implor'd generall peace betwixt nation aſpyring french heere hand dolphin traine approacheth conferre matter yorke trauell turn'd effect many peeres many captaines gentlemen soldiers quarrell haue beene ouerthrowne bodyes countryes benefit shall laſt conclude effeminate peace haue loſt moſt part townes treaſon falſhood treacherie great progenitors conquered oh warwicke warwicke foreſee greefe vtter loſſe realme france war patient yorke conclude peace couenants little frenchmen gaine thereby enter charles alanſon baſtard reignier char since lords england thus agreed peacefull truce proclaim'd france come informed conditions league muſt yorke speake wincheſter boyling choller chokes hollow paſſage poyſon'd voyce theſe balefull enemies win charles reſt enacted thus regard king henry giues conſent meere compaſſion lenity eaſe countrie diſtreſſefull warre breath fruitfull peace become true liegemen crowne charles vpon condition wilt pay tribute plac'd viceroy vnder enioy regall dignity alan muſt himſelfe adorne temples coronet yet authority retaine priuiledge priuate man proffer abſurd reaſonleſſe char knowne already poſſeſt halfe gallian territories therein reuerenc'd lawfull king shall lucre reſt vn-vanquiſht detract much prerogatiue call'd viceroy whole lord ambaſſador ile rather keepe haue coueting caſt poſsibility yorke inſulting charles haſt meanes vs'd interceſſion obtaine league matter growes compremize stand'ſt aloofe vpon compariſon either accept title vſurp'ſt benefit proceeding king challenge deſert plague inceſſant warres reig lord well obſtinacy cauill courſe contract neglected ten one finde like opportunity alan truth policie subiects maſſacre ruthleſſe dayly proceeding hoſtility therefore take compact truce although breake pleaſure war charles shall condition char shall onely reſeru'd claime intereſt townes garriſon yor allegeance maieſty art knight neuer diſobey rebellious crowne england nobles crowne england diſmiſſe army ye pleaſe hang vp enſignes let drummes heere entertaine peace exeunt actus quintus enter suffolke conference king gloceſter exeter king wondrous rare deſcription noble earle beauteous margaret hath aſtoniſh'd vertues graced externall gifts breed loues paſſions heart like rigour tempeſtuous guſtes prouokes mightieſt hulke againſt tide driuen breath renowne either shipwracke arriue may haue fruition loue suf tuſh good lord tale preface worthy praiſe cheefe perfections louely dame skill vtter would make volume inticing lines able rauiſh dull conceit diuine full repleate choice delights card medice te pſum protector to't well protect king windes grow high doe stomacks lords irkeſome muſick heart strings iarre hope harmony pray lords let compound enter one crying miracle gloſt meanes noyſe fellow miracle do'ſt proclayme one miracle miracle suffolke come king tell miracle one forſooth blinde man saint albones shrine within halfe houre hath receiu'd man ne're life king god prays'd beleeuing soules giues light darkneſſe comfort deſpaire enter maior saint albones brethren bearing man betweene two chayre card comes towneſ-men proceſſion preſent highneſſe man king great comfort earthly vale although multiplyed gloſt stand maſters bring neere king highneſſe pleaſure talke king good-fellow tell vs circumſtance may glorifie lord haſt beene long blinde reſtor'd simpc borne blinde and't pleaſe grace wife indeede suff woman wife wife and't like worſhip gloſt hadſt mother could'ſt haue better told king wert borne simpc barwick north and't like grace king poore soule gods goodneſſe hath beene great let neuer day night vnhallowed paſſe remember lord hath done queene tell good-fellow cam'ſt chance deuotion holy shrine simpc god knowes pure deuotion call'd hundred times blood-drinking haue noble duke aliue know world may deeme knowne hollow friends may iudg'd made duke away name slanders tongue wounded princes courts fill'd reproach get death aye vnhappie queene crown'd infamie king ah woe gloſter wretched man queen woe wretched doſt turne away hide face loathſome leaper looke art like adder waxen deafe poyſonous kill forlorne queene comfort gloſters tombe dame elianor neere ioy erect statue worſhip make image ale-houſe nye wrack'd vpon sea twice aukward winde englands banke droue backe againe vnto natiue clime boaded well fore-warning winde scorpions neſt footing vnkinde shore curſt gentle guſts loos'd forth brazen caues bid blow towards englands bleſſed turne sterne vpon dreadfull rocke yet aeolus would murtherer left hatefull office vnto pretty vaulting sea refus'd drowne knowing wouldſt haue drown'd teares sea vnkindneſſe rockes cowr'd would daſh ragged becauſe flinty heart hard might pallace periſh elianor farre could ken chalky cliffes shore tempeſt beate vs backe vpon hatches duskie sky began rob earneſt-gaping-ſight lands view tooke coſtly iewell necke hart bound diamonds threw towards land sea receiu'd wiſh'd body might heart euen loſt faire englands view bid mine eyes packing heart call'd blinde duskie spectacles looſing ken albions wiſhed coaſt often haue tempted suffolkes tongue agent foule inconſtancie watch aſcanius madding dido would vnfold fathers acts commenc'd burning troy witcht like falſe like aye dye elinor henry weepes doſt liue long noyſe within enter warwicke many commons war reported mighty soueraigne good duke humfrey traiterouſly murdred suffolke cardinall beaufords meanes commons like angry hiue bees want leader vp downe care reuenge haue calm'd mutinie vntill heare order death king dead good begge pardon paſſed mother meant'ſt waſt borne baſtardie fearefull homage done giue hyre soule hell pernicious blood-ſucker men suff waking blood preſence dar'ſt goe warw away euen drag hence vnworthy wherefore curſſe would curſes kill doth mandrakes grone would inuent bitter termes curſt harſh horrible heare deliuer'd fixed teeth full many fignes deadly hate leane-fac'd enuy loathſome caue tongue mine earneſt words mine eyes like beaten flint mine haire fixt end one diſtract euery ioynt curſe ban euen burthen'd heart would breake curſe poyſon drinke gall worſe gall daintieſt taſte groue feare loue beene dead would'ſt haue mourn'd much qu loue mourne dye enter meſſenger king newes com'ſt haſte meſ rebels southwarke fly lord iacke cade proclaimes himſelfe lord mortimer deſcended duke qu hope gone suffolke deceaſt king farewell lord truſt kentiſh rebels buc truſt body feare betraid say truſt haue mine innocence therefore bold reſolute exeunt enter lord scales vpon tower walking subſidie enter george lord say cade well hee beheaded ten times ah say surge nay buckram lord art within point-blanke iuriſdiction regall canſt anſwer maieſty giuing vp normandie vnto mounſieur baſimecu dolphine france knowne vnto theſe preſence euen preſence lord mortimer beeſome muſt court cleane filth art haſt moſt traiterouſly corrupted youth realme erecting grammar schoole whereas fore-fathers bookes score tally haſt cauſed printing vs'd contrary king crowne dignity haſt built paper-mill prooued face haſt men vſually talke nowne verbe abhominable wordes chriſtian eare endure heare haſt appointed iuſtices peace call poore men matters able anſwer moreouer haſt put priſon becauſe could reade haſt hang'd indeede onely cauſe haue beene moſt worthy liue doſt ride foot-cloth doſt say cade marry ought'ſt let horſe weare cloake honeſter men go hoſe doublets dicke worke example butcher say men kent dic kent say nothing bona terra mala gens cade away away latine say heare beare mee wher'e kent commentaries caeſar writ term'd ciuel'ſt place iſle sweet covntry becauſe full riches people liberall valiant actiue wealthy makes hope void pitty maine loſt normandie yet recouer would looſe life iuſtice fauour haue alwayes done prayres teares haue mou'd gifts could neuer haue ought exacted hands kent maintaine king realme large gifts haue beſtow'd learned clearkes becauſe booke preferr'd king ignorance curſe god knowledge wing wherewith flye heauen vnleſſe poſſeſt diuelliſh cannot forbeare murther tongue hath parlied vnto forraigne kings behoofe cade tut one blow field say great men haue reaching hands oft haue thoſe neuer dead geo monſtrous coward come behinde folkes say theſe cheekes pale watching good cade giue box o' th' eare wil make red againe say long determine poore mens cauſes hath made full diſeaſes cade ye haue hempen candle help hatchet dicke doſt quiuer man say palſie feare prouokes cade nay noddes vs ile euen ile head pole take away behead say tell wherein haue offended moſt haue affected wealth honor speake cheſts fill'd vp extorted gold apparrell behold haue iniur'd ye death theſe hands free guiltleſſe bloodſhedding breaſt harbouring foule deceitfull thoughts let liue cade feele remorſe words ile bridle dye bee pleading well life away ha's familiar vnder tongue gods name goe take away head preſently breake sonne lawes houſe sir iames cromer head bring vppon two poles hither done say ah countrimen make prair's god obdurate would fare departed therefore yet relent life cade away command ye proudeſt peere realme weare came henry griefe court enter queene exeter heere comes queene whoſe lookes wray anger ile away henry exeter queene nay goe follow henry patient gentle queene queene patient extreames ah wretched man would dy'de maid neuer neuer borne sonne seeing haſt prou'd vnnaturall father hath deſeru'd looſe birth-right thus hadſt lou'd halfe well felt paine nouriſht blood would'ſt haue left deareſt heart-blood rather haue made duke thine heire diſ-inherited thine onely sonne prince father cannot diſ-inherite king henry pardon margaret pardon sonne earle warwick duke enforc't quee enforc't art king wilt forc't heare ah timorous wretch haſt vndone sonne giu'n vnto houſe yorke head reigne entayle heires vnto crowne make sepulcher creepe farre time warwick chancelor lord callice sterne falconbridge commands narrow seas duke made protector realme yet findes trembling lambe inuironned wolues beene woman souldiers haue toſs'd pikes would haue granted act preferr'ſt life thine honor do'ſt diuorce table henry bed vntill act parliament repeal'd whereby sonne diſ-inherited northerne lords haue forſworne colours follow mine foule diſgrace vtter ruine houſe yorke thus doe leaue come sonne let's away army ready come wee'le henry stay gentle margaret heare queene haſt much already get gone henry gentle sonne edward wilt queene murther'd enemies prince returne victorie field ile grace till ile follow queene come sonne away may linger thus henry poore queene loue sonne hath made breake termes rage reueng'd may hatefull duke whoſe haughtie winged deſire coſt crowne like emptie eagle tyre fleſh sonne loſſe thoſe three lords torments heart ile write vnto entreat faire come couſin meſſenger exet hope reconcile exit flouriſh enter richard edward mountague richard brother though bee youngeſt giue mee leaue edward better play orator mount haue reaſons forceable enter duke yorke yorke sonnes brother quarrell began firſt edward quarrell contention yorke rich concernes grace vs crowne england father yorke mine boy till king henry dead richard right depends life death edward heire therefore enioy giuing houſe lancaſter leaue breathe out-runne father end yorke tooke oath hee quietly reigne edward kingdome oath may broken would breake thouſand oathes reigne one yeere richard god forbid grace forſworne yorke clayme open warre richard ile proue contrary you'le heare mee yorke canſt sonne impoſſible richard oath moment tooke true lawfull magiſtrate hath authoritie ouer henry none vſurpe place made depoſe oath lord vaine friuolous therefore armes father doe thinke thing weare crowne within whoſe circuit elizium poets faine bliſſe ioy doe linger thus cannot reſt vntill white roſe weare dy'de euen luke-warme blood henries heart yorke richard ynough king dye brother london preſently whet warwick enterpriſe richard duke norfolke tell priuily intent edward vnto lord cobham kentiſhmen willingly riſe truſt souldiors wittie courteous liberall full thus imploy'd reſteth occaſion riſe yet king priuie drift houſe lancaſter enter gabriel newes comm'ſt poſte gabriel queene northerne earles lords intend beſiege caſtle hard twentie thouſand men therefore fortifie hold lord yorke sword think'ſt feare edward richard brother mountague poſte london let noble warwicke cobham reſt haue left protectors king powrefull pollicie themſelues truſt henry oathes mount brother goe ile winne feare thus moſt humbly doe take leaue exit mountague enter mortimer brother york sir iohn sir hugh mortimer mine vnckles come sandall happie houre armie queene meane beſiege vs iohn shee neede wee'le meete field yorke fiue thouſand men richard fiue hundred father neede woman's generall feare march afarre edward heare drummes let's men order iſſue forth bid battaile yorke fiue men twentie though oddes great doubt vnckle victorie▪ many battaile haue wonne france enemie hath beene tenne one haue like alarum exit enter rutland tutor rutland ah whither flye hands ah tutor looke bloody clifford comes enter clifford clifford chaplaine away prieſthood life brat accurſed duke whoſe father father dye tutor lord beare company clifford souldiers away tutor ah clifford murther innocent child leaſt hated god man exit clifford dead alreadie feare makes cloſe eyes ile open rutland looks pent-vp lyon o're wretch trembles vnder deuouring pawes walkes inſulting o're prey comes rend limbes aſunder ah gentle clifford kill sword cruell threatning looke sweet clifford heare dye meane wrath reueng'd men let liue clifford vaine poore boy fathers blood hath paſſage words enter rutland let fathers blood open againe man clifford cope clifford brethren liues thine reuenge digg'd vp fore-fathers graues hung rotten coffins vp chaynes could mine ire eaſe heart houſe yorke furie torment soule till root accurſed line leaue one aliue liue hell therefore— rutland oh let pray take death pray clifford pitty clifford pitty rapiers point affords rutland neuer harme wilt clifford father hath rutland ere borne haſt one sonne pitty leaſt reuenge thereof god iuſt miſerably ah let liue priſon dayes giue occaſion offence let dye haſt cauſe clifford cauſe father father therefore dye rutland dij faciant laudis iſta tuae clifford plantagenet come plantagenet sonnes blood cleauing blade shall ruſt vpon weapon till blood congeal'd doe make wipe exit alarum enter richard duke yorke yorke army queene hath got field vnckles reſcuing followers eager foe turne back flye like ships winde lambes purſu'd hunger-ſtarued wolues sonnes god knowes hath bechanced know haue demean'd themſelues like men borne renowne life death three times richard make lane thrice cry'de courage father fight full oft came edward purple faulchion painted hilt blood thoſe encountred hardyeſt warriors retyre richard cry'de charge giue foot ground cry'de crowne elſe glorious tombe scepter earthly sepulchre charg'd againe alas bodg'd againe haue swan bootleſſe labour againſt tyde
