pale cheekes thinkes preſenteth wither one roſe let flouriſh contend thouſand liues muſt wither son mother fathers death take ne're fa wife sonne shed teares ne're king country theſe woful chances miſ-thinke king son euer rew'd fathers death fath euer father bemoan'd sonne hen euer king greeu'd subiects woe much mine ten times much son ile beare hence may weepe fill fath theſe armes mine winding heart boy sepulcher heart thine image ne're go breſt funerall bell obſequious father men loſſe hauing priam valiant sonnes ile beare hence let fight haue murthered kill exit hen sad-hearted-men much ouergone care heere king wofull alarums excurſions enter queen prince exeter prin fly father flye friends fled warwicke rages like chafed bull away death doth hold vs purſuite qu mount lord towards barwicke poſt amaine edward richard like brace grey-hounds hauing fearfull flying hare fiery eyes wrath bloody graſpt yrefull hands backes therefore hence amaine exet away vengeance comes along nay expoſtulate make elſe come ile away hen nay take good exeter feare loue go whether queene intends forward away exeunt lowd alarum enter clifford wounded clif heere burnes candle heere dies whiles laſted gaue king henry light lancaſter feare ouerthrow bodies parting soule loue feare glew'd many friends fall tough commixtures melts impairing henry miſproud yorke whether flye gnats sunne henries enemies phoebus had'ſt neuer giuen conſent phaeton checke fiery steeds burning carre neuer earth henry had'ſt kings father father giuing ground vnto houſe yorke neuer like sommer flyes ten thouſand luckleſſe realme hed left mourning widdowes death day had'ſt kept chaire peace doth cherriſh weeds gentle ayre makes robbers bold much lenity bootleſſe plaints cureleſſe wounds way flye hold flight foe mercileſſe pitty hands haue deſeru'd pitty ayre hath got deadly wounds much effuſe blood doth make faint come yorke richard warwicke reſt fathers boſomes split breſt alarum retreat enter edward warwicke richard soldiers montague clarence ed breath lords good fortune bids vs pauſe frownes war peacefull lookes troopes purſue bloody-minded queene led calme henry though king doth saile fill'd fretting guſt command argoſie waues thinke lords clifford fled war impoſsible eſcape though face words brother richard markt graue whereſoere hee's dead clifford grones rich whoſe takes murth'ring knife vnto roote whence tender meane princely father duke yorke war gates yorke fetch ye head fathers head clifford placed whereof let roome meaſure meaſure muſt anſwered ed bring forth fatall schreechowle houſe nothing death vs death diſmall threatning ill-boading tongue war thinke vnderſtanding bereft speake clifford doſt know darke cloudy death ore-ſhades beames life heares vs penitence war clifford deuiſe excuſes faults cla deuiſe fell tortures faults rich didd'ſt loue yorke yorke edw pittied'ſt rutland pitty cla where's captaine margaret fence war mocke clifford sweare was't wont ric oath nay world go's hard clifford cannot friends oath know he's dead soule right hand would buy two houres life deſpight might rayle hand chop iſſuing blood stifle villaine whoſe vnſtanched thirſt yorke yong rutland could war he's dead traitors head reare place fathers london triumphant march crowned englands royall king whence warwicke cut sea france aske ladie bona queene theſe lands together hauing france friend dread foe hopes riſe againe though cannot greatly hurt yet looke haue buz offend thine eares firſt coronation britanny ile croſſe sea effect marriage pleaſe lord ed euen wilt warwicke let bee builde seate neuer vndertake thing wherein counſaile conſent wanting richard create duke glouceſter george clarence warwicke selfe shall vndo pleaſeth beſt rich let duke clarence george gloſter gloſters dukedome ominous war tut that's fooliſh obſeruation richard▪ duke gloſter london theſe honors poſſeſſion exeunt enter sinklo humfrey croſſe-bowes hands sink vnder thicke growne brake wee'l laund anon deere come couert make stand culling principall deere hum ile aboue hill may sink cannot noiſe croſſe-bow heard loſt heere ayme beſt time tedious ile tell befell day meane sink heere comes man let's till paſt enter king prayer booke hen scotland euen pure loue greet mine owne land wiſhfull harry harry land thine place fill'd scepter wrung balme waſht wherewith annointed bending knee call caeſar humble preaſe right man comes redreſſe helpe sink heere's deere whoſe skin's keepers fee quondam king let's vpon hen let embrace aduerſaries wiſe men wiſeſt courſe hum linger let vs lay hands vpon sink forbeare a-while wee'l heare little hen queene son gone france aid heare great commanding warwicke thither gone craue french kings siſter wife edward newes true mourne nero tainted remorſe heare plaints briniſh teares come begge warwicke giue shee left crauing ayde henrie right asking wife edward shee weepes henry depos'd smiles edward inſtaul'd poore wretch greefe whiles warwicke tels title wrong inferreth arguments mighty concluſion winnes king promiſe siſter elſe king edwards place margaret thus poore art forſaken went'ſt forlorne hum say art talk'ſt kings queens king leſſe born man leaſt leſſe men may talke kings hum talk'ſt wer't king king minde that's enough hum king crowne king crowne heart head deck'd diamonds indian crowne call'd content crowne kings enioy hum well king crown'd content crowne content muſt contented go along vs thinke king king edward hath depos'd allegeance apprehend enemie king neuer breake oath hum neuer oath king dwell england hum heere country remaine king annointed king nine monthes old father grandfather kings true subiects vnto tell haue broke oathes sin subiects wer king king dead breath man ah men know looke blow feather face ayre blowes againe obeying winde blow yeelding another blowes commanded alwayes greater guſt lightneſſe common men breake oathes milde intreatie make guiltie go king commanded kings command ile obey sinklo true subiects king king edward king would againe henrie king edward sinklo charge gods name kings go vs vnto officers king gods name lead kings name obeyd god let king performe▪ humbly yeeld vnto exeunt enter edward gloſter clarence lady gray king brother gloſter albons field ladyes husband sir richard grey land conqueror repoſſeſſe thoſe lands wee iuſtice cannot well deny becauſe quarrell houſe yorke worthy gentleman loſe life rich highneſſe doe well graunt diſhonor deny king leſſe yet ile make pawſe rich yea lady hath thing graunt king graunt humble clarence hee knowes game true hee keepes winde rich silence king widow conſider come time know minde wid right gracious lord cannot brooke delay may pleaſe highneſſe reſolue pleaſure rich widow ile warrant lands pleaſes pleaſure fight cloſer good faith you'le catch blow clarence feare vnleſſe chance fall rich god forbid hee'le take vantages king many children haſt widow tell clarence thinke meanes begge child rich nay whip hee'le rather giue two wid three moſt gracious lord rich haue foure you'le rul'd king pittie loſe fathers lands wid pittifull dread lord graunt king lords giue vs leaue ile trye widowes wit rich good leaue haue haue leaue till youth take leaue leaue crutch king tell madame doe loue children wid full dearely loue king would doe much doe good wid doe good would harme king get husbands lands doe good wid therefore came vnto maieſtie king ile tell theſe lands got wid bind highneſſe king wilt doe giue wid command reſts doe king take exceptions boone wid gracious lord except cannot doe king canſt doe meane aske wid doe grace commands rich hee plyes hard much raine weares marble clar red fire nay wax muſt melt wid lord heare taske king eaſie taske loue king wid that's perform'd becauſe subiect king husbands lands freely giue wid take leaue many thouſand thankes rich match made curſie king fruits loue meane wid fruits loue meane louing liege king feare another loue think'ſt much get wid loue till death humble thanks prayers loue vertue begges vertue graunts king troth meane loue wid meane thought king partly may perceiue minde wid minde neuer graunt perceiue highneſſe aymes ayme aright king tell plaine ayme lye wid tell plaine rather lye priſon king haue husbands lands wid mine honeſtie dower loſſe purchaſe king therein wrong'ſt children mightily wid herein highneſſe wrongs mightie lord merry inclination accords pleaſe diſmiſſe eyther king wilt requeſt do'ſt demand wid lord end rich widow likes knits browes clarence hee blunteſt wooer chriſtendome like one vpon promontorie farre-off hee would tread wiſhing foot equall eye chides sea thence saying hee'le lade dry haue way doe wiſh crowne farre chide meanes keepes ile cut cauſes flattering lookes oh miſerable thought vnlikely▪ accompliſh twentie golden crownes loue forſwore mothers wombe deale lawes shee corrupt frayle nature bribe mine arme vp like wither'd shrub make enuious mountaine back deformitie mocke body legges vnequall diſ-proportion euery part like chaos vn-lick'd beare-whelpe carryes impreſſion like damme man belou'd oh monſtrous fault harbour thought earth affoords ioy king france margaret muſt learne kings command muſt confeſſe great albions queene former golden dayes miſchance hath trod title downe diſ-honor layd ground muſt take like seat vnto fortune humble seat true king loth linke lawfull choſen warw thereon pawne credit mine honor lewis hee gracious peoples eye warw henry vnfortunate lewis diſſembling aſide tell truth meaſure loue vnto siſter bona war may beſeeme monarch like himſelfe haue often heard loue externall plant whereof root fixt vertues ground leaues fruit maintain'd beauties sunne exempt enuy diſdaine vnleſſe lady bona quit paine lewis siſter let vs heare firme reſolue bona graunt denyall mine yet confeſſe often ere day speaks war haue heard kings deſert recounted mine eare hath tempted iudgement deſire lewis warwicke thus siſter edwards forthwith articles drawne touching ioynture king muſt make dowrie counter-poys'd draw neere queene margaret witneſſe bona wife engliſh king pr edw edward engliſh king marg deceitfull warwicke deuice alliance make void comming lewis henries friend lewis friend margaret title crowne weake may appeare edwards good reaſon releas'd giuing ayde late promiſed yet haue kindneſſe hand eſtate th' alliance france dare preſume vs manner mar told maieſty much proueth edwards loue warwickes honeſty war king lewis heere proteſt heauen hope haue heauenly bliſſe cleere miſdeed edwards king diſhonors moſt himſelfe could forget houſe yorke father came vntimely death let paſſe th' abuſe done neece impale regall crowne put henry natiue right guerdon'd laſt shame shame himſelfe deſert honor loue forgiue quite forget old faults ioy becom'ſt king henries friend war much friend vnfained friend king lewis vouchſafe furniſh vs bands choſen soldiours ile vndertake land coaſt force tyrant warre foule diſpaire bona quarrel engliſh queens one war mine faire lady bona ioynes lew mine thine margarets therefore laſt firmely reſolu'd haue ayde mar let giue humble thankes lew englands meſſenger returne poſte tell falſe edward king lewis france ouer maskers reuell new bride what's paſt go feare king withall bona tell hope hee'l proue widower weare willow garland mar tell mourning weeds layde aſide ready put armor war tell hath done wrong therefore ile vn-crowne er't long there's reward gone exit poſt lew warwicke oxford fiue thouſand men shall croſſe seas bid falſe edward battaile occaſion noble queen prince follow freſh supply yet ere go anſwer one doubt pledge haue firme loyalty war aſſure conſtant loyalty queene young prince agree ile ioyne mine eldeſt daughter ioy forthwith bride clarence minde tell plainly thinke king brother clarence like choyce penſiue halfe malecontent clarence well lewis france earle warwicke weake courage iudgement they'le take offence abuſe king suppoſe take offence without cauſe lewis warwicke edward king warwickes muſt haue rich haue becauſe king yet haſtie marriage proueth well king yea brother richard offended rich god forbid wiſh god hath ioyn'd together pittie yoake well together king setting skornes miſlike aſide tell reaſon lady grey become wife englands queene somerſet mountague speake freely thinke clarence mine opinion king lewis becomes enemie mocking marriage lady bona rich warwicke gaue charge dis-honored new marriage king lewis warwick appeas'd inuention deuiſe mount yet haue ioyn'd france alliance would haue helpes onely defend lyes clar one lord haſtings well deſerues haue heire lord hungerford king graunt law rich yet thinks grace hath done well giue heire daughter lord scales vnto brother louing bride edward king lewis france ouer maskers reuell new bride king lewis braue belike thinkes henry lady bona marriage poſt theſe words vtt'red mild diſdaine tell hope hee'le proue widower ile weare willow garland king blame could little leſſe wrong henries queene haue heard place poſt tell quoth mourning weedes done readie put armour king belike minds play amazon warwicke theſe iniuries poſt incens'd againſt maieſtie reſt diſcharg'd theſe words tell hath done wrong therefore ile vncrowne er't long king ha durſt traytor breath prowd words well arme thus fore-warn'd haue warres pay preſumption warwicke friends margaret poſt gracious soueraigne link'd friendſhip yong prince edward marryes warwicks daughter clarence belike elder clarence haue younger brother king farewell faſt hence warwickes daughter though want kingdome yet marriage may proue inferior loue warwicke follow exit clarence somerſet followes rich thoughts ayme matter loue edward crowne king clarence somerſet gone warwicke yet arm'd againſt worſt happen haſte needfull deſp'rate caſe pembrooke stafford behalfe goe leuie men make prepare warre alreadie quickly landed perſon follow exeunt pembrooke stafford ere goe haſtings god helpe mountague hee proues true hast hastings hee fauours edwards cauſe king brother richard vs rich deſpight withſtand king victorie therefore let vs hence loſe howre till wee meet warwicke fained friend proceedings welcome clarence daughter thine reſts nights couerture brother careleſſely encamp'd souldiors lurking towne attended guard wee may take pleaſure scouts haue found aduenture eaſie vlyſſes diomede manhood rheſus tents brought thence thracian fatall steeds wee well couer'd nights black mantle vnawares may beat downe edwards guard himſelfe intend onely follow attempt applaud name henry leader cry henry let's way warwicke friends god saint george exeunt enter three watchmen guard kings tent watch come maſters man take king downe watch bed watch hath made vow neuer lye take naturall reſt till warwicke himſelfe quite watch morrow belike day warwicke neere men report watch pray noble man▪ king reſteth tent watch lord haſtings kings chiefeſt friend watch commands king chiefe followers lodge townes himſelfe keepes cold field watch honour becauſe dangerous watch giue worſhip quietneſſe like better dangerous honor warwicke knew eſtate doubted would waken watch vnleſſe halberds vp paſſage watch wherefore elſe guard royall tent defend perſon night-foes enter warwicke clarence oxford somerſet french souldiors warw tent guard courage maſters honor neuer follow edward watch goes watch stay dyeſt warwicke reſt cry warwicke warwicke vpon guard flye crying arme arme warwicke reſt following drumme playing trumpet enter warwicke somerſet reſt bringing king gowne chaire richard haſtings flyes ouer stage som flye warw richard haſtings let goe heere duke edw duke warwicke wee parted call'dſt king warw caſe alter'd diſgrac'd embaſſade degraded king come create duke yorke alas gouerne kingdome know vſe embaſſadors contented one wife vſe brothers brotherly peoples welfare enemies edw yea brother clarence art nay edward needs muſt downe yet warwicke deſpight miſchance complices edward alwayes beare himſelfe king though fortunes mallice ouerthrow state minde exceedes compaſſe wheele warw minde edward englands king takes crowne henry weare engliſh crowne true king indeede lord somerſet requeſt see forthwith duke edward conuey'd vnto brother arch-biſhop yorke haue fought pembrooke fellowes ile follow tell anſwer lewis lady bona a-while farewell good duke yorke leade forcibly ed fates impoſe men muſt needs abide boots reſiſt winde tide exeunt oxf remaines lords vs march london soldiers war that's firſt thing haue free king henry impriſonment regall throne exit enter riuers lady gray riu madam makes change gray brother riuers yet learne late misfortune befalne king edward riu loſſe pitcht battell againſt warwicke gray loſſe owne royall perſon riu soueraigne gray almoſt taken priſoner either betrayd falſhood guard foe vnawares haue vnderſtand new committed biſhop yorke fell warwickes brother foe riu theſe newes muſt confeſſe full greefe yet gracious madam beare may warwicke may looſe hath wonne day gray till faire hope muſt hinder liues decay rather waine diſpaire loue edwards off-ſpring wombe makes bridle paſſion beare mildneſſe misfortunes croſſe draw many teare riſing blood-ſucking leaſt teares blaſt drowne king edwards fruite true heyre th' engliſh crowne riu madam warwicke become gray inform'd comes towards london crowne henries head gueſſe reſt king edwards friends muſt downe preuent tyrants violence truſt hath broken faith ile hence forthwith vnto sanctuary leaſt heire edwards right reſt force fraud come therefore let vs flye may flye warwicke take vs dye exeunt enter richard lord haſtings sir william stanley rich lord haſtings sir william stanley leaue wonder drew hither cheefeſt thicket parke thus caſe know king brother priſoner biſhop whoſe hands hath good vſage great liberty often attended weake guard come hunting way diſport himſelfe haue aduertis'd meanes houre make way vnder colour vſuall game heere finde friends horſe men free captiuitie enter king edward huntſman huntſman way lord way lies game king edw nay way man see huntſmen brother gloſter lord haſtings reſt stand thus cloſe biſhops deere rich brother time caſe requireth haſt horſe ready parke-corner king ed whether haſt lyn lord thence flanders rich wel gueſt beleeue meaning ed stanley requite forwardneſſe rich wherefore time talke ed huntſman wilt go along huntſ better tarry hang'd rich come away lets ha adoo ed biſhop farwell sheeld warwickes frowne pray may re-poſſeſſe crowne exeunt flouriſh enter king henry clarence warwicke somerſet young henry oxford mountague lieutenant hen lieutenant god friends haue edward regall turn'd captiue libertie feare hope vnto ioyes enlargement due fees lieu subiects may challenge nothing sou'rains humble prayer may preuaile craue pardon maieſtie hen lieutenant well vſing nay ile well requite kindneſſe made impriſonment pleaſure pleaſure incaged birds conceiue many moody thoughts laſt notes houſhold harmonie quite forget loſſe libertie warwicke god free chiefely therefore thanke god author inſtrument therefore may conquer fortunes liuing low fortune cannot hurt people bleſſed land may puniſht thwarting warwicke although head weare crowne reſigne gouernment art fortunate deeds warw grace hath beene fam'd vertuous may wiſe vertuous auoiding fortunes malice men rightly temper starres yet one thing let blame grace chuſing clarence place clar warwicke art worthy heau'ns natiuitie adiudg'd oliue branch lawrell crowne likely bleſt peace warre therefore yeeld free conſent warw chuſe clarence onely protector king warwick clarence giue hands ioyne hands hands hearts diſſention hinder gouernment make protectors land lead priuate life deuotion latter dayes rebuke creators prayſe warw anſweres clarence soueraignes clar conſents warwicke yeeld conſent fortune repoſe warw though loth yet muſt content wee'le yoake together like double henries body place meane bearing weight gouernment enioyes honor eaſe clarence needfull forthwith edward pronounc'd traytor lands goods confiſcate clar elſe succeſſion determined warw therein clarence want part king firſt chiefe affaires let entreat command margaret queene sonne edward returne france till doubtfull feare ioy libertie halfe eclips'd clar bee done soueraigne king lord somerſet youth haue tender care somerſ liege young henry earle richmond king come hither englands hope layes hand head powers truth diuining thoughts prettie lad proue countries bliſſe lookes full peacefull maieſtie head nature fram'd weare crowne hand wield scepter himſelfe likely time bleſſe regall throne make much lords hee muſt helpe hurt mee enter poſte warw newes friend poſte edward eſcaped brother fled hee heares burgundie warw vnſauorie newes made eſcape poſte conuey'd richard duke gloſter lord haſtings attended ambuſh forreſt biſhops huntſmen reſcu'd hunting dayly exerciſe warw brother careleſſe charge let vs hence soueraigne prouide may betide exeunt manet somerſet richmond oxford som lord like flight edwards doubtleſſe burgundie yeeld helpe haue warres befor't long henries late preſaging prophecie glad heart hope young richmond doth heart miſ-giue theſe conflicts may befall harme therefore lord oxford preuent worſt forthwith wee'le hence brittanie till paſt ciuill enmitie oxf edward re-poſſeſſe crowne like richmond reſt downe som brittanie come therefore let's exeunt flouriſh enter edward richard haſtings souldiers edw brother richard lord haſtings reſt yet thus farre fortune maketh vs amends enterchange wained henries regall crowne well haue paſs'd re-paſs'd seas brought deſired helpe burgundie remaines thus arriu'd rauenſpurre hauen gates yorke enter dukedome rich gates made faſt brother like many men threſhold well fore-told danger lurkes within edw tuſh man aboadments muſt affright vs faire foule meanes muſt enter hither friends repaire vs hast liege ile knocke enter walls maior yorke brethren maior lords fore-warned comming gates owe allegeance vnto henry edw maſter maior henry king yet edward leaſt duke yorke maior true good lord know leſſe edw challenge nothing dukedome well content alone rich fox hath got noſe hee'le finde meanes make body follow hast maſter maior doubt open gates king henries friends maior gates opened deſcends rich wiſe captaine perſwaded haſt good old man would faine wel long entred doubt perſwade brothers vnto reaſon enter maior two aldermen edw maſter maior theſe gates muſt night time warre feare man yeeld vp keyes takes keyes edward defend towne thoſe friends deine follow mee march enter mountgomerie drumme souldiers rich brother sir iohn mountgomerie truſtie friend vnleſſe deceiu'd edw welcome sir iohn come armes mount helpe king edward time euery loyall subiect ought doe edw thankes good mountgomerie forget title crowne onely clayme dukedome till god pleaſe reſt mount fare well hence againe came king duke drummer vp let vs march away drumme begins march edw nay sir iohn wee'le debate meanes crowne may recouer'd mount talke debating words you'le proclaime king ile leaue fortune gone keepe back come fight pretend title rich brother wherefore nice points edw wee grow wee'le make clayme till wiſdome conceale meaning haſt away wit armes muſt rule rich feareleſſe minds clyme vnto crowns brother proclaime hand bruit thereof bring many friends edw right henry vſurpes diademe mount soueraigne like himſelfe edwards champion haſt sound trumpet edward proclaim'd come fellow souldior make proclamation flouriſh sound soul edward fourth grace god king england france lord ireland mount whoſoe're gain king edwards right challenge fight throwes downe gauntlet long liue edward fourth edw thankes braue mountgomery thankes vnto fortune ile requite kindneſſe night let's harbor yorke morning sunne rayſe carre aboue border horizon wee'le forward towards warwicke mates well wot henry souldier ah froward clarence euill beſeemes flatter henry forſake brother yet wee may wee'le meet warwicke come braue souldiors doubt day gotten doubt large pay exeunt flouriſh enter king warwicke mountague clarence oxford somerſet war counſaile lords edward belgia haſtie germanes blunt hollanders hath paſs'd narrow seas troupes doth march amaine london many giddie people flock king let's leuie men beat backe againe clar little fire quickly trodden riuers cannot quench war warwickſhire haue true-hearted friends mutinous peace yet bold warre thoſe muſter vp sonne clarence shalt vp suffolke norfolke kent knights gentlemen come brother mountague buckingham northampton leiceſterſhire find men well enclin'd heare command'ſt braue oxford wondrous well belou'd oxfordſhire muſter vp friends soueraigne louing citizens like iland gyrt ocean modeſt dyan circled nymphs shall reſt london till come faire lords take leaue reply farewell soueraigne king farewell hector troyes true hope clar truth kiſſe highneſſe hand king well-minded clarence fortunate mount comfort lord take leaue oxf thus truth bid adieu king sweet oxford louing mountague happy farewell war farewell lords let's meet couentry exeunt king pallace reſt couſin exeter thinkes lordſhip thinkes power edward hath field able encounter mine exet doubt reſt king that's feare meed hath got fame haue mine eares demands poſted delayes pittie hath beene balme heale wounds mildneſſe hath allay'd griefes mercie dry'd water-flowing teares haue deſirous wealth much oppreſt great subſidies forward reuenge though much err'd loue edward exeter theſe graces challenge grace lyon fawnes vpon lambe lambe neuer ceaſe follow shout within lancaſter lancaſter exet hearke hearke lord shouts theſe enter edward souldiers edw seize henry beare hence againe proclaime vs king england foun makes brookes flow spring sea dry much higher ebbe hence tower let exit king henry lords towards couentry bend courſe peremptorie warwicke remaines sunne hot vſe delay cold biting winter marres hop'd-for hay rich away betimes forces ioyne take great-growne traytor vnawares braue warriors march amaine towards couentry exeunt enter warwicke maior couentry two meſſengers others vpon walls war poſt came valiant oxford farre hence lord mine honeſt fellow meſſ dunſmore marching hitherward war farre brother mountague poſt came mountague meſſ daintry puiſſant troope enter someruile war say someruile louing sonne gueſſe nigh clarence someru southam leaue forces doe expect two howres hence war clarence hand heare drumme someru lord southam lyes drum honor heares marcheth warwicke war belike vnlook'd friends someru hand quickly know march flouriſh enter edward richard souldiers edw goe trumpet walls parle rich see warwicke mans wall war oh vnbid edward come scouts could heare newes repayre edw warwicke wilt ope citie gates speake gentle words humbly bend knee call edward king hands begge mercy pardon theſe outrages war nay rather wilt draw forces hence confeſſe vp pluckt downe call warwicke patron penitent remaine duke yorke rich thought leaſt would haue king make ieaſt againſt war dukedome sir goodly gift rich faith poore earle giue ile doe good gift war gaue kingdome brother edw mine warwickes gift war art atlas great weight weakeling warwicke takes gift againe henry king warwicke subiect edw warwickes king edwards priſoner gallant warwicke doe anſwer body head rich alas warwicke fore-caſt whiles thought ten king finger'd deck left poore henry biſhops pallace tenne one you'le meet tower edw euen yet warwicke rich come warwicke take time kneele downe kneele downe nay elſe iron cooles war rather chop hand blow fling face beare low edw sayle canſt haue winde tyde friend hand faſt wound coale-black hayre shall whiles head warme new cut write duſt sentence blood wind-changing warwicke change enter oxford drumme colours war oh chearefull colours oxford comes oxf oxford oxford lancaſter rich gates open somerſet somerſet lancaſter rich two name dukes somerſet haue liues vnto houſe yorke third sword hold enter clarence drumme colours war loe george clarence along force enough bid brother battaile vpright zeale right preuailes nature brothers loue come clarence come wilt warwicke call clar father warwick know meanes looke throw infamie ruinate fathers houſe gaue blood lyme together vp lancaſter troweſt warwicke clarence harſh blunt vnnaturall bend fatall inſtruments warre againſt brother lawfull king perhaps wilt obiect holy oath keepe oath impietie iephah daughter treſpas made deſerue well brothers hands proclayme mortall foe reſolution whereſoe're meet meet abroad plague foule mis-leading prowd-hearted warwicke defie brother turne bluſhing cheekes pardon edward make amends richard doe frowne vpon faults henceforth vnconſtant edw welcome ten times belou'd neuer hadſt deſeru'd hate rich welcome good clarence brother-like warw oh paſſing traytor periur'd vniuſt edw warwicke wilt leaue towne fight beat stones thine eares warw alas coop'd defence away towards barnet preſently bid battaile edward dar'ſt edw yes warwicke edward dares leads way lords field saint george victorie exeunt march warwicke companie followes alarum excurſions enter edward bringing forth warwicke wounded edw lye dye dye feare warwicke bugge fear'd vs mountague faſt warwickes bones may keepe thine companie exit warw ah nigh come friend foe tell victor yorke warwicke aske mangled body blood want heart muſt yeeld body earth fall conqueſt foe thus yeelds cedar axes edge whoſe armes gaue princely eagle vnder whoſe ramping lyon whoſe top-branch ouer-peer'd ioues tree kept low shrubs winters pow'rfull winde theſe eyes dim'd deaths black veyle haue beene piercing mid-day sunne treaſons world wrinckles browes fill'd blood lik'ned oft kingly sepulchers liu'd king could digge graue durſt warwicke bent brow loe glory duſt blood parkes walkes mannors euen forſake lands nothing left bodies length pompe rule reigne earth duſt liue yet dye muſt enter oxford somerſet som ah warwicke warwicke wert might recouer loſſe againe queene france hath brought puiſſant power euen heard newes ah could'ſt flye warw would flye ah mountague brother take hand lippes keepe soule lou'ſt brother didſt teares would waſh cold congealed blood glewes lippes let come quickly mountague dead som ah warwicke mountague hath breath'd laſt lateſt gaſpe cry'd warwicke commend valiant brother would haue like cannon vault mought diſtinguiſht laſt well might heare deliuered groane oh farewell warwicke warw sweet reſt soule flye lords warwicke bids farewell meet heauen oxf away away meet queenes great power beare away body exeunt flouriſh enter king edward triumph richard clarence reſt king thus farre fortune keepes vpward courſe grac'd wreaths victorie midſt bright-ſhining day black threatning cloud encounter glorious sunne ere attaine eaſefull weſterne bed meane lords thoſe powers queene hath rays'd gallia haue arriued coaſt heare march fight vs clar little gale diſperſe cloud blow source whence came beames dry thoſe vapours vp euery cloud engenders storme rich queene valued thirtie thouſand somerſet oxford fled haue time breathe well aſſur'd faction full king aduertis'd louing friends doe hold courſe toward tewksbury hauing beſt barnet field thither willingneſſe rids way march augmented euery countie goe along strike vp drumme cry courage away exeunt flouriſh march enter queene young edward somerſet oxford souldiers qu great lords wiſe men ne'r waile loſſe chearely redreſſe harmes though maſt blowne ouer-boord cable broke holding-anchor loſt halfe saylors flood yet liues pilot is't meet hee leaue helme like fearefull lad tearefull eyes adde water sea giue hath much whiles moane ship rock induſtrie courage might haue ah ah fault say warwicke anchor mountague top-maſt friends tackles theſe oxford another anchor somerſet another goodly maſt friends france shrowds tacklings though vnskilfull ned allow'd skilfull pilots charge helme weepe keepe courſe though rough winde shelues rocks threaten vs wrack good chide waues faire edward ruthleſſe sea clarence quick-ſand deceit richard raged fatall rocke theſe enemies poore barke say alas tread sand quickly beſtride rock tyde waſh elſe famiſh that's three-fold death lords let vnderſtand caſe one would flye vs there's hop'd-for mercy brothers ruthleſſe waues sands rocks courage cannot auoided childiſh weakeneſſe lament feare prince thinkes woman valiant spirit coward heard theſe words infuſe breaſt magnanimitie make naked foyle man armes doubting fearefull man haue leaue goe away betimes leaſt need might infect another make like himſelfe god forbid let depart neede helpe oxf women children high courage warriors faint perpetuall oh braue young prince famous grandfather doth liue againe long may'ſt liue beare image renew glories som fight hope goe home bed like owle day ariſe mock'd wondred qu thankes gentle somerſet oxford thankes prince take thankes yet hath nothing elſe enter meſſenger meſſ prepare lords edward hand readie fight therefore reſolute oxf thought leſſe policie haſte thus faſt finde vs vnprouided som hee's deceiu'd readineſſe qu cheares heart forwardneſſe oxf pitch battaile hence budge flouriſh march enter edward richard clarence souldiers edw braue followers yonder thornie wood heauens aſſiſtance muſt roots hew'ne vp yet ere night need adde fuell fire well wot ye blaze burne giue fight lords qu lords knights gentlemen teares gaine-ſay euery word ye drinke water eye therefore henry soueraigne priſoner foe state vſurp'd realme subiects statutes cancell'd treaſure yonder wolfe makes fight iuſtice gods name lords valiant giue fight alarum retreat excurſions exeunt flouriſh enter edward richard queene clarence oxford somerſet edw period tumultuous broyles away oxford hames caſtle somerſet guiltie head goe beare hence heare oxf part ile trouble words som patience fortune exeunt qu part troublous world meet ioy ieruſalem edw proclamation made finds edward shall haue high reward life rich loe youthfull edward comes enter prince edw bring forth gallant let vs heare young thorne begin prick edward canſt make bearing armes vp subiects trouble haſt turn'd prince speake like subiect prowd ambitious yorke suppoſe fathers mouth reſigne chayre kneele whil'ſt propoſe words traytor would'ſt haue anſwer qu ah father beene reſolu'd rich might haue worne petticoat ne're haue breech lancaſter prince let aeſop fable winters night curriſh riddles place rich heauen brat ile plague ye word qu waſt borne plague men rich gods take away captiue scold prince nay take away crooke-backe rather edw peace wilfull boy charme tongue clar vntutor'd lad art malapert prince know dutie vndutifull laſciuious edward periur'd george miſ-ſhapen dicke tell ye better traytors ye vſurp'ſt fathers right mine edw take likeneſſe rayler stabs rich sprawl'ſt take end agonie rich clar ther's twitting periurie clar qu oh kill rich marry offers kill edw hold richard hold haue done much rich liue fill world words edw doth vſe meanes recouerie rich clarence excuſe king brother ile hence london matter ere ye come heare newes cla rich tower tower exit qu oh ned ned mother boy can'ſt traitors murtherers caeſar blood offend worthy blame foule deed equall man reſpect childe men ne're fury childe what's worſe murtherer may name heart burſt heart may burſt butchers villaines bloudy caniballes plant haue vntimely cropt haue children butchers thought would haue vp remorſe euer chance haue childe looke youth haue cut deathſmen haue rid yong prince king away go beare hence perforce qu nay neuer beare hence diſpatch heere sword ile pardon death wilt clarence cla heauen much eaſe qu good clarence clarence cla did'ſt heare would qu vſeſt forſweare sin charity wilt yu diuels butcher richard hard fauor'd richard richard art art heere murther almeſ-deed petitioners blood ne're put'ſt backe ed away charge ye beare hence qu come prince exit queene ed where's richard gone cla london poſt gueſſe make bloody supper tower ed he's thing comes head march hence diſcharge common pay thankes let's away london gentle queene well fares hope hath sonne exit enter henry richard lieutenant wall rich good day lord booke hard hen good lord lord rather tis flatter good little better gloſter good deuill alike prepoſterous therefore good lord rich sirra leaue vs muſt conferre hen flies wreakleſſe ye wolfe firſt harmleſſe sheepe doth yeeld fleece next throate vnto butchers knife scene death hath roſsius acte rich suſpition alwayes haunts guilty minde theefe doth feare buſh officer hen bird hath bin limed buſh trembling wings miſdoubteth euery buſh hapleſſe male one bird haue fatall obiect eye poore yong lim'd caught kill'd rich peeuiſh foole creet taught sonne office fowle yet wings foole drown'd hen dedaius poore boy icarus father minos deni'de courſe sunne wings boy brother edward selfe sea whoſe enuious gulfe vp life ah kill weapon words breſt better brooke daggers point eares tragicke hiſtory wherefore doſt come is't life rich think'ſt executioner hen perſecutor art murthering innocents executing art executioner rich son kill'd preſumption hen hadſt bin kill'd firſt yu didſt preſume had'ſt liu'd kill sonne mine thus propheſie many thouſand miſtruſt parcell feare many old mans many widdowes many orphans water-ſtanding-eye men sonnes wiues husbands orphans parents timeles death shall rue houre euer was't borne owle birth euill night-crow cry'de aboding luckleſſe time dogs howl'd hiddeous tempeſt trees rauen rook'd chimnies top chatt'ring pies diſmall diſcords mother felt mothers paine yet brought forth leſſe mothers hope wit indigeſted deformed lumpe like fruit goodly tree teeth had'ſt head was't borne cam'ſt bite world reſt true haue heard cam'ſt— rich ile heare dye prophet stabbes among'ſt reſt ordain'd hen much god forgiue pardon dyes rich aſpiring blood lancaſter sinke ground thought would haue mounted see weepes poore kings death may purple teares alway thoſe wiſh downfall houſe life yet remaining downe downe hell thither stabs againe haue neyther pitty loue feare indeed true henrie told haue often heard mother came world legges forward reaſon thinke ye make haſt ruine vſurp'd right midwife wonder'd women cri'de ieſus bleſſe vs borne teeth plainly bite play dogge heauens haue body let hell make crook'd minde anſwer haue brother like brother word gray-beards call diuine reſident men like one another alone clarence beware keept'ſt light pitchy day buzze abroad propheſies edward fearefull life purge feare ile death king henry prince son gone clarence turne next reſt counting bad till beſt ile throw body another roome triumph henry day doome exit flouriſh enter king queene clarence richard haſtings nurſe attendants king englands royall throne re-purchac'd blood enemies valiant foe-men like autumnes corne haue mow'd downe tops pride three dukes somerſet threefold renowne hardy vndoubted champions two cliffords father sonne two northumberlands two brauer men ne're courſers trumpets two braue beares warwick montague chaines fetter'd kingly lyon made forreſt tremble roar'd thus haue suſpition seate made footſtoole security come hither beſſe let kiſſe boy yong ned thine vnckles haue armors watcht winters night went afoote summers heate might'ſt repoſſeſſe crowne peace labours reape gaine rich ile blaſt harueſt head laid yet look'd world ordain'd thicke heaue heaue waight breake backe worke way execute king clarence gloſter loue louely queene kis princely nephew brothers cla duty owe vnto maieſty seale vpon lips babe cla thanke noble clarence worthy brother thanks rich loue tree frō whence yu witneſſe louing kiſſe giue fruite truth iudas kiſt maſter cried haile meant harme king delights hauing countries peace brothers loues cla grace haue done margaret reynard father king france hath pawn'd sicils ieruſalem hither haue ranſome king away waft hence france reſts time triumphes mirthfull comicke befits pleaſure court sound drums trumpets farwell annoy heere hope begins laſting ioy exeunt omnes finis tragedy richard third landing earle richmond battell boſworth field actus primus scoena prima enter richard duke gloſter winter diſcontent made glorious summer son yorke clouds lowr'd vpon houſe deepe boſome ocean buried browes bound victorious wreathes bruiſed armes hung vp monuments alarums chang'd merry meetings dreadfull marches delightfull meaſures grim-viſag'd warre hath wrinkled front mounting barbed steeds fright soules fearfull aduerſaries capers nimbly ladies chamber laſciuious pleaſing lute trickes made court amorous looking-glaſſe rudely want loues maieſty wonton ambling nymph curtail'd faire proportion cheated feature diſſembling nature deform'd vn-finiſh'd time breathing world halfe made vp lamely vnfaſhionable dogges barke halt weake piping time peace haue delight paſſe away time vnleſſe shadow sunne deſcant mine owne deformity therefore cannot proue louer entertaine theſe faire well dayes determined proue villaine hate idle pleaſures theſe dayes plots haue laide inductions dangerous drunken propheſies libels dreames brother clarence king deadly hate one againſt king edward true iuſt subtle falſe treacherous day clarence cloſely mew'd vp propheſie edwards heyres murtherer diue thoughts downe clarence comes enter clarence brakenbury▪ guarded brother good day meanes armed guard waites vpon grace cla maieſty tendring perſons hath appointed conduct conuey point wiſedome far well hee'l done cowardly wakes neuer wake vntill great iudgement day hee'l vrging word iudgement hath bred kinde remorſe art affraid kill hauing warrant damn'd killing warrant defend thought had'ſt bin reſolute let liue ile backe duke glouſter tell nay prythee little hope paſſionate humor mine change wont hold one tels twenty do'ſt feele certaine dregges conſcience yet within mee remember reward deed's done come dies forgot reward where's conſcience duke glouſters purſe hee opens purſe giue vs reward conſcience flyes matter let goe there's none entertaine come againe ile meddle makes man coward man cannot accuſeth man cannot sweare checkes man cannot lye neighbours wife detects bluſhing mutinies mans boſome filles man full obſtacles made reſtore purſſe gold chance found beggars man keepes turn'd townes citties dangerous thing euery man means liue well endeuours truſt himſelfe liue vvithout euen elbow perſwading kill dkue take diuell minde beleeue would inſinuate make fram'd cannot preuaile spoke like tall man reſpects reputation come fall worke take coſtard hiltes sword throw malmeſey-butte next roome excellent deuice make soft wakes strike wee'l reaſon cla art keeper giue cup wine haue wine enough lord anon cla gods name art man cla royall loyall cla voice thunder looks humble voice kings lookes mine owne cla darkly deadly doſt eyes menace looke pale hither wherefore come to— cla murther cla haue hearts tell therefore cannot haue hearts wherein friends haue offended offended vs haue king cla reconcil'd againe neuer lord therefore prepare dye cla drawne forth among world men innocent offence euidence doth accuſe lawfull queſt haue giuen verdict vp vnto frowning iudge pronounc'd bitter poore clarence death conuict courſe law threaten death moſt vnlawfull charge hope goodneſſe depart lay hands deed vndertake damnable vpon command hath commanded king cla erroneous vaſſals great king kings hath table law commanded murther spurne edict fulfill mans take heed holds vengeance hand hurle vpon heads breake law vengeance doth hurle falſe forſwearing murther did'ſt receiue sacrament fight quarrell houſe lancaſter like traitor name god did'ſt breake vow treacherous blade vnrip'ſt bowels sou'raignes sonne was't cheriſh defend canſt vrge gods dreadfull law vs haſt broke deere degree cla alas whoſe ill deede edward brother whoſoe're lord haue deſerued death rich eyes witneſſe euill looke bewitch'd behold mine arme like blaſted sapling wither'd vp edwards wife monſtrous witch conſorted harlot strumpet shore witchcraft bleſt fairer life rich coſins qu coſins indeed vnckle couzend comfort kingdome kindred freedome life whoſe hand lanch'd tender hearts head indirectly gaue direction doubt murd'rous knife dull blunt till whetted heart reuell intrailes lambes vſe greefe makes wilde greefe tame tongue eares name boyes till nayles anchor'd thine eyes deſp'rate bay death like poore barke tackling roſe ruſh peeces merry ile man may weepe vpon wedding day actus primus scoena prima enter duke norfolke one doore duke buckingham lord aburgauenny buckingham good morrow well met haue ye done since laſt france norf thanke grace healthfull euer freſh admirer buck vntimely ague staid priſoner chamber thoſe sunnes glory thoſe two lights men met vale andren guynes arde preſent horſebacke beheld lighted clung embracement grew together they▪ foure thron'd ones could haue weigh'd compounded one buck whole time chambers priſoner loſt view earthly glory men might till time pompe married one aboue following day became next dayes maſter till laſt made former wonders it's day french clinquant gold like heathen gods shone downe engliſh morrow made britaine india euery man shew like mine▪ dwarfiſh pages cherubins gilt madams vs'd toyle almoſt beare pride vpon labour painting maske cry'de incompareable th' enſuing night made foole begger two kings equall luſtre beſt worſt preſence preſent eye still praiſe preſent one diſcerner durſt wagge tongue cenſure theſe sunnes phraſe heralds challeng'd noble spirits armes performe beyond thoughts compaſſe former fabulous storie poſſible enough got credit beuis beleeu'd buc oh go farre belong worſhip affect honor honeſty tract eu'ry thing would good diſcourſer looſe life actions tongue buc royall diſpoſing nought rebell'd order gaue thing view office diſtinctly full function guide meane body limbes great sport together gueſſe one certes promiſes element buſineſſe buc pray lord ordred good diſcretion right reuerend cardinall yorke buc diuell mans pye freed ambitious finger theſe fierce vanities wonder keech bulke take vp rayes o' th' beneficiall sun keepe earth surely sir there's put's theſe ends propt aunceſtry whoſe grace chalkes succeſſors way call'd vpon high feats done to' th' crowne neither allied eminent aſſiſtants spider-like selfe-drawing web giues vs note force owne merit makes way guift heauen giues buyes place next king abur cannot tell heauen hath giuen let grauer eye pierce pride peepe part whence ha's hell diuell niggard ha's giuen begins new hell himſelfe buc diuell vpon french going tooke vpon without priuity o' th' king t'appoint attend makes vp file gentry moſt part great charge little honor meant lay vpon owne letter honourable boord councell muſt fetch papers abur know kinſmen mine three leaſt haue eſtates neuer abound formerly buc many haue broke backes laying mannors great iourney vanity miniſter communication moſt poore iſſue greeuingly thinke peace betweene french vs valewes coſt conclude buc euery man hideous follow'd thing inſpir'd conſulting broke generall propheſie tempeſt daſhing garment peace aboaded breach on't budded france hath flaw'd league hath attach'd merchants goods burdeux abur therefore th' ambaſſador marry is't abur proper title peace purchas'd rate buc buſineſſe reuerend cardinall carried like grace state takes notice priuate difference betwixt cardinall aduiſe take heart wiſhes towards honor plenteous reade cardinals malice potency together conſider high hatred would effect wants miniſter power know nature he's reuengefull know sword hath edge it's long and't may reaches farre extend thither darts boſome vp counſell you'l finde wholeſome loe comes rock aduice enter cardinall wolſey purſe borne certaine guard two secretaries papers cardinall paſſage fixeth eye buckham buckingham full diſdaine car duke buckinghams surueyor ha where's examination secr heere pleaſe car perſon ready secr pleaſe grace car well know buckingham shall leſſen bigge looke exeunt cardinall traine buc butchers curre venom'd-mouth'd haue power muzzle therefore beſt wake beggers booke out-worths nobles blood chaff'd aske god temp'rance that's th' appliance onely diſeaſe requires buc read in's looks matter againſt eye reuil'd abiect obiect inſtant bores tricke he's gone to' th' king ile follow out-ſtare stay lord let reaſon choller queſtion go climbe hilles requires flow pace firſt anger like full hot horſe allow'd way selfe-mettle tyres man england aduiſe like would friend buc ile king mouth honor quite cry downe ipſwich fellowes inſolence proclaime there's difference maſter laſt coſtly treaty th' enteruiew much treaſure like glaſſe breake ith' wrenching norf faith buck pray giue fauour sir cunning cardinall articles o' th' combination drew himſelfe pleas'd ratified cride thus let much end giue crutch th' dead count-cardinall done tis well worthy wolſey cannot erre followes take kinde puppie th' old dam treaſon charles emperour vnder pretence queene aunt twas indeed colour came whiſper wolſey makes viſitation feares interview betwixt england france might amity breed preiudice league peep'd harmes menac'd priuily deales cardinal troa doe well emperour camp held learned man wol yes camp beleeue there's ill opinion euen lord cardinall wol camp enuide fearing would riſe vertuous kept forraigne man greeu'd ran mad dide wol heau'ns peace that's chriſtian care enough liuing murmurers there's places rebuke foole would needs vertuous good fellow command followes appointment haue none neere els learne brother liue grip'd meaner perſons kin deliuer modeſty th' queene exit gardiner moſt conuenient place thinke receipt learning black-fryers ye meete waighty buſines wolſey furniſh'd lord would grieue able man leaue bedfellow conſcience conſcience tender place muſt leaue exeunt scena tertia enter anne bullen old lady neither here's pang pinches highneſſe hauing liu'd long good lady tongue could euer pronounce diſhonour life neuer knew harme-doing oh many courſes sun enthroaned still growing maieſty pompe leaue thouſand fold bitter firſt t' acquire proceſſe giue auaunt pitty would moue monſter old la hearts moſt hard temper melt lament oh gods much better ne're knowne pompe though't temporall yet quarrell fortune diuorce bearer panging bodies old alas poore lady shee's againe much muſt pitty drop vpon verily tis better lowly borne range humble liuers content perk'd vp gliſtring griefe weare golden old content beſt hauing anne troth maidenhead would queene old beſhrew would venture maidenhead for't would hipocriſie haue faire parts woman haue womans heart euer yet affected eminence wealth soueraignty bleſſings guifts sauing mincing capacity chiuerell conſcience would receiue might pleaſe anne nay good troth old yes troth troth would queen anne riches vnder heauen old tis three pence bow'd would hire old queene pray thinke dutcheſſe haue limbs beare load title truth old weakly made plucke little would young count way bluſhing comes backe cannot vouchſafe burthen tis weake euer get boy doe talke againe would queene world old faith little england you'ld venture emballing would carnaruanſhire although long'd th' crowne lo comes enter lord chamberlaine cham good morrow ladies wer't worth know conference good lord demand values asking miſtris sorrowes pittying cham gentle buſineſſe becomming action good women hope well pray god amen cham beare gentle minde heau'nly bleſſings follow creatures may faire lady perceiue high notes tane many vertues kings maieſty commends good opinion doe's purpoſe honour leſſe flowing marchioneſſe pembrooke title thouſand pound yeare annuall grace addes doe know kinde obedience tender nothing prayers words duely hallowed wiſhes worth empty vanities yet prayers wiſhes returne lordſhip vouchſafe thankes obedience bluſh ng handmaid highneſſe whoſe health royalty pray cham lady faile t' approue faire conceit king hath haue perus'd well beauty honour mingled haue caught king knowes yet lady may proceed iemme lighten ile i'le king exit lord chamberlaine honour'd lord old see haue beene begging yeares court yet courtier beggerly could come pat betwixt early late pound oh fate freſh fiſh heere fye fye fye vpon compel'd fortune haue mouth fild vp open old taſts bitter forty pence lady tis old story would queene would mud egypt haue heard come pleaſant old court crier henry king england king heere scribe say katherine queene england come court crier katherine queene england queene makes anſwer riſes chaire goes court comes king kneeles feete sir deſire right iuſtice beſtow pitty moſt poore woman stranger borne dominions hauing heere iudge indifferent aſſurance equall friendſhip proceeding alas sir haue offended cauſe hath behauiour giuen diſpleaſure thus proceede put take good grace heauen witneſſe haue bene true humble wife times conformable euer feare kindle diſlike yea countenance glad inclin'd houre euer contradicted deſire made mine friends haue loue although knew mine enemy friend mine deriu'd anger continue liking nay gaue notice thence diſcharg'd sir call minde haue beene wife obedience vpward twenty yeares haue bene bleſt many children courſe proceſſe time report proue againſt mine honor aught bond wedlocke loue dutie againſt sacred perſon gods name turne away let fowl'ſt contempt shut doore vpon giue vp kinde iuſtice pleaſe sir king father reputed prince moſt prudent excellent vnmatch'd wit iudgement ferdinand father king spaine reckon'd one wiſeſt prince reign'd many yeare queſtion'd gather'd wiſe councell euery realme▪ debate buſineſſe deem'd marriage lawful wherefore humbly beſeech sir till may friends spaine aduis'd whoſe counſaile implore i' th' name god pleaſure fulfill'd wol haue heere lady choice theſe reuerend fathers men integrity learning yea elect o' th' land aſſembled pleade cauſe therefore bootleſſe longer deſire court well owne quiet rectifie vnſetled king camp grace hath well iuſtly therefore madam it's fit royall seſſion proceed without delay arguments produc'd heard qu lord cardinall wol pleaſure madam qu sir weepe thinking queene long haue dream'd certaine daughter king drops teares ile turne fire wol patient yet qu humble nay god puniſh beleeue induc'd potent circumſtances mine enemy make challenge iudge haue blowne coale betwixt lord gods dew quench therefore againe vtterly abhorre yea soule refuſe iudge yet hold moſt malicious foe thinke friend truth wol profeſſe like euer yet haue charity diſplayd th' effects diſpoſition gentle wiſedome ore-topping womans powre madam wrong haue spleene againſt iniuſtice farre haue proceeded farre shall warranted commiſſion conſiſtorie yea whole conſiſtorie rome charge haue blowne coale deny king preſent knowne gainſay deed may wound worthily falſehood yea much haue done truth know free report knowes wrong therefore lies cure cure remoue theſe thoughts highneſſe beſeech gracious madam vnthinke queen lord lord woman much weake t' oppoſe cunning y' meek humble-mouth'd place calling full meekeneſſe humilitie heart cramm'd arrogancie spleene pride haue fortune highneſſe fauors gone o're lowe mounted powres retainers words domeſtickes as't pleaſe pronounce office muſt tell tender perſons honor high profeſſion spirituall agen refuſe iudge heere appeale vnto pope bring whole cauſe holineſſe iudg'd curtſies king offers depart camp queene obſtinate stubborne iuſtice apt accuſe diſdainfull tride by't tis well shee's going away kin call againe crier katherine▪ england come court gent madam cald backe que need note pray keep way cald returne lord helpe vexe paſt patience pray paſſe tarry euer vpon buſineſſe appearance make courts exit queene attendants kin goe wayes kate man i' th' world report ha's better wife let naught truſted falſe art alone rare qualities gentleneſſe meekneſſe saint-like wife-like gouernment obeying commanding parts soueraigne piousels could queene earthly queenes shee's noble borne like true nobility ha's carried towards wol moſt gracious sir humbleſt manner require highnes pleaſe declare hearing theſe eares rob'd bound muſt vnloos'd although fully whether euer broach buſines highnes laid way might induce queſtion on't euer haue thankes god royall lady one leaſt word might preiudice preſent state touch good perſon kin lord cardinall doe excuſe yea vpon mine honour free from't taught haue many enemies know like village curres barke fellowes doe theſe queene put anger y' excus'd iuſtifi'de euer haue wiſh'd buſines neuer deſir'd oft haue hindred oft paſſages made toward honour good lord cardnall point thus farre cleare mou'd too't bold time attention marke th' inducement thus came giue heede too't conſcience firſt receiu'd tendernes scruple pricke certaine speeches vtter'd th' biſhop bayon french embaſſador beene hither debating marriage duke orleance daughter mary i' th' progreſſe buſines ere determinate reſolution hee meane biſhop require reſpite wherein might king lord aduertiſe whether daughter legitimate reſpecting marriage dowager sometimes brothers wife reſpite boſome conſcience enter'd yea power made tremble region breaſt forc'd way many maz'd conſiderings throng preſt caution firſt thought heauen commanded nature ladies wombe conceiu'd male-child doe offices life too't graue th' dead male iſſue di'de made ot world ayr'd hence tooke thought iudgement kingdome well worthy beſt heyre o' th' world gladded in't followes weigh'd danger realmes iſſues faile gaue many groaning throw thus hulling wild sea conſcience toward remedy whereupon preſent heere together that's meant rectifie conſcience feele full yet well reuerend fathers land doctors learn'd firſt began priuate lord lincolne remember vnder oppreſſion reeke firſt dowager widdow prince arthur cranmer's worthy fellow hath tane much paine kings buſineſſe suf ha's arch-byſhop heare suf enter wolſey cromwell cardinall obſerue obſerue hee's moody car packet cromwell gau't king crom owne hand in's bed-chamber card look'd o' th' inſide paper crom preſently vnſeale firſt view'd serious minde heede countenance bad attend heere morning card ready come abroad crom thinke card leaue exit cromwell dutches alanſon french kings siſter marry anne bullen ile anne bullens there's in't faire viſage bullen wee'l bullens speedily wiſh heare rome marchioneſſe penbroke thinkings moone worth conſidering king takes seat whiſpers louell goes cardinall car heauen forgiue euer god bleſſe highneſſe king good lord full heauenly beare inuentory beſt graces minde running o're haue time spirituall leyſure briefe keepe earthly audit deeme ill husband gald haue therein companion car sir holy offices haue time time thinke vpon part buſineſſe beare i' th' state nature require times preſeruation perforce fraile among'ſt brethren mortall muſt giue tendance king haue well car euer may highneſſe yoake together lend cauſe well well king well agen kinde good deede well yet words deeds father lou'd deed crowne word vpon since office haue kept next heart haue alone imploy'd high profits might come home par'd preſent hauings beſtow bounties vpon car meane sur lord increaſe buſineſſe king haue made prime man state pray tell pronounce haue found true▪ may confeſſe withall bound vs car soueraigne confeſſe royall graces showr'd daily haue bene could purpoſes requite went beyond mans endeauors endeauors haue euer come deſires yet fill'd abilities mine owne ends haue beene mine euermore pointed to' th' good moſt sacred perſon profit state great graces heap'd vpon poore vndeſeruer nothing render allegiant thankes prayres heauen loyaltie euer ha's euer growing till death winter kill king fairely anſwer'd loyall obedient subiect therein illuſtrated honor pay act i' th' contrary fowleneſſe puniſhment preſume hand ha's open'd bounty heart drop'd loue powre rain'd honor hand heart braine euery function power notwithſtanding bond duty loues particular friend car profeſſe highneſſe good euer labour'd mine owne haue though world cracke duty throw soule though perils abound thicke thought could make appeare formes horrid yet duty doth rocke againſt chiding flood approach wilde riuer breake vnſhaken king nobly take notice lords ha's loyall breſt haue open't read o're breakfaſt appetite haue exit king frowning vpon cardinall nobles throng whiſpering car meane anger's haue reap'd parted frowning ruine leap'd eyes lookes chafed lyon vpon daring huntſman gall'd makes nothing muſt reade paper feare story anger paper ha's vndone th' accompt world wealth haue drawne together mine owne ends indeed gaine popedome fee friends rome negligence fit foole fall croſſe diuell made put maine secret packet king way cure new deuice beate braines know yet know way take right fortune bring againe what's th' pope letter liue buſineſſe writ too's holineſſe nay farewell haue touch'd higheſt point greatneſſe full meridian glory haſte setting fall like bright exhalation euening man enter woolſey dukes norfolke suffolke earle surrey lord chamberlaine heare kings pleaſure cardinall commands render vp great seale preſently hands confine aſher-houſe lord wincheſters till heare highneſſe car stay where's commiſſion lords words cannot carrie authority weighty suf dare croſſe bearing kings mouth expreſſely car till finde words meane malice know officious lords dare muſt deny feele courſe mettle ye molded enuy eagerly ye follow diſgraces fed ye wanton ye appeare euery thing may bring ruine follow enuious courſes men malice haue chriſtian warrant doubt time finde fit rewards seale aske violence king mine maſter owne hand gaue bad enioy place honors life confirme goodneſſe ti'de letters patents who'll take sur king gaue car muſt himſelfe sur art proud traitor prieſt car proud lord lyeſt within theſe fortie houres surrey durſt better haue burnt tongue sur ambition scarlet robb'd bewailing land noble buckingham father-in-law heads brother-cardinals beſt parts bound together weigh'd haire plague policie deputie ireland farre king might haue mercie fault gau'ſt whil'ſt great goodneſſe holy pitty abſolu'd axe wol elſe talking lord lay vpon credit anſwer moſt falſe duke law found deſerts innocent priuate malice end noble iurie foule cauſe witneſſe lou'd many words lord tell haue little honeſtie honor way loyaltie truth toward king euer roiall maſter dare mate man surrie loue follies sur soule long coat prieſt protects feele sword i' th' life blood elſe lords ye endure heare arrogance fellow liue thus tamely thus iaded peece scarlet farewell nobilitie let grace go forward dare vs cap like larkes card goodneſſe poyſon stomacke sur yes goodneſſe gleaning lands wealth one owne hands card'nall extortion goodneſſe intercepted packets writ pope againſt king goodneſſe since prouoke moſt notorious lord norfolke truly noble reſpect common good state deſpis'd nobilitie iſſues liue gentlemen produce grand articles collected life ile worſe sacring bell browne wench lay kiſſing armes lord cardinall car much thinkes could deſpiſe man bound charitie againſt thoſe articles lord kings hand thus much foule ones wol much fairer mine innocence ariſe king knowes truth sur cannot thanke memorie yet remember theſe articles bluſh crie guiltie cardinall you'l little honeſtie wol speake sir dare worſt obiections bluſh nobleman want manners sur rather want thoſe head haue firſt without kings aſſent knowledge wrought legate power maim'd iuriſdiction biſhops writ rome elſe forraigne princes ego rex meus inſcrib'd brought king seruant suf without knowledge either king councell went ambaſſador emperor made bold carry flanders great seale sur item large commiſſion gregory de caſſado conclude without kings states allowance league betweene highneſſe ferrara suf meere ambition haue caus'd holy-hat kings coine sur haue inumerable meanes got leaue owne conſcience furniſh rome prepare wayes haue dignities meere vndooing kingdome many odious taint mouth cham lord preſſe falling man farre vertue faults lye open lawes let em correct heart weepes little great selfe sur forgiue suf lord cardinall kings pleaſure becauſe thoſe things haue done late power legatiue within kingdome fall into' th' compaſſe premunire therefore writ againſt forfeit goods lands tenements caſtles whatſoeuer kings protection charge wee'l leaue meditations liue better anſwer giuing backe great seale vs king know doubt thanke fare well little good lord cardinall exeunt wolſey wol farewell little good beare farewell long farewell greatneſſe man day puts forth tender leaues hopes morrow bloſſomes beares bluſhing honors thicke vpon third day comes froſt killing froſt thinkes good eaſie man full greatneſſe ripening nippes roote fals haue ventur'd like little wanton boyes bladders many summers sea glory farre beyond depth high-blowne pride length broke vnder ha's left weary old seruice mercy rude muſt downe let proudeſt hee dares moſt wag finger that's holy better thinke place becomes sur may pleaſe grace;— kin sir doe's pleaſe thought men vnderſtanding wiſedome councell finde none diſcretion lords gallowes hang'd ye rogue place roare fetch dozen crab-tree ones theſe ile heads muſt chriſtenings looke ale cakes heere rude raskalls man pray sir patient much impoſſible vnleſſe wee dore cannons make por doe knock downe th' dozens fields muſter haue wee indian great toole come court women beſiege vs bleſſe fry fornication dore chriſtian conſcience one chriſtening beget thouſand bee father god-father together man spoones bigger sir fellow neere doore braſier face o' conſcience twenty dog-dayes reigne in's noſe vnder line need pennance fire-drake hit three times head three times noſe diſcharged againſt mee hee like morter-piece blow vs habberdaſhers wife wit neere rail'd vpon till pinck'd porrenger fell head kindling combuſtion state miſt meteor hit woman cryed clubbes might farre let theſe faithfull friends o' th' suburbs haue great roome doubt left ladies paſſe backe chriſtening por and't pleaſe honour men many may doe torne pieces haue done army cannot rule cham liue king blame for't ile lay ye th' heeles heads clap round fines neglect y' lazy knaues heere ye lye baiting bombards ye doe seruice harke trumpets th' come already chriſtening go breake among preaſſe finde th' body idle vnactiue still cubbording viand neuer bearing like labour reſt th' inſtruments heare deuiſe inſtruct walke feele mutually participate miniſter vnto appetite affection common whole body common finde publique benefit receiue proceeds comes way thinke great toe aſſembly cit great toe great toe men one o' th loweſt baſeſt pooreſt moſt wiſe rebellion goeſt formoſt raſcall art worſt blood run lead'ſt firſt win vantage make ready bats clubs rome rats point battell one muſt haue baile enter caius martius hayle noble martius mar thanks what's matter diſſentious rogues rubbing poore itch opinion make scabs cit haue euer good word mar giue good words wil flatter beneath abhorring would haue curres like peace warre one affrights makes proud truſts finde lyons findes hares foxes geeſe coale fire vpon ice hailſtone sun vertue make worthy whoſe offence curſe iuſtice deſerues greatnes deſerues hate affections appetite deſires moſt would encreaſe euill depends vpon fauours finnes leade hewes downe oakes ruſhes hang ye truſt ye euery minute change minde call noble hate vilde garland what's matter theſe places citie cry againſt noble senate vnder gods keepe awe elſe would feede one another what's men corne owne rates wherof citie well mar hang they'l th' fire preſume know what's done i' th capitoll who's like riſe thriues declines side factions giue coniecturall marriages making parties feebling liking cobled shooes ther's grain enough would nobility lay aſide ruth let vſe sword i'de make quarrie thouſands theſe quarter'd high could picke lance menen nay theſe almoſt thoroughly perſwaded though abundantly lacke diſcretion yet paſsing cowardly beſeech troope mar diſſolu'd hang em hungry forth prouerbes hunger-broke wals dogges muſt eate meate made mouths gods corne richmen onely theſe vented complainings anſwer'd petition granted one breake heart generoſity make bold power looke pale threw caps would hang hornes a' th moone shooting emulation menen graunted mar fiue tribunes defend vulgar wiſdom owne choice one's iunius brutus sicinius velutus know sdeath rabble haue firſt vnroo'ft city ere preuayl'd time win vpon power throw forth greater theames inſurrections arguing menen mar go get home fragments enter meſſenger haſtily meſſ where's caius martius mar heere what's matter meſ newes volcies armes mar glad on't ha meanes vent muſtie see beſt elders enter sicinius velutus annius brutus cominius titus lartius senatours sen martius true haue lately told vs volces armes mar haue leader tullus auffidius put too't enuying nobility thing would wiſh onely com haue fought together mar halfe halfe world th' eares vpon partie i'de reuolt make onely warres lion proud hunt sen worthy martius attend vpon cominius theſe warres com former promiſe mar sir conſtant titus lucius shalt tullus face art stand'ſt tit caius martius ile leane vpon one crutch fight tother ere behinde buſineſſe men oh true-bred sen company to' th' capitoll know greateſt friends attend vs tit lead follow cominius muſt followe right worthy priority com noble martius sen hence homes gone mar nay let follow volces haue much corne take theſe rats thither gnaw garners worſhipfull mutiners valour puts well forth pray follow exeunt citizens away manet sicin brutus sicin euer man proud martius bru equall sicin choſen tribunes people bru mark'd lip eyes sicin nay taunts bru mou'd gird gods sicin bemocke modeſt moone bru preſent warres deuoure growne proud valiant sicin nature tickled good diſdaines treads noone wonder inſolence brooke commanded vnder cominius bru fame aymes already he's well grac'd cannot better held attain'd place firſt miſcarries shall generals fault though performe th' vtmoſt man giddy cenſure cry martius oh borne buſineſſe sicin doe head good patricians muſt viſited haue receiu'd onely greetings change honors volum haue liued inherited wiſhes buildings fancie onely there's one thing wanting doubt rome caſt vpon cor know good mother rather way com capitall flouriſh cornets exeunt state enter brutus scicinius bru tongues bleared pratling nurſe rapture lets baby crie chats kitchin malkin pinnes richeſt lockram reechie necke clambring walls eye stalls bulkes windowes vp leades fill'd ridges hors'd variable complexions agreeing earneſtneſſe flamins doe preſſe among popular throngs puffe winne vulgar veyl'd dames commit warre white damaske nicely gawded cheekes toth' wanton phoebus burning kiſſes poother whatſoeuer god leades crept humane powers gaue gracefull poſture scicin warrant conſull brutus office may power goe scicin cannot temp'rately tranſport honors begin end loſe thoſe hath wonne brutus there's comfort scici doubt commoners vpon ancient mallice forget leaſt cauſe theſe new honors giue make little queſtion prowd doo't brutus heard conſull neuer would appeare i' th' market place put naples veſture humilitie manner wounds toth' people begge breaths scicin right brutus word oh would miſſe rather carry gentry deſire nobles scicin wiſh better haue hold purpoſe put execution brutus moſt like scicin good wills deſtruction brutus muſt fall authorities end muſt people hatred hath held to's power would haue made mules pleaders diſpropertied freedomes holding humane action capacitie soule fitneſſe world cammels warre haue prouand onely bearing burthens blowes vnder scicin time inſolence shall teach people time want put vpon't that's eaſie dogges sheepe fire kindle dry stubble blaze shall darken euer enter meſſenger brutus what's matter meſſ capitoll thought martius conſull haue dumbe men throng blind heare matrons flong gloues ladies maids scarffes handkerchers vpon paſs'd nobles bended ioues statue commons made shower thunder caps showts neuer like brutus let's capitoll carry vs eares eyes th' time hearts euent scicin haue exeunt enter two officers lay cuſhions capitoll come come almoſt many conſulſhips three thought euery one coriolanus carry that's braue fellow hee's vengeance prowd loues common people hath beene many great men haue flatter'd people ne're loued many haue loued know wherefore loue know hate vpon better ground therefore coriolanus neyther care whether loue hate manifeſts true knowledge ha's diſpoſition noble careleſneſſe lets plainely care whether loue hee waued indifferently neyther good harme hee hate greater deuotion render leaues nothing vndone may fully diſcouer oppoſite affect mallice diſpleaſure people bad diſlikes flatter loue hee hath deſerued worthily countrey aſſent eaſie degrees thoſe hauing beene courteous people bonnetted without deed haue eſtimation report hee hath planted honors eyes actions hearts tongues confeſſe much kinde ingratefull iniurie report otherwiſe mallice giuing lye would plucke reproofe rebuke euery eare heard hee's worthy man make way comming sennet enter patricians tribunes people lictors coriolanus menenius cominius conſul scicinius brutus take places themſelues coriolanus menen hauing determin'd volces titus lartius remaines maine point after-meeting gratifie noble hath thus countrey therefore pleaſe moſt reuerend graue elders deſire preſent conſull laſt generall well-found succeſſes report little worthy worke perform'd martius caius coriolanus met thanke remember honors like himſelfe sen speake good cominius leaue nothing length make vs thinke rather defectiue requitall maſters a' th' people doe requeſt kindeſt eares louing motion toward common body yeeld paſſes scicin conuented vpon pleaſing treatie haue hearts inclinable honor aduance theame aſſembly brutus rather wee bleſt doe remember kinder value people hath hereto priz'd menen that's that's would rather pleaſe heare cominius brutus moſt willingly yet caution pertinent rebuke giue menen loues people tye bed-fellow worthie cominius coriolanus riſes offers goe away nay keepe place senat sit coriolanus neuer heare haue nobly done coriol honors pardon rather haue wounds heale againe heare got brutus sir hope words dis-bench'd coriol sir yet oft blowes haue made fled words therefore hurt people loue weigh— menen pray downe corio rather haue one head i' th' sun alarum idly heare nothings monſter'd exit coriolanus menen maſters people multiplying spawne flatter that's thouſand one good one rather venture limbes honor ones eares heare proceed cominius com lacke voyce deeds coriolanus vtter'd feebly held valour chiefeſt vertue moſt dignifies hauer man cannot world counter-poys'd yeeres tarquin made head rome fought beyond marke others dictator prayſe point fight amazonian shinne droue brizled lippes beſtrid o're-preſt roman i' th' conſuls view slew three oppoſers tarquins met knee dayes feates might act woman scene prou'd beſt man i' th' field meed brow-bound oake pupill age man-entred thus waxed like sea brunt battailes lurcht swords garland laſt corioles let cannot home flyers rare example made coward turne terror weeds veſſell vnder men obey'd fell stem sword deaths marke tooke face foot thing blood whoſe euery motion tim'd dying cryes alone entred mortall gate th' citie painted deſtinie aydeleſſe came re-inforcement carioles like planet all's dinne warre gan pierce readie doubled requickned fleſh fatigate battaile came runne reeking o're liues men perpetuall till call'd field citie neuer eaſe breſt panting menen worthy man senat cannot meaſure fit honors deuiſe com kickt look'd vpon things precious common muck world couets leſſe miſerie would giue rewards deeds content time▪ end menen hee's right noble let call'd senat call coriolanus doth appeare enter coriolanus menen senate coriolanus well pleas'd make conſull corio doe owe life seruices menen remaines doe people corio doe beſeech let o're-leape cuſtome cannot put gowne naked entreat wounds giue pleaſe may paſſe scicin sir people muſt haue voyces neyther bate one iot ceremonie menen put too't pray goe fit cuſtome take predeceſſors haue honor forme corio part bluſh acting might well taken people brutus marke corio brag vnto thus thus shew th' vnaking skarres hide receiu'd hyre breath onely menen doe vpon't recommend tribunes people purpoſe noble conſull wiſh ioy honor senat coriolanus alſo tell noble acceptance ingratitude monſtrous multitude ingratefull make monſter multitude members bring monſtrous members cit make vs better thought little helpe vp corne himſelfe call vs many-headed multitude cit haue beene call'd many heads browne blacke abram bald wits diuerſly coulord truely thinke wittes iſſue one scull would flye eaſt weſt north south conſent one direct way points a' th compaſſe cit thinke way iudge wit would flye cit nay wit another mans wadg'd vp blocke-head liberty southward cit way cit looſe fogge three parts melted away rotten dewes fourth would returne conſcience helpe get wife cit neuer without trickes may may cit reſolu'd giue voyces that's matter greater part carries hee would incline people neuer worthier man enter coriolanus gowne humility menenius heere comes gowne humility marke behauiour altogether come ones twoes threes he's make requeſts particulars wherein euerie one vs ha's honor giuing voices owne tongues therefore follow ile direct go content content men oh sir right haue knowne worthieſt men haue done't corio muſt pray sir plague vpon't cannot bring tougue pace looke sir wounds got countries seruice certaine brethren roar'd ranne th' noiſe owne drummes menen oh gods muſt muſt deſire thinke vpon coriol thinke vpon hang would would forget like vertues diuines loſe em men you'l marre ile leaue pray em pray wholſome manner exit enter three citizens corio bid waſh faces keepe teeth cleane heere comes brace know cauſe sir heere cit sir tell vs hath brought too't corio mine owne deſert cit owne deſert corio mine owne deſire cit owne deſire corio sir neuer deſire yet trouble poore begging cit muſt thinke giue thing hope gaine corio well pray price a' th' conſulſhip cit price aske kindly corio kindly pray let ha't haue wounds bee priuate good voice sir cit ha't worthy sir corio match sir there's two worthie voyces begg'd haue almes adieu cit odde cit giue againe matter exeunt enter two citizens coriol
