admit meet anon vpon approbation corio senate-houſe scicin coriolanus corio may change theſe garments scicin may sir cori ile knowing repayre toth' senate-houſe mene ile keepe company along brut people scicin fare well exeunt coriol mene ha's lookes thinkes warme at's heart brut prowd heart wore humble weeds diſmiſſe people enter plebeians scici maſters haue choſe man cit ha's voyces sir brut pray gods may deſerue loues cit amen sir poore vnworthy notice mock'd vs begg'd voyces cit certainely flowted vs downe-right cit kind mock vs cit one amongſt vs vs'd vs haue vs marks merit wounds receiu'd for's countrey scicin man cit hee hee wounds could priuate hat thus wauing would conſull aged cuſtome voyces permit voyces therefore graunted thanke voyces thanke moſt voyces haue left voyces haue mockerie scicin eyther ignorant childiſh friendlineſſe yeeld voyces brut could haue told leſſon'd power pettie state enemie euer ke againſt liberties charters beare i' th' body weale arriuing place potencie o' th' state malignantly remaine faſt foe toth' plebeij voyces might curſes haue worthy deeds clayme leſſe gracious nature would thinke vpon voyces tranſlate mallice towards loue standing friendly lord scicin thus haue fore-aduis'd toucht spirit try'd inclinations pluckt eyther gracious promiſe might cauſe call'd vp haue held elſe would haue gall'd nature eaſily endures article tying ought putting rage haue ta'ne th' aduantage choller paſs'd vnelected brut perceiue free contempt need loues▪ doe thinke contempt bruſing hath power cruſh bodyes heart among tongues cry againſt rectorſhip iudgement scicin haue ere deny'd er againe aske mock beſtow tongues cit hee's confirm'd may deny yet cit deny ile haue fiue hundred voyces cit twice fiue hundred friends piece brut get hence inſtantly tell thoſe friends haue choſe conſull take liberties make voyce dogges often beat barking therefore kept doe scici let aſſemble iudgement reuoke ignorant election enforce pride old hate vnto beſides forget contempt wore humble weed suit loues thinking vpon seruices tooke th' apprehenſion preſent portance moſt gibingly vngrauely faſhion inueterate hate beares brut lay fault vs tribunes labour'd impediment betweene muſt caſt election scici say choſe commandment guided owne true affections minds pre-occupy'd rather muſt made againſt graine voyce conſull lay fault vs brut vs say read lectures youngly began countrey long continued noble houſe▪ o' th' martians whence came ancus martius numaes daughters sonne great hoſtilius king houſe publius quintus beſt water brought conduits hither nobly nam'd twice cenſor great anceſtor scicin one thus deſcended hath beſide well perſon wrought high place commend remembrances haue found skaling preſent bearing paſt hee's fixed enemie reuoke approbation brut say ne're don't harpe putting preſently haue drawne number repaire toth' capitoll almoſt repent election exeunt plebeians brut let goe mutinie better put hazard paſt doubt greater nature fall rage refuſall obſerue anſwer vantage anger scicin toth' capitoll come o' th' people partly owne haue goaded on-ward exeunt actus tertius cornets enter coriolanus menenius gentry cominius titus latius senators corio tullus auffidius made new head latius lord caus'd compoſition corio volces firſt readie time prompt make roade vpon's againe com worne lord conſull hardly ages banners waue againe corio saw auffidius latius came curſe againſt volces vildly yeelded towne retyred antium corio spoke latius lord corio latius often met sword sword things vpon earth hated perſon moſt would pawne fortunes hopeleſſe reſtitution might call'd vanquiſher corio antium liues latius antium corio wiſh cauſe oppoſe hatred fully welcome home enter scicinius brutus behold theſe tribunes people tongues o' th' common mouth deſpiſe doe pranke authoritie againſt noble scicin paſſe cor hah brut dangerous goe on— corio makes change mene matter com hath paſs'd noble common brut cominius corio haue childrens voyces senat tribunes giue way toth' market place brut people incens'd againſt scicin stop fall broyle corio theſe heard muſt theſe haue voyces yeeld diſclaim toungs offices mouthes rule teeth haue mene calme calme corio purpos'd thing growes plot curbe nobilitie suffer't liue cannot rule euer ruled brut call't plot people cry mockt late corne giuen gratis repin'd scandal'd suppliants people call'd time-pleaſers flatterers foes nobleneſſe corio knowne brut corio haue inform'd brut informe com like doe buſineſſe brut vnlike way better corio conſull yond clouds let deſerue ill make fellow tribune scicin much people paſſe bound muſt enquire way gentler neuer noble conſull yoake tribune mene let's calme com people abus'd paltring becomes rome ha's coriolanus deſeru'd diſhonor'd rub layd falſely i' th' plaine way merit corio tell corne againe mene senat heat sir corio liue nobler friends craue pardons mutable ranke-ſented meynie let regard doe flatter therein behold themſelues againe nouriſh senate cockle rebellion inſolence sedition haue plowed mingling vs honor'd number lack vertue power haue giuen beggers mene well senat words beſeech corio country haue blood fearing outward force lungs coine words till decay againſt thoſe meazels diſdaine tetter vs yet way catch bru a' th' people god puniſh man infirmity sicin well let people know't mene choller cor choller patient midnight ioue minde sicin minde remain poiſon poyſon corio shall remaine heare triton minnoues marke abſolute shall com cannon cor shall god moſt vnwiſe patricians graue wreakleſſe senators haue thus giuen hidra heere chooſe officer peremptory shall horne noiſe o' th' monſters wants hee'l turne current ditch make channell haue power vale ignorance none awake dangerous lenity learn'd common fooles let haue cuſhions plebeians senators leſſe voices blended great'ſt taſte moſt pallates chooſe magiſtrate one puts shall popular shall againſt grauer bench euer frown'd greece ioue himſelfe makes conſuls baſe soule akes know two authorities vp neither supreame confuſion may enter gap take one th' com well to' th' market place corio euer gaue counſell giue forth corne a' th' store-houſe gratis vs'd sometime greece mene well well cor thogh people abſolute powre noriſht diſobedience fed ruin state bru people giue one thus voyce corio ile giue reaſons worthier voyces know corne recompence reſting well aſſur'd ne're for't preſt to' th' warre euen nauell state touch'd would thred gates kinde seruice deſerue corne gratis i' th' warre mutinies reuolts wherein moſt valour th' accuſation haue often made againſt senate cauſe vnborne could neuer natiue franke donation well boſome-multiplied digeſt senates courteſie let deeds expreſſe what's like words requeſt greater pole true feare gaue vs demands thus debaſe nature seats make rabble call cares feares time breake ope lockes a' th' senate bring crowes pecke eagles mene come enough bru enough ouer meaſure corio take may diuine humane seale end withall double worſhip whereon part do's diſdaine cauſe inſult without reaſon gentry title wiſedom cannot conclude yea generall ignorance muſt omit reall neceſſities giue way vnſtable slightneſſe purpoſe barr'd followes nothing done purpoſe therefore beſeech leſſe fearefull diſcreet loue fundamentall part state doubt change on't preferre noble life long wiſh iumpe body dangerous phyſicke that's death without plucke multitudinous tongue let icke poyſon diſhonor mangles true iudgement bereaues state integrity becom't hauing power good would th' ill doth controul't bru enough sicin ha's like traitor anſwer traitors corio wretch deſpight ore-whelme people theſe bald tribunes depending obedience failes to' th' greater bench rebellion what's mee muſt law choſen better houre let meet muſt meet throw power i' th' duſt bru manifeſt treaſon sicin conſull enter aedile bru ediles hoe let apprehended sicin go call people whoſe name selfe attach traitorous innouator foe to' th' publike weale obey charge follow thine anſwer corio hence old goat wee'l surety com ag'd hands-off corio hence rotten thing bones garments sicin helpe ye citizens enter rabble plebeians aediles mene reſpect sicin heere's hee would take power bru seize aediles downe downe sen weapons weapons weapons buſtle coriolanus tribunes patricians citizens ho sicinius brutus coriolanus citizens peace peace peace hold peace mene breath confuſions neere cannot tribunes to' th' people coriolanus patience speak good sicinius scici heare people peace let's tribune peace scici point loſe liberties martius would haue martius late haue nam'd conſull mene fie fie fie way kindle quench sena vnbuild citie lay flat scici citie people true people citie brut conſent eſtabliſh'd peoples magiſtrates remaine mene like doe com way lay citie flat bring roofe foundation burie yet diſtinctly raunges heapes piles ruine scici deſerues death brut let vs authoritie let vs loſe doe pronounce vpon part o' th' people whoſe power elected martius worthy preſent death scici therefore lay hold beare toth' rock tarpeian thence deſtruction caſt brut aediles ple yeeld martius yeeld mene heare one word tribunes heare word aediles peace peace mene truly countries friend temp rately proceed would thus violently redreſſe brut sir thoſe cold wayes like prudent helpes poyſonous diſeaſe violent lay hands vpon beare rock corio drawes sword corio ile die there's among haue beheld fighting come trie vpon haue mene downe sword tribunes withdraw brut lay hands vpon mene helpe martius helpe noble helpe young old downe downe exeunt mutinie tribunes aediles people beat mene goe get houſe gone away naught elſe sena get gone com stand faſt haue many friends enemies mene shall put sena gods forbid prythee noble friend home houſe leaue vs cure cauſe mene sore vpon vs cannot tent gone corio come sir along vs mene would barbarians though rome litter'd romans though calued i' th' porch o' th' capitoll gone put worthy rage tongue one time owe another corio faire ground could beat fortie mene could take vp brace o' th' beſt yea two tribunes com oddes beyond arithmetick manhood call'd foolerie againſt falling fabrick hence tagge returne whoſe rage doth rend like interrupted waters o're-beare vs'd beare mene pray gone ile trie whether old wit requeſt thoſe haue little muſt patcht cloth colour com nay come away exeunt coriolanus cominius patri man ha's marr'd fortune mene nature noble world would flatter neptune trident ioue for's power thunder heart's mouth breſt forges tongue muſt vent angry forget euer heard name death noiſe within here's goodly worke patri would bed mene would tyber vengeance could faire enter brutus sicinius rabble againe sicin viper would depopulate city euery man himſelf mene worthy tribunes sicin throwne downe tarpeian rock rigorous hands hath reſiſted law therefore law triall publike power naught cit well know noble tribunes peoples mouths hands mene sir sicin peace cry hauocke hunt modeſt warrant sicin sir com'ſt haue holpe make reſcue mene heere know conſuls worthineſſe name faults sicin conſull conſull mene conſull coriolanus bru conſull mene tribunes leaue good people may heard would craue word two turne harme much loſſe time sic speake breefely peremptory diſpatch viporous traitor eiect hence one danger keepe heere certaine death therefore decreed dyes night menen good gods forbid renowned rome▪ whoſe gratitude towards deſerued children enroll'd ioues owne booke like vnnaturall dam eate vp owne sicin he's diſeaſe muſt cut away mene oh he's limbe ha's diſeaſe mortall cut cure eaſie ha's done rome that's worthy death killing enemies blood hath loſt dare vouch hath many ounce dropp'd country left looſe countrey vs doo't brand th' end world sicin cleane kamme brut meerely awry loue country honour'd menen foote gangren'd reſpected bru wee'l heare purſue houſe plucke thence leaſt infection catching nature spred menen one word one word tiger-footed-rage find harme vnskan'd late tye leaden pounds too's heeles proceed proceſſe leaſt parties belou'd breake great rome romanes brut sicin ye talke haue taſte obedience ediles reſiſted come mene conſider ha's bin bred i' th' warres since could draw sword ill boulted language meale bran together throwes without diſtinction giue leaue ile go vndertake bring peace anſwer lawfull forme peace vtmoſt perill sen noble tribunes humane way courſe proue bloody end vnknowne beginning sic noble menenius peoples officer maſters lay downe weapons bru go home sic meet market place wee'l attend bring martius wee'l proceede firſt way menen ile bring let deſire company muſt come worſt follow sena pray let's exeunt omnes enter coriolanus nobles corio let pull mine eares preſent death wheele wilde horſes heeles pile ten hilles tarpeian rocke precipitation might downe beame yet thus enter volumnia noble nobler corio muſe mother do's approue wont call wollen vaſſailes things created buy groats bare heads congregations yawne wonder one ordinance vp peace warre talke wiſh milder would haue falſe nature rather play man oh would haue put power well worne corio let go vol might haue beene enough man leſſe leſſer bin things diſpoſitions ye diſpos'd ere lack'd power croſſe corio let hang volum burne enter menenius senators men come come haue bin rough rough muſt returne mend sen there's remedy vnleſſe good citie cleaue midd'ſt periſh volum pray counſail'd haue heart little apt yet braine leades vſe anger better vantage mene well noble woman thus to' th' heart violent fit a' th' time craues phyſicke whole state would put mine armour beare corio muſt mene returne th' tribunes corio well mene repent haue corio cannot gods muſt doo't volum abſolute though therein neuer noble extremities haue heard honor policy like vnſeuer'd friends i' th' warre grow together grant tell peace th' looſe combine corio tuſh tuſh mene good demand honor warres beſt ends adopt policy leſſe worſe hold companionſhip peace honour warre like requeſt corio force becauſe lyes th' people owne inſtruction by' th' matter heart prompts words roated tongue though baſtards syllables allowance boſomes truth diſhonors take towne gentle words elſe would put fortune hazard much blood would diſſemble nature fortunes friends requir'd honor wife sonne theſe senators nobles rather generall lowts frowne fawne vpon inheritance loues want might ruine menen noble lady come goe vs faire may dangerous preſent loſſe paſt pry sonne goe bonnet hand thus farre hauing knee buſſing buſineſſe action eloquence eyes th' ignorant learned eares wauing head often thus correcting heart humble ripeſt mulberry hold handling art souldier bred broyles haſt way do'ſt confeſſe fit vſe clayme asking good loues wilt frame forſooth hereafter farre haſt power perſon menen done euen hearts haue pardons ask'd free words little purpoſe volum prythee goe rul'd although know hadſt rather follow thine enemie fierie gulfe flatter bower enter cominius cominius com haue beene i' th' market place sir fit make partie defend calmeneſſe abſence all's anger menen onely faire com thinke thereto frame volum muſt prythee goe corio muſt goe vnbarb'd sconce muſt baſe tongue giue noble heart lye muſt beare well doo't yet plot looſe mould martius duſt grinde throw't againſt winde toth' market place haue put part neuer diſcharge toth' life com come come wee'le prompt volum prythee son haſt praiſes made firſt souldier haue praiſe performe part haſt done corio well muſt doo't away diſpoſition poſſeſſe harlots throat warre turn'd quier'd drumme pipe small eunuch virgin voyce babies lull a-ſleepe knaues tent cheekes schoole-boyes teares take vp glaſſes beggars tongue make motion lips arm'd knees bow'd stirrop bend like hath receiu'd almes doo't leaft honor mine owne truth bodies action teach minde moſt inherent baſeneſſe volum choice begge diſ-honor come ruine let mother rather feele pride feare dangerous stoutneſſe mocke death bigge heart liſt valiantneſſe mine owe pride corio pray content mother going market place chide ile mountebanke loues cogge hearts come home belou'd trades rome looke going commend wife ile returne conſull neuer truſt tongue i' th way flattery volum exit volumnia▪ com away tribunes attend arm anſwer mildely prepar'd accuſations heare gods hourely synod particular proſperity loue worſe old father menenius do's son soul art preparing fire vs looke heere's water quench hardly moued come beeing aſſured none could moue haue bene blowne th' volcian lords plainly haue borne buſineſſe auf onely ends haue reſpected stopt eares againſt generall rome neuer admitted priuat whiſper frends thought corio laſt old man crack'd heart haue rome lou'd aboue meaſure father nay godded indeed lateſt refuge whoſe old loue haue though offer'd firſt conditions refuſe cannot accept grace onely thought could little haue yeelded freſh embaſſes suites mine would neuer diſhonour traytor reſtore lauinia emperour luc dead wife anothers lawfull promiſt loue enter aloft emperour tamora two aaron moore empe titus▪ emperour needs ile truſt leiſure mocks fooliſh tribune mine theſe confedrates deed hath diſhonoured family vnworthy brother vnworthy sonnes luci let vs giue buriall becomes giue mutius buriall bretheren tit traytors away reſt's tombe monument fiue hundreth yeares hath haue sumptuouſly re-edified heere none souldiers romes seruitors repoſe fame none baſely braules bury comes heere mar lord impiety nephew mutius deeds plead muſt buried bretheren titus two sonnes accompany ti villaine word titus would vouch'd place heere tit would bury deſpight mar noble titus intreat pardon mutius bury tit marcus euen haſt vpon creſt theſe boye mine honour haſt wounded foes doe repute euery one trouble get gone sonne himſelfe let vs withdraw sonne tell mutius bones buried brother kneele mar brother name doth nature plea'd sonne father name doth nature tit speake reſt mar renowned titus halfe luc deare father vs mar suffer brother marcus interre noble nephew heere vertues neſt died honour lauinia's cauſe art romaine barbarous greekes vpon aduiſe bury aiax himſelfe laertes graciouſly plead funerals let young mutius ioy bar'd entrance heere tit riſe marcus riſe diſmall'ſt day ere diſhonored sonnes rome well bury bury next put tombe luc lie bones mutius friends till trophees adorne tombe kneele man teares noble mutius liues fame di'd vertues cauſe exit mar lord theſe dumps comes queene gothes thus aduanc'd rome ti know marcus know whether deuiſe heauens tell beholding man brought high good turne farre yes nobly remunerate flouriſh enter emperor tamora two moore one doore enter doore baſsianus lauinia others sat baſsianus haue plaid prize god giue ioy gallant bride baſs lord wiſh leſſe take leaue sat traytor rome haue law haue power faction repent rape baſs rape call lord ceaſe owne true betrothed loue wife let lawes rome determine meane poſſeſt mine sat good vs liue weele baſs lord haue done beſt may anſwere muſt life onely thus much giue grace know duties owe rome noble gentleman lord titus heere opinion honour wrong'd reſcue lauinia owne hand youngeſt son zeale highly mou'd wrath controul'd frankly gaue receiue fauour saturnine hath expre'ſt himſelfe deeds father friend rome tit prince baſsianus leaue plead deeds thoſe haue diſhonoured rome righteous heauens iudge haue lou'd honour'd saturnine tam worthy lord euer tamora gracious thoſe princely eyes thine heare indifferently pardon paſt satu madam diſhonoured openly baſely put vp without reuenge tam lord gods rome for-fend authour diſhonour mine honour dare vndertake good lord titus innocence whoſe fury diſſembled griefes looke graciouſly looſe noble friend vaine lookes afflict gentle heart lord rul'd wonne laſt diſſemble griefes diſcontents newly planted throne leaſt people patricians vpon iuſt take titus part vs ingratitude rome reputes hainous yeeld intreats let alone ile finde day maſſacre race faction familie cruell father trayt'rous deare life make know let queene kneele beg grace vaine come come emperour come andronicus take vp good old man cheere heart dies tempeſt angry frowne king riſe titus riſe empreſſe hath preuail'd titus thanke maieſtie lord theſe words theſe lookes infuſe new life tamo titus incorparate rome roman adopted happily muſt aduiſe emperour good day quarrels die andronicus let mine honour good lord haue reconcil'd friends prince baſsianus haue paſt word promiſe emperour milde tractable feare lords lauinia aduiſe humbled knees aske pardon maieſtie son doe vow heauen highnes mildly might tendring honour owne mar mine honour heere proteſt king away talke trouble vs tamora nay nay sweet emperour muſt friends tribune nephews kneele grace denied hart looke back king marcus brothers heere louely tamora's intreats doe remit theſe young mens haynous faults stand vp lauinia though left like churle found friend death would part batchellour prieſt come emperours court feaſt two brides gueſt lauinia friends day loue-day tamora tit morrow pleaſe maieſtie hunt panther hart horne hound weele giue grace bon iour satur titus gramercy exeunt actus secunda flouriſh enter aaron alone aron climbeth tamora olympus toppe safe fortunes aloft secure thunders cracke lightning flaſh aduanc'd pale enuies threatning reach golden sunne morne hauing gilt ocean beames gallops zodiacke gliſtering coach ouer-lookes higheſt piering hills tamora vpon wit doth earthly honour waite vertue caucaſus away weedes idle thoughts bright pearle gold waite vpon new made empreſſe waite wanton queene goddeſſe semorimis queene syren charme romes saturnine common weales hollo enter chiron demetrius brauing dem chiron yeres wants wit wit wants edge manners intru'd grac'd may ought know'ſt affected chi demetrius doo'ſt ouer-weene beare downe braues difference yeere two makes leſſe gracious fortunate able fit deſerue miſtris grace vpon approue plead paſſions lauinia's loue aron clubs clubs theſe louers keep peace dem boy although mother vnaduiſed gaue daunſing rapier deſperate growne threat friends goe haue lath glued within till know better handle chi meane little skill haue full well perceiue much dare deme boy grow ye braue drawe aron lords nere emperours pallace dare draw maintaine quarrell openly full well wote ground grudge would million gold cauſe knowne moſt concernes would noble mother much diſhonored court rome put vp deme till haue rapier boſome withall thruſt theſe reprochfull downe throat hath breath'd diſhonour heere chi prepar'd full reſolu'd foule coward thundreſt tongue weapon nothing dar'ſt performe aron way gods warlike gothes adore pretty brabble vndoo vs lords thinke dangerous vpon princes right lauinia become looſe baſsianus degenerate loue quarrels may broacht without controulement iuſtice reuenge young lords beware empreſſe know diſcord ground muſicke would pleaſe chi care knew world loue lauinia world demet youngling learne make meaner choiſe lauinia thine elder brothers hope aron ye mad know ye rome furious impatient cannot brooke competitors loue tell lords doe plot deaths deuiſe chi aaron thouſand deaths would propoſe atchieue loue aron atcheive deme mak'ſt shee woman therefore may woo'd shee woman therfore may wonne shee lauinia therefore muſt lou'd man water glideth mill wots miller eaſie cut loafe know though baſsianus emperours brother better haue worne vulcans badge aron good saturnius may deme diſpaire knowes court words faire lookes liberality haſt full often doe borne cleanly keepers noſe aron certaine would turnes chi turne deme aaron haſt hit aron would hit tir'd adoo harke yee harke yee fooles would offend chi faith deme one aron friends ioyne iar pollicie muſt doe affect muſt reſolue cannot would atcheiue muſt perforce accompliſh may take lucrece chaſt lauinia baſsianus loue courſe lingring languiſhment muſt purſue haue found path lords hunting hand louely roman ladies troope forreſt walkes wide many vnfrequented plots fitted kinde rape villaine single thither dainty doe home force words dreadfull deafe dull braue boyes take turnes luſts heauens eye reuell lauinia's treaſurie chi counſell lad cowardiſe deme sij fas aut nefas till finde coole heat charme calme fits per stigia per manes earely new married ladies baſs lauinia laui haue bene awake two houres satur come horſe chariots let vs haue madam ye romaine hunting mar haue dogges lord rouze proudeſt panther chaſe clime higheſt pomontary top tit haue horſe follow game makes way runnes likes swallowes ore plaine deme chiron hunt horſe hound hope plucke dainty doe ground exeunt enter aaron alone aron wit would thinke none bury much gold vnder tree neuer inherit let thinks abiectly know gold muſt coine cunningly effected beget excellent peece villany repoſe gold vnreſt haue almes empreſſe cheſt enter tamora moore tamo louely aaron wherefore look'ſt euery thing doth make gleefull boaſt birds chaunt melody euery buſh snake lies rolled chearefull sunne greene leaues quiuer▪ cooling winde make cheker'd ground vnder aaron let vs whil'ſt babling eccho mock's hounds replying well tun'd-hornes double hunt heard let vs downe marke yelping noyſe conflict wandring prince dido enioy'd happy curtain'd counſaile-keeping caue may wreathed others armes paſtimes done poſſeſſe golden whiles hounds hornes melodious birds vnto vs nurſes song lullabie bring babe aſleepe aron madame though venus gouerne deſires saturne dominator ouer mine deadly eye cloudy melancholie fleece woolly haire vncurles euen adder doth vnrowle fatall execution madam theſe veneriall vengeance heart death hand blood reuenge hammering head harke tamora empreſſe soule neuer hopes heauen reſts day doome baſsianus philomel muſt looſe tongue day sonnes make pillage chaſtity waſh hands baſſianus blood seeſt letter take vp pray giue king fatall plotted scrowle queſtion eſpied heere comes parcell hopefull booty dreads yet liues deſtruction enter baſſianus lauinia tamo ah moore sweeter life aron great empreſſe baſſianus comes croſſe ile goe fetch sonnes backe quarrell ere baſſi haue heere romes royall empreſſe vnfurniſht well beſeeming troope dian habited like hath abandoned holy groues generall hunting forreſt tamo sawcie controuler priuate power dian temples planted preſently hornes acteons hounds driue vpon new transformed limbes vnmannerly intruder art laui vnder patience gentle empreſſe thought haue goodly gift horning doubted moore highnes looke pale wan tamo haue reaſon thinke looke pale theſe two haue tic'd hither place barren deteſted vale trees though sommer yet forlorne leane ore-come moſſe balefull miſſelto heere neuer sunne heere nothing breeds vnleſſe nightly owle fatall rauen abhorred pit told heere dead time night thouſand fiends thouſand hiſſing snakes ten thouſand toades many vrchins would make fearefull confuſed cries mortall body hearing fall mad elſe die told helliſh tale told would binde heere vnto body diſmall yew leaue miſerable death call'd foule adultereſſe laſciuious goth bittereſt tea es euer eare heare effect wondrous fortune come vengeance executed reuenge loue mothers life ye henceforth cal'd children dem witneſſe sonne chi strook home laui come semeramis nay barbarous tamora name fits nature owne tam giue poyniard know boyes mothers hand right mothers wrong deme stay madam heere belongs firſt thraſh corne burne minion vpon chaſtity vpon nuptiall vow loyaltie painted hope braues mightineſſe carry vnto graue chi doe would eunuch drag hence husband hole make dead trunke-pillow luſt tamo ye haue hony deſire let waſpe out-liue vs chir warrant madam make come miſtris perforce enioy nice-preſerued honeſty laui oh tamora bear'ſt woman face tamo heare away laui sweet lords intreat heare word demet liſten faire madam let glory teares hart vnrelenting flint drops raine laui tigers young-ones teach dam doe learne wrath taught milke turne marble euen teat had'ſt tyranny yet euery mother breeds sonnes alike intreat woman pitty chiro would'ſt haue proue baſtard laui true rauen doth hatch larke yet haue heard oh could finde lion mou'd pitty indure haue princely pawes par'd away rauens foſter forlorne children whil'ſt owne birds famiſh neſts oh though hard hart nothing kind pittifull tamo know meanes away lauin oh let teach fathers gaue life well might haue obdurate open deafe eares tamo had'ſt perſon nere offended euen pittileſſe remember boyes powr'd forth teares vaine brother fierce andronicus would relent therefore away vſe worſe better lou'd laui oh tamora call'd gentle queene thine owne hands kill place life haue beg'd long poore baſſianus dy'd tam sonnes fee let luſt deme away haſt vs heere long lauinia garace womanhood ah beaſtly creature blot enemy generall name confuſion fall— chi nay ile mouth bring husband hole aaron bid vs hide tam straight bring lothſome pit eſpied panther faſt aſleepe quin dull ere bodes marti mine promiſe well could leaue quin art fallen hole whoſe mouth couered rude growing briers vpon whoſe leaues drops new-ſhed-blood freſh mornings dew diſtil'd flowers fatall place speake brother haſt hurt fall martius oh brother diſmal'ſt obiect euer eye made heart lament aron fetch king finde heere thereby may haue likely geſſe theſe made away brother exit aaron marti doſt comfort helpe vnhallow'd blood-ſtained hole quintus vncouth feare chilling ore-runs trembling ioynts heart mine eie marti proue haſt baſſianus lies embrewed heere heape like lambe deteſted darke blood-drinking pit quin darke dooſt know mart vpon bloody finger doth weare precious ring lightens hole like taper monument doth vpon dead mans earthly cheekes ragged intrailes pit pale moone piramus night lay bath'd maiden blood brother helpe fainting hand feare hath made faint mee hath fell deuouring receptacle hatefull ocitus miſtie mouth quint reach hand may helpe wanting doe much good may pluckt wombe deepe pit poore baſsianus graue haue plucke brinke martius clime without help quin hand looſe againe till art heere aloft can'ſt rauiſht chi write downe mind bewray meaning let play scribe dem see tokens chi goe home call water waſh hands dem hath tongue call hands waſh let's leaue walkes chi t' cauſe goe hang dem had'ſt hands helpe knit cord exeunt winde hornes enter marcus hunting lauinia neece flies away faſt coſen word husband dreame would wealth would wake doe wake planet downe may eternall speake gentle neece vngentle hands hath lopt hew'd made body bare two branches thoſe ornaments whoſe circkling kings haue might gaine great happines halfe loue dooſt alas crimſon riuer warme blood like bubling fountaine winde doth riſe fall betweene roſed lips comming going hony breath tereus hath defloured leaſt detect cut tongue ah turn'ſt away face notwithſtanding loſſe blood conduit iſſuing spouts yet doe cheekes looke red titans face bluſhing encountred cloud shall oh knew hart knew beaſt might raile eaſe mind sorrow concealed like ouen doth burne hart cinders faire philomela loſt tongue tedious sampler minde louely neece meane cut craftier tereus haſt met withall hath cut thoſe pretty fingers could haue better philomel oh monſter thoſe lilly hands tremble like aſpen leaues vpon lute make delight kiſſe would haue toucht life heard heauenly harmony tongue hath made would haue dropt knife fell aſleepe cerberus thracian poets feete come let vs goe make father blinde blinde fathers eye one houres drowne fragrant meades whole months teares fathers eyes doe draw backe mourne oh could mourning eaſe miſery exeunt actus tertius enter iudges senatours titus two bound paſſing stage place execution titus going pleading ti heare graue fathers noble tribunes pitty mine age whoſe youth dangerous warres whilſt blood romes great quarrell froſty nights haue watcht theſe bitter teares filling aged wrinkles cheekes pittifull condemned sonnes whoſe corrupted thought two twenty neuer wept becauſe died honours lofty bed andronicus lyeth downe iudges paſſe theſe tribunes duſt write harts deepe languor teares let teares earths drie appetite blood make bluſh earth friend raine exeunt diſtill theſe two ancient ruines youthfull aprill drought ile drop vpon winter warme teares ile melt keepe erernall time face refuſe drinke deare blood enter lucius weapon drawne oh reuerent tribunes oh gentle aged men vnbinde reuerſe doome death let neuer wept teares preualing oratours lu oh noble father lament vaine tribunes heare man recount ti ah lucius brothers let plead graue tribunes intreat lu gracious lord tribune heares ti matter man heare would marke oh heare would pitty therefore tell bootles though cannot anſwere diſtreſſe yet better tribunes intercept tale doe weepe humbly feete receiue teares weepe attired graue weedes rome could afford tribune like theſe waxe tribunes hard offendeth tribunes tongues doome men death wherefore weapon drawne lu reſcue two brothers death attempt iudges haue pronounc'ſt euerlaſting doome baniſhment ti happy man haue befriended fooliſh lucius doſt perceiue rome wildernes tigers tigers muſt pray rome affords prey mine happy art theſe deuourers baniſhed comes brother marcus heere enter marcus lauinia mar titus prepare noble eyes weepe noble heart breake bring conſuming thine age ti conſume let mar daughter ti marcus luc aye obiect kils ti faint-harted boy ariſe looke vpon speake lauinia accurſed hand hath made handleſſe fathers foole hath added water sea brought faggot bright burning troy griefe height cam'ſt like nylus diſdaineth bounds giue ile chop hands haue fought rome vaine haue nur'ſt woe feeding life booteleſſe prayer haue bene held vp haue effectleſſe vſe require one helpe cut well lauinia haſt hands hands rome vaine luci speake gentle hath martyr'd mar delightfull engine thoughts blab'd pleaſing eloquence torne forth pretty hollow cage like mellodius bird sweet varied notes inchanting euery eare luci oh hath done deed marc oh thus found parke seeking hide herſelfe doth deare hath receiude vnrecuring wound tit deare wounded hath hurt kild dead one vpon rocke inuiron'd wilderneſſe sea markes waxing tide grow waue waue expecting euer enuious briniſh bowels way death wretched gone heere baniſht man heere brother weeping woes giues greateſt deere lauinia deerer picture plight would haue madded doe behold liuely body haſt hands wipe away teares tongue tell hath martyr'd husband dead death brothers condemn'd dead looke marcus ah lucius looke name brothers freſh teares stood cheekes doth hony dew vpon gathred lillie almoſt withered mar perchance weepes becauſe kil'd husband perchance becauſe knowes innocent ti kill husband ioyfull becauſe law hath tane reuenge would doe foule deede witnes makes gentle lauinia let kiſſe lips make may eaſe shall good vncle brother lucius round fountaine looking downewards behold cheekes meadowes yet dry miery left flood fountaine gaze long till freſh taſte taken cleerenes made brine pit bitter teares cut away hands like thine bite tongues dumbe paſſe remainder hatefull dayes doe let vs haue tongues plot deuiſe miſeries make vs wondred time come lu sweet father ceaſe teares griefe see wretched weeps mar patience deere neece good titus drie thine eyes ti ah marcus marcus brother well wot napkin cannot drinke teare mine poore man haſt drown'd thine owne lu ah lauinia wipe cheekes ti marke marcus marke vnderſtand tongue would brother napkin true teares wet cheekes oh woe farre helpe limbo bliſſe enter aron moore alone moore titus andronicus lord emperour sends word loue let marcus lucius old titus one chop hand king hither aliue ranſome fault ti oh gracious emperour oh gentle aaron euer rauen like larke giues tydings sunnes vpriſe heart ile emperour hand good aron wilt help chop lu stay father noble hand thine hath throwne downe many enemies shall hand turne youth better blood therfore mine brothers liues mar hands hath defended rome rear'd aloft bloody battleaxe writing deſtruction enemies caſtle oh none high deſert hand hath bin idle let ranſome two nephewes death haue kept worthy end moore nay come agree whoſe hand goe along feare die pardon come mar hand goe lu heauen goe ti sirs withered hearbs theſe meete plucking vp therefore mine lu sweet father thought let redeeme brothers death mar fathers mothers care let brothers loue ti agree betweene hand lu ile goe fetch axe mar vſe axe exeunt ti come hither aaron ile deceiue lend hand giue mine moore cal'd deceit honeſt neuer whil'ſt liue deceiue men ile deceiue another you'l ere halfe houre paſſe cuts titus hand enter lucius marcus againe ti diſpatcht good aron giue maieſtie hand tell hand warded thouſand dangers bid bury hath merited let haue account iewels purchaſt eaſie price yet deere becauſe bought mine owne aron goe andronicus hand looke haue heads meane oh villany doth fat thoughts let fooles doe good faire men call grace aron haue blacke like face exit ti heere lift one hand vp heauen bow feeble ruine earth power pitties wretched teares call wilt kneele doe deare heart heauen heare prayers weele breath welkin dimme sun fogge cloudes hug melting boſomes mar oh brother poſſibilities breake theſe deepe extreames ti deepe hauing bottome paſſions bottomleſſe mar yet let reaſon gouerne lament titus reaſon theſe miſeries limits could binde woes heauen doth weepe doth earth ore flow windes rage doth sea wax mad threatning welkin big-ſwolne face wilt haue reaſon coile sea harke doe flow shee weeping welkin earth muſt sea moued muſt earth continuall teares become deluge ouerflow'd drown'd bowels cannot hide woes like drunkard muſt vomit giue leaue looſers haue leaue eaſe bitter tongues enter meſſenger two heads hand meſſ worthy andronicus ill art repaid good hand emperour heere heads two noble heeres hand backe griefes reſolution mockt woe thinke vpon woes remembrance fathers death exit marc let hot aetna coole cicilie heart euer-burning hell theſe miſeries may borne weepe weepe doth eaſe deale flouted double death luci ah make deep wound yet deteſted life thereat euer death let life beare name life hath intereſt breath mar alas poore hart kiſſe comfortleſſe frozen water titus fearefull haue end mar farwell flatterie die andronicus doſt two heads warlike hands mangled daughter baniſht deere fight strucke pale bloodleſſe brother euen like image cold numme ah controule griefes rent haire hand gnawing teeth diſmall cloſing vp moſt wretched eyes time art titus ha ha ha mar doſt laugh fits houre ti haue another teare beſides enemy would vſurpe vpon watry eyes make blinde tributarie teares way finde reuenges caue theſe two heads doe threat neuer come bliſſe till theſe miſchiefes returned againe euen throats haue committed come let taske haue doe heauie people circle may turne one vnto right wrongs vow made come brother take head hand beare lauinia employd theſe things beare hand wench betweene teeth boy goe get art exile muſt hie gothes raiſe army loue thinke doe let's kiſſe part haue much doe exeunt manet lucius luci farewell andronicus noble father woful'ſt man euer liu'd rome farewell proud rome til lucius come againe loues pledges dearer life farewell lauinia noble would wert fore haſt beene lucius lauinia liues obliuion hateful griefes lucius liue requit wrongs make proud saturnine empreſſe beg gates likes tarquin queene gothes raiſe power reueng'd rome saturnine exit lucius bnaket enter andronicus marcus lauinia boy looke eate preſerue iuſt much vs reuenge theſe bitter woes marcus vnknit knot neece poore creatures want hands cannot paſſionate tenfold griefe wirh foulded armes poore right hand mine left tirranize vppon hands trim'd lucius oh deteſtable villaine call'ſt trimming aron waſht cut trim'd trim luci oh barbarous beaſtly villaines like aron indeede tutor inſtruct codding mother card euer wonne set bloody minde thinke learn'd true dog euer fought head well let deeds witneſſe worth trayn'd bretheren guilefull hole dead corps baſſianus lay wrote letter father found hid gold within letter mention'd confederate queene two sonnes done haſt cauſe rue wherein miſcheife play'd cheater fathers hand drew apart almoſt broke heart extreame laughter pried creuice wall hand two sonnes heads beheld teares laught hartily mine eyes rainie like told empreſſe almoſt pleaſing tale tydings gaue twenty kiſſes goth canſt neuer bluſh aron like blacke dogge luci art theſe hainous deedes aron done thouſand euen curſe day yet thinke come within compaſſe curſe wherein notorious ill kill man elſe deuiſe death rauiſh maid plot way accuſe innocent forſweare set deadly enmity betweene two friends make poore mens cattell breake neckes set fire barnes hayſtackes night bid owners quench teares oft haue dig'd vp dead men graues vpright deere friends doore euen almoſt forgot skinnes barke trees haue knife carued romaine letters let die though dead tut haue done thouſand dreadfull things willingly one would kill fly nothing greeues hartily indeede cannot doe ten thouſand luci bring downe diuell muſt die death decrees may flie away effect deceiu'd meane see heere bloody lines haue downe written executed tam titus come talke tit word grace talke wanting hand giue action haſt ods therefore tam did'ſt know would'ſt talke tit mad know well enough witneſſe wretched witneſſe theſe crimſon lines witneſſe theſe trenches made griefe care witneſſe trying day heauie night witneſſe know well proud empreſſe torment mine enemies tam therefore come downe welcome tit doe ere come loe rape murder giue art reuenge stab teare chariot wheeles ile come waggoner whirle along globes prouide two proper palfries blacke iet hale vengefull waggon away finde murder guilty cares car loaden heads diſmount waggon wheele trot like seruile footeman day long euen eptons riſing eaſt vntill downefall sea day day ile heauy taske deſtroy rapine murder tam theſe miniſters come tit miniſters call'd tam rape murder therefore called cauſe take vengeance kind men tit good lord like empreſſe son empreſſe worldly men haue miſerable mad miſtaking eyes oh reuenge come one armes imbracement content imbrace tam cloſing fits lunacie ere forge feede braine-ſicke fits vphold maintaine firmely takes reuenge credulous mad thought ile make lucius sonne whil'ſt banquet hold ile find cunning practiſe hand diſperſe giddle gothes leaſt make enemies see heere comes muſt play theame tit long haue bene forlorne welcome dread fury woofull houſe rapine murther welcome like empreſſe sonnes well fitted moore could hell afford deuill well wote empreſſe neuer wags company moore would repreſent queene aright conuenient deuill welcome doe tam would'ſt haue vs doe andronicus dem shew murtherer ile deale chi shew villaine hath done rape reueng'd tam shew thouſand haue done wrong ile reuenged tit looke round wicked rome find'ſt man that's like good murder hee's murtherer goe hap finde another like good rapine rauiſher go emperours court queene attended moore well maiſt know owne proportion vp downe doth reſemble pray doe violent death haue bene violent mine tam well haſt leſſon'd vs would pleaſe good andronicus lucius thrice valiant sonne leades towards rome band warlike gothes bid come banquet houſe heere euen teach torches burne bright hangs vpon cheeke night rich iewel aethiops eare beauty rich vſe earth deare snowy doue trooping crowes yonder lady ore fellowes meaſure done ile watch place touching make bleſſed rude hand heart loue till forſweare neuer true beauty till night tib voice mountague fetch rapier boy dares come hither couer'd antique face fleere solemnitie honour kin dead hold cap kinſman bloud rude brawles doth lie bleeding ile amerce fine repent loſſe mine deafe pleading excuſes teares prayers purchaſe abuſes therefore vſe none let romeo hence haſt elſe found houre laſt beare hence body attend mercy murders pardoning thoſe kill exeunt enter iuliet alone iul gallop apace fiery footed fleedes towards phaebus lodging wagoner phaeton would whip weſt bring cloudie night immediately spred cloſe curtaine loue-performing night run-awayes eyes may wincke romeo leape theſe armes vntalkt vnſeene louers doe amorous rights owne beauties loue blind beſt agrees night come ciuill night fortunes lord lord alwaies haue confeſt aper ho ho confeſt handg'd haue timo apermantus welcome aper make welcome come haue thruſt doores tim fie th' art churle ye' haue got humour become man much blame lords irafuror breuis eſt yond man verie angrie go let haue table himſelfe neither affect companie fit for't indeed aper let thine apperill timon come obſerue giue warning on't tim take heede th' art athenian therefore welcome would haue power prythee let meate make aper meate choake nere flatter oh gods number men eats timon greeues many dip meate one mans blood madneſſe cheeres vp wonder men dare truſt themſelues men thinks enuite without kniues good meate liues there's much example for't fellow next parts bread pledges breath diuided draught readieſt man kill beene▪ proued huge man might'ſt kill bid lord might haue happineſſe lord would vſe hearts whereby might expreſſe part zeales thinke euer perfect timon oh doubt good friends gods themſelues haue prouided haue much helpe beene friends elſe haue charitable title thouſands chiefely belong heart haue told modeſtie owne behalfe thus farre confirme oh gods thinke need haue friends nere haue need of' em moſt needleſſe creatures liuing nere haue vſe would moſt reſemble inſtruments hung vp caſes keepes themſelues haue often wiſht poorer might come neerer borne benefits better properer call owne richer friends oh pretious comfort haue many like brothers commanding one anothers fortunes oh ioyes e'ne made away er't borne mine eies cannot hold wate thinks▪ forget faults drinke aper weep'ſt make drinke timon lord haile worthy timon bounties taſte fiue beſt sencesa cknowledge patron come freely gratulate plentiou boſome taſt touch pleas'd table riſe onely come feaſt thine eies timo they'r wecome let haue kind admittance muſicke make welcome luc lord ample y' belou'd aper hoyday vanitie comes way daunce mad women like madneſſe glory life pompe little oyle roote make fooles diſport flatteries drinke thoſe men vpon whoſe age voyde vp agen poyſonous spight enuy liues that's depraued depraues dyes beares one graues friends guift feare thoſe dance would one day vpon bene done men doores againſt sunne lords riſe table much adoring timon loues amazon dance men women loftie two hoboyes ceaſe tim haue done pleaſures much grace faire ladies set faire faſhion entertainment halfe beautifull kinde haue added worth vntoo't luſter entertain'd mine owne deuice thanke for't lord lord take vs euen beſt aper faith worſt filthy would hold taking doubt tim ladies idle banquet attends pleaſe diſpoſe la moſt thankfully lord exeunt tim flauius fla lord tim little casket bring hither fla yes lord iewels yet croſſing in's humor elſe tell well faith all's hee'ld croſt could pitty bounty eyes behinde man might ne're wretched minde exit lord men ser heere lord readineſſe lord horſes tim friends haue one word looke good muſt intreat honour much aduance iewell accept weare kinde lord lord farre already guifts enter seruant ser lord certaine nobles senate newly alighted come viſit tim fairely welcome enter flauius fla beſeech honor vouchſafe word concerne neere tim neere another time ile heare prythee let's prouided entertainment fla know enter another seruant ser may pleaſe honor lord lucius free loue hath preſented foure milke-white horſes trapt siluer tim accept fairely let preſents worthily entertain'd enter third seruant newes ser pleaſe lord honourable gentleman lord lucullus entreats companie morrow hunt ha's honour two brace grey-hounds tim ile hunt let receiu'd without faire reward fla come commands vs prouide giue great guifts empty coffer know purſe yeeld begger heart power make wiſhes good promiſes flye beyond debt ows eu'ry word kinde payes intereſt for't land's put bookes well would gently put office forc'd happier friend feede e'ne enemies exceede bleed inwardly lord exit tim much wrong bate much owne merits heere lord trifle loue lord common thankes receyue lord he's crutch old limping sire beate braines piety feare religion gods peace iuſtice truth domeſticke awe night-reſt neighbour-hood inſtruction manners myſteries trades degrees obſeruances cuſtomes lawes nakedneſſe deteſtable towne take multiplying bannes timon woods finde th' vnkindeſt beaſt kinder mankinde gods confound heare good gods th' athenians within wall graunt timon growes hate may grow whole race mankinde high low amen exit enter steward two three seruants heare steward where's maſter vndone caſt nothing remaining stew alack fellowes let recorded righteous gods poore houſe broke noble maſter falne gone one friend take fortune arme go along turne backes companion throwne graue familiars buried fortunes slinke away leaue falſe vowes like empty purſes pickt poore dedicated beggar ayre diſeaſe pouerty walkes like contempt alone fellowes enter seruants stew broken implements ruin'd houſe yet hearts weare timons liuery faces fellowes seruing alike leak'd barke poore mates dying decke hearing surges threat muſt part sea ayre stew good fellowes lateſt wealth ile among'ſt euer meete timons let's yet fellowes let's heads knell vnto maſters fortunes haue better dayes let take nay put hands one word thus part rich parting poore embrace part wayes oh fierce wretchedneſſe glory brings vs would wiſh wealth exempt since riches point miſery contempt would mock'd glory liue dreame friendſhip haue pompe compounds onely painted like varniſht friends poore honeſt lord brought lowe owne heart vndone goodneſſe strange vnvſuall blood mans worſt do's much good dares halfe kinde agen bounty makes gods marre men deereſt lord bleſt moſt accurſt rich onely wretched great fortunes made cheefe afflictions alas kinde lord hee's flung rage ingratefull seate monſtrous friends ha's wombe whoſe procreation reſidence birth scarſe diuidant touch fortunes greater leſſer nature lay beare great fortune contempt nature raiſe begger deny't lord senators beare contempt hereditary begger por neither y' haue vngently brutus stole bed yeſternight supper aroſe walk'd muſing armes a-croſſe ask'd matter vpon vngentle lookes vrg'd head impatiently foote yet inſiſted yet anſwer'd angry caeſar forth things threaten'd ne're look'd backe face caeſar vaniſhed calp caeſar neuer ceremonies yet fright one within beſides things haue heard recounts moſt horrid watch lionneſſe hath whelped graues haue yawn'd yeelded vp dead fierce fiery warriours fight vpon clouds rankes squadrons right forme warre drizel'd blood vpon capitoll noiſe battell hurtled ayre horſſes neigh dying men grone ghoſts caeſar theſe things beyond vſe feare caeſ auoyded whoſe end purpos'd mighty gods yet caeſar go theſe predictions world generall caeſar calp beggers dye comets heauens themſelues blaze forth cawdor say whence owe intelligence vpon blaſted heath way prophetique greeting speake charge witches vaniſh banq earth hath bubbles water ha's theſe whither vaniſh'd macb ayre corporall melted breath winde would banq things doe haue eaten inſane root takes reaſon priſoner macb children kings banq king macb thane cawdor went banq toth' tune▪ words who's enter roſſe angus roſſe king hath happily receiu'd macbeth▪ newes reades perſonall venture rebels fight wonders prayſes doe contend thine viewing o're reſt o' th' day findes norweyan rankes▪ nothing afeard didſt make strange images death thick tale poſt poſt euery one beare prayſes kingdomes great defence powr'd downe ang wee giue royall maſter thanks onely harrold pay thee▪ roſſe earneſt greater honor bad call thane cawdor addition haile moſt worthy thane thine banq deuill true macb thane cawdor liues doe dreſſe borrowed robes ang thane liues yet vnder heauie iudgement beares life deſerues looſe whether combin'd thoſe norway lyne rebell hidden helpe vantage labour'd countreyes wracke know treaſons capitall confeſs'd prou'd haue ouerthrowne macb glamys thane cawdor greateſt behinde thankes paines doe hope children kings thoſe gaue thane cawdor promis'd leſſe banq truſted home might yet enkindle vnto crowne beſides thane cawdor oftentimes winne vs harme inſtruments darkneſſe tell vs truths winne vs honeſt trifles betray's deepeſt conſequence couſins word pray macb two truths told happy prologues act imperiall theame thanke gentlemen cannot ill cannot good ill hath giuen earneſt commencing truth thane cawdor good doe yeeld whoſe horrid image doth vnfixe heire make heart knock ribbes againſt vſe nature preſent feares leſſe horrible imaginings thought whoſe murther yet fantaſticall shakes man function son lord glou breeding sir hath bin charge haue often bluſh'd acknowledge braz'd too't kent cannot conceiue glou sir yong fellowes mother could wherevpon grew round womb'd indeede sir sonne cradle ere diuided three kingdome faſt intent cares buſineſſe age conferring yonger vnburthen'd crawle toward death cornwal leſſe louing sonne albany haue houre conſtant publiſh daughters dowers future may preuented princes france burgundy great riuals yongeſt daughters loue long court haue made amorous heere anſwer'd tell daughters since diueſt vs rule intereſt territory cares state doth loue vs moſt largeſt bountie may extend nature doth merit challenge gonerill eldeſt borne firſt gon sir loue word weild ye matter deerer eye-ſight libertie beyond valewed rich rare leſſe life grace health beauty honor much childe ere lou'd father found loue makes breath poore vnable beyond manner much loue cor cordelia loue lear theſe bounds euen line forreſts champains rich'd plenteous riuers wide-skirted meades make lady thine albanies iſſues perpetuall daughter deereſt regan wife cornwall reg made siſter prize worth true heart finde names deede loue onely comes profeſſe enemy ioyes moſt precious profeſſes finde alone felicitate deere highneſſe loue cor poore cordelia yet loue's ponderous tongue lear thine hereditarie euer remaine ample third faire kingdome leſſe validitie pleaſure confeir'd gonerill ioy although laſt leaſt whoſe yong loue▪ vines france milke burgundie striue intereſt draw third opilent siſters cor nothing lord lear nothing cor nothing lear nothing come nothing againe cor vnhappie cannot heaue heart mouth loue maieſty according bond leſſe lear cordelia mend little leaſt may marre fortunes cor good lord haue begot bred lou'd returne thoſe duties backe right fit obey conſort reg maruaile though ill affected haue put old mans death haue th' expence waſt reuenues haue preſent euening siſter beene well inform'd cautions come houſe ile cor aſſure regan edmund heare doth inſtant much commend nature's deepe truſt much need firſt baſt sir truely euer elſe glo thanke grace cor know came viſit reg thus thredding darke ey'd night occaſions noble gloſter prize wherein muſt haue vſe aduiſe father hath writ hath siſter differences beſt though fit anſwere home meſſengers hence attend diſpatch good old friend lay comforts boſome beſtow needfull counſaile buſineſſes craues inſtant vſe glo madam graces right welcome exeunt flouriſh scena secunda enter kent aad steward stew good dawning friend art houſe kent stew may horſes kent i' th' myre stew prythee lou'ſt tell morter daube wall iakes spare gray-beard wagtaile cor peace beaſtly knaue know reuerence kent yes sir anger hath priuiledge cor art angrie kent weare sword weares honeſty rogues theſe like rats oft mee thinke cornw perceiue altogether brothers euill diſpoſition made death prouoking merit a-worke reprouable badneſſe himſelfe baſt malicious fortune muſt repent iuſt letter hee approues intelligent apprehenſion baſt finde comforting king fully perſeuer courſe loyalty though conflict betweene blood corn lay truſt vpon finde deere father loue exeunt scena sexta enter kent glouceſter glou heere darkneſſe pray innocent beware foule fiend foole prythee nunkle tell whether madman gentleman yeoman lear king king foole he's yeoman ha's gentleman sonne hee's mad yeoman sonne gentleman lear haue thouſand red burning come hizzing vpon edg bleſſe fiue wits kent pitty sir patience oft haue boaſted retaine edg teares begin take part much marre counterfetting lear little dogges trey blanch hundred like faſhion garments perſian let bee chang'd enter gloſter kent good lord lye heere reſt awhile lear make noiſe make noiſe draw curtaines wee'l go supper i' th' morning foole ile go bed noone stew lord glouſter hath conuey'd hence fiue thirty knights hot queſtriſts met gate lords dependants gone toward douer boaſt haue well armed friends corn get horſes miſtris gon farewell lord siſter exit corn edmund farewell go traitor gloſter pinnion like theefe bring vs though well may paſſe vpon life without forme iuſtice yet power shall curt'ſie wrath men may blame comptroll enter glouceſter i'me none corn chaire binde villaine finde glou kinde gods moſt ignobly done plucke beard reg white traitor glou naughty ladie theſe haires doſt rauiſh chin quicken accuſe hoſt robbers hands letter gueſſingly downe came one that's newtrall heart one oppos'd corn cunning reg falſe corn haſt king glou douer reg wherefore douer was't charg'd perill corn wherefore douer let anſwer glou tyed to' th' stake muſt courſe reg wherefore douer glou becauſe would cruell nailes plucke poore old eyes fierce siſter annointed fleſh boariſh phangs sea bare head hell-blacke-night indur'd would haue ill thoughts againe men muſt endure going hence euen comming hither ripeneſſe come glo that's true exeunt scena tertia enter conqueſt drum colours edmund lear cordelia priſoners souldiers captaine baſt officers take away good guard vntill greater pleaſures firſt knowne cenſure cor firſt beſt meaning haue incurr'd worſt oppreſſed king caſt downe could elſe out-frowne falſe fortunes frowne shall theſe daughters theſe siſters lear come let's away priſon two alone like birds i' th' cage doſt aske bleſſing ile kneele downe aske forgiueneſſe wee'l liue pray tell old tales laugh gilded butterflies heere poore rogues talke court newes wee'l talke looſes wins who's who's take vpon's myſtery things gods wee'l weare wall'd priſon packs great ones ebbe flow th' moone baſt take away lear vpon cordelia gods themſelues throw incenſe haue caught parts vs bring brand heauen fire vs hence like foxes wipe thine eyes good yeares deuoure fleſh fell ere make vs weepe weele e'm firſt come exit baſt come hither captaine hearke take note go follow priſon one haue aduanc'd do'ſt inſtructs doſt make way noble fortunes know men time tender minded do's become sword great imployment beare queſtion either thou'lt do't thriue meanes capt ile do't lord baſt write happy th' haſt done marke inſtantly carry haue downe exit captaine flouriſh enter albany gonerill regan soldiers alb sir haue day valiant fortune led well haue captiues oppoſites dayes require vſe find merites may equally determine baſt sir thought fit old miſerable king retention whoſe age charmes whoſe title plucke common boſome turne impreſt launces eies command queen reaſon ready morrow t'appeare hold seſſion alb sir patience hold warre brother reg that's liſt grace methinkes pleaſure might haue bin demanded ere farre led powers bore commiſſion place perſon immediacie may well vp call brother gon hot owne grace doth exalt himſelfe addition reg rights inueſted compeetes beſt alb moſt husband reg ieſters oft proue prophets gon hola hola eye told look'd rega lady well elſe anſwere full flowing generall take souldiers priſoners patrimony diſpoſe walls thine witneſſe world create heere lord maſter gon meane enioy alb let alone lies good baſt thine lord alb halfe-blooded fellow yes reg let drum proue title thine alb stay yet heare reaſon edmund arreſt capitall treaſon arreſt guilded serpent claime faire compaſſing ioy drown'd go without rodo wilt faſt hopes depend iſſue iago art go make money haue told often re-tell againe againe hate moore cauſe hearted thine hath leſſe reaſon let vs coniunctiue reuenge againſt canſt cuckold doſt pleaſure many euents wombe time wilbe deliuered trauerſe go prouide money haue morrow adieu rod meete i' th' morning iago lodging rod ile betimes iago go farewell heare rodorigo rod ile land exit iago thus euer make foole purſe mine owne gain'd knowledge prophane would time expend snpe sport profit hate moore thought abroad ha's done office know if't true meere kinde surety holds well better purpoſe worke caſſio's proper man let get place plume vp double knauery let's time abuſe othello's eares familiar wife hath perſon diſpoſe fram'd make women falſe moore free open nature thinkes men honeſt tenderly lead by' th' noſe aſſes haue't engendred hell night muſt bring monſtrous birth worlds light actus secundus scena prima enter montano two gentlemen mon cape diſcerne sea gent nothing high wrought flood cannot heauen maine deſcry saile mon thinks wind hath aloud land fuller blaſt ne're battlements hath ruffiand vpon sea ribbes oake mountaines melt hold morties heare segregation turkiſh fleet vpon foaming shore chidden billow pelt clowds winde-ſhak'd-surge high monſtrous maine seemes caſt water burning beare quench guards th' euer-fixed pole neuer like molleſtation view enchafed flood mon turkiſh fleete enſhelter'd embay'd drown'd impoſſible beare enter gentleman newes laddes warres done deſperate tempeſt hath bang'd turkes deſignement halts noble venice hath greeuous wracke moſt part fleet mon true ship heere put verenneſſa michael caſſio lieutenant warlike moore othello come shore▪ moore himſelfe sea full commiſſion heere cyprus mon glad on't worthy gouernour caſſio though comfort touching turkiſh loſſe yet lookes praye moore ted fowle violent tempeſt mon pray heauens haue man commands like full soldier let's sea-ſide hoa well veſſell that's come throw-out eyes braue othello euen till make maine th' eriall blew indiſtinct regard gent come let's euery minute expectancie arriuancie enter caſſio caſſi thankes valiant warlike iſle approoue moore oh let heauens giue defence againſt elements haue loſt dangerous sea mon well caſſio barke timber'd pylot verie expert approu'd allowance therefore hope's death stand bold cure within saile saile saile caſſio noiſe gent towne empty brow o' th' sea stand rankes people cry saile caſſio hopes gouernor gent diſcharge shot courteſie friends leaſt caſſio pray sir go forth giue vs truth arriu'd gent exit mon good lieutenant generall wiu'd caſſio moſt fortunately hath atchieu'd maid paragons deſcription wilde fame one excels quirkes blazoning pens th' eſſentiall veſture creation purpoſes deſ well diſcretion exit caſſio iago hah like othel doſt iago nothing lord if—i know othel caſſio parted wife iago caſſio lord cannot thinke would away guilty-like seeing comming oth beleeue deſ lord haue bin talking suitor heere man languiſhes diſpleaſure oth is't meane deſ lieutenant caſſio good lord haue grace power moue preſent reconciliation take one truly loues erres ignorance cunning haue iudgement honeſt face prythee call backe oth went hence deſ humbled hath left part greefe mee good loue call backe othel deſdemon time deſ oth sweet deſ shall't night supper oth night deſ morrow dinner oth dine home meete captaines cittadell deſ morrow night tueſday morne tueſday noone night wenſday morne prythee name time let exceed three dayes infaith hee's penitent yet treſpaſſe common reaſon saue warres muſt make example beſt almoſt fault t' encurre priuate checke come tell othello wonder soule would aske deny mam'ring michael caſſio came woing wirh many time haue anthony attendants ant hearke land bids tread vpon't aſham'd beare friends come hither lated world haue loſt way euer haue laden gold take diuide flye make peace caeſar omnes fly wee ant haue fled commendation free entertainment poſt embrace theſe conditions let vs haue articles betwixt vs onely thus farre anſwere make voyage vpon giue directly vnderſtand haue preuayl'd enemy worth debate remaine vnſeduc'd making appeare otherwiſe ill opinion th' aſſault haue made chaſtity anſwer sword iach hand couenant wee haue theſe things downe lawfull counſell away britaine leaſt bargaine catch colde fetch gold haue two wagers recorded poſt agreed french hold thinke phil signior iachimo pray let vs follow exeunt scena sexta enter queene ladies cornelius qu whiles yet dewe's ground gather thoſe flowers make haſte ha's note lady madam queen diſpatch exit ladies maſter doctor haue brought thoſe drugges cor pleaſeth highnes madam beſeech grace without offence conſcience bids aske wherefore haue commanded theſe moſt poyſonous compounds moouers languiſhing death though deadly qu wonder doctor ask'ſt queſtion haue bene pupill long haſt learn'd make perfumes diſtill preſerue yea great king himſelfe doth woo oft confections hauing thus farre proceeded vnleſſe think'ſt diuelliſh is't meete amplifie iudgement concluſions try forces theſe compounds creatures count worth hanging none humane try vigour apply allayments act gather vertues effects cor highneſſe shall practiſe make hard heart beſides theſe effects noyſome infectious qu content thee▪ enter piſanio heere comes ladies piſa good lord proue vntrue ile choake there's ile exit scena septima enter imogen alone imo father cruell stepdame falſe fooliſh suitor wedded-lady hath husband baniſh'd husband crowne griefe thoſe repeated vexations bin theefe-ſtolne two brothers happy moſt miſerable deſires that's glorious bleſſed thoſe meane ere haue honeſt wills comfort may fye enter piſanio iachimo piſa madam noble
