another caius lucius attendants cym would auguſtus caeſar vs luc iulius caeſar whoſe remembrance yet liues mens eyes eares tongues theame hearing euer britain conquer'd caſſibulan thine vnkle famous caeſars prayſes whit leſſe feats deſeruing succeſſion granted rome tribute yeerely three thouſand pounds lately left vntender'd qu kill meruaile shall euer clot many caeſars ere another iulius britaine's world nothing pay wearing owne noſes qu opportunity take from's reſume haue againe remember sir liege kings anceſtors together naturall brauery iſle neptunes parke ribb'd pal'd oakes vnskaleable roaring waters sands beare enemies boates vp to' th' top-maſt kinde conqueſt caeſar made heere made heere bragge came saw ouer-came firſt euer touch'd carried coaſt twice beaten shipping poore ignorant baubles terrible seas like egge-ſhels mou'd vpon surges crack'd eaſily rockes ioy whereof fam'd caſſibulan point oh giglet fortune maſter caeſars sword made luds-towne reioycing-fires bright britaines courage clot come there's tribute paid kingdome time mo caeſars may haue crook'd noſes owe armes none cym son let mother end clot haue yet many among vs gripe hard caſſibulan doe one haue hand tribute pay tribute caeſar hide sun vs blanket put moon pocket pay tribute light elſe sir tribute pray cym muſt know till iniurious romans extort tribute vs free caeſars ambition much almoſt o' th' world againſt colour heere put yoake vpon's becomes warlike people reckon say caeſar anceſtor mulmutius ordain'd lawes whoſe vſe sword caeſar hath much mangled whoſe repayre franchiſe shall power hold good deed tho rome therfore angry mulmutius made lawes firſt britaine put browes within golden crowne call'd himſelfe king luc cymbeline pronounce auguſtus caeſar caeſar hath moe kings seruants domeſticke officers thine enemy receyue warre confuſion caeſars name pronounce looke fury reſiſted thus defide thanke cym art welcome caius caeſar knighted youth much vnder gather'd honour againe perforce behooues keepe vtterance perfect pannonians dalmatians liberties armes preſident reade would britaines cold caeſar finde luc let proofe clot maieſty biddes welcome make paſtime vs day two longer vs afterwards tearmes finde vs salt-water-girdle beate vs fall aduenture crowes fare better there's end luc cym know maſters pleaſure mine remaine welcome exeunt scena secunda enter piſanio reading letter piſ adultery wherefore write monſters accuſe leonatus oh maſter infection falne eare falſe italian poyſonous tongu'd handed hath preuail'd ready hearing diſloyall she's puniſh'd truth vndergoes goddeſſe-like wife-like aſſaults would take vertue oh maſter mind lowe fortunes murther vpon loue truth vowes haue made command blood go od neuer let counted looke lacke humanity much fact comes doo't letter haue owne command shall giue opportunitie oh damn'd paper blacke incke that's bauble art foedarie act look'ſt virgin-like without loe comes enter imogen ignorant commanded imo piſanio piſ madam heere letter lord imo lord lord leonatus oh learn'd indeed aſtronomer knew starres characters heel'd lay future open good gods let heere contain'd relliſh loue lords health content yet two aſunder let grieue griefes medcinable one doth phyſicke loue content good wax leaue bleſt bees make theſe lockes counſaile louers men dangerous bondes pray alike though forfeytours caſt priſon yet claſpe young cupids tables good newes gods ivſtice fathers wrath take dominion could cruell oh deerest creatures would euen renew eyes take notic cambria milford-hauen owne loue aduiſe follow wiſhes happineſſe remaines loyall vow encreaſing loue leonatus-poſthumus oh horſe wings hear'ſt piſanio milford-hauen read tell farre thither one meane affaires may plod weeke may glide thither day true piſanio long'ſt like lord long'ſt oh let bate like yet long'ſt fainter kinde oh like mine's beyond beyond thicke loues counſailor fill bores hearing to' th' senſe farre bleſſed milford by' th' way tell wales made happy t'inherite hauen firſt may hence nd gap make time hence-going returne excuſe firſt get hence excuſe borne ere begot weele talke heereafter prythee many miles may well rid twixt houre houre piſ one sun sun madam's enough much imo one rode to's excution man could neuer go haue heard riding wagers horſes haue bin nimbler sands run i' th' clocks behalfe foolrie go bid woman faigne sickneſſe she'le home father prouide preſently riding suit coſtlier would fit franklins huſwife piſa madam you're beſt conſider imo man heere heere enſues haue fog cannot looke away prythee bid there's acceſſible none milford way exeunt scena tertia enter belarius guiderius aruiragus bel goodly day keepe houſe whoſe roofe's lowe sleepe boyes gate inſtructs t'adore heauens bowes mornings holy office gates monarches arch'd high giants may et keepe impious turbonds without good morrow sun haile faire heauen houſe i' th' rocke yet vſe hardly prouder liuers guid haile heauen aruir haile heauen bela mountaine vp yond hill legges yong ile tread theſe flats conſider aboue perceiue like crow place leſſen's may reuolue tales haue told courts princes tricks warre seruice seruice done allowed apprehend thus drawes vs profit things oſten comfort finde hold full-wing'd eagle oh life nobler attending checke richer nothing babe prouder ruſtling vnpayd-for silke gaine cap makes fine yet keepes booke vncros'd life gui proofe poore vnfledg'd haue neuer wing'd view o' th' neſt knowes ayre's home hap'ly life beſt quiet life beſt haue knowne well correſponding age vnto vs cell ignorance trauailing bed priſon debtor dares limit arui old heare raine winde beate darke december pinching caue diſcourſe freezing houres away haue nothing beaſtly fox prey like warlike wolfe eate valour chace flyes cage make quite doth priſon'd bird bondage freely bel know citties vſuries felt knowingly art o' th' court hard leaue keepe whoſe top climbe certaine falling feare's bad falling toyle o' th' warre paine onely danger i' th' name fame honor dyes i' th' hath oft epitaph record faire act nay many times doth ill deſerue well what's worſe muſt curt'ſie cenſure oh boyes storie world may reade bodie's mark'd roman swords report firſt beſt note cymbeline lou'd souldier theame name farre tree whoſe boughes bend fruit one night storme robbery call shooke downe mellow hangings nay leaues left bare weather gui vncertaine fauour bel fault nothing haue told oft two villaines whoſe falſe oathes preuayl'd perfect honor cymbeline confederate romanes followed baniſhment twenty yeeres rocke theſe demeſnes haue bene world haue liu'd honeſt freedome payed pious debts heauen fore-end time vp to' th' mountaines hunters language veniſon firſt lord o' th' feaſt two miniſter feare poyſon attends place greater state ile meete valleyes exeunt hard hide nature theſe boyes know little sonnes to' th' king cymbeline dreames aliue thinke mine though train'd vp thus meanely i' th' caue whereon bowe thoughts hit roofes palaces nature prompts lowe things prince much beyond tricke others paladour heyre cymbeline britaine king father call'd guiderius ioue three-foot tell warlike feats haue done flye story thus mine enemy fell thus foote on's necke euen princely blood flowes cheeke straines yong nerues puts himſelfe poſture acts words yonger brother cadwall aruiragus like figure strikes life much owne conceyuing hearke game rows'd oh cymbeline heauen conſcience knowes didd'ſt vniuſtly baniſh whereon three two yeeres old theſe babes thinking barre succeſſion refts lands euriphile was't nurſe took mother euery day honor graue belarius mergan call'd take naturall father game vp exit scena quarta enter piſanio imogen imo told'ſt came frō horſe ye place neere hand ne're long'd mother firſt haue piſanio man poſthumus mind makes thus wherefore breaks th' inward one painted thus would interpreted thing perplex'd beyond put hauiour leſſe feare ere wildneſſe vanquiſh senſes what's matter tender'ſt paper looke vntender if't summer newes smile too't winterly need'ſt keepe count'nance husbands hand drug-damn'd italy hath out-craftied hee's hard point speake man tongue may take extreamitie reade would euen mortall piſ pleaſe reade finde wretched man thing moſt diſdain'd fortune imogen reades miſtris piſanio hath plaide strumpet bed teſtimonies whereof lyes bleeding weake surmiſes proofe greefe certaine expect reuenge th piſanio muſt acte faith tainted breach let thine owne hands take away life giue opportunity milford hauen hath letter purpoſe feare make mee certaine done art pander diſhonour equally diſloyall need draw sword paper hath cut throat alreadie slander whoſe edge sword whoſe tongue out-venomes wormes nyle whoſe breath rides poſting windes doth belye corners world kings queenes states maides matrons nay secrets graue viperous enters cheere madam imo falſe bed falſe lye watch thinke weepe clock clock charge nature breake fearfull dreame cry awake that's falſe to's bed piſa alas good lady imo falſe conſcience witneſſe iachimo didd'ſt accuſe incontinencie look'dſt like villaine thinkes fauours good enough iay italy whoſe mother painting hath betraid poore garment faſhion richer hang th' walles muſt ript peeces oh mens vowes womens traitors good reuolt husband thought put villainy borne where't growes worne baite ladies piſa good madam heare imo true honeſt men heard like falſe aeneas time thought falſe synons weeping many holy teare tooke pitty moſt true wretchedneſſe poſthumus wilt lay leauen proper men goodly gallant falſe periur'd great faile come fellow honeſt maſters bidding little witneſſe obedience looke draw sword take hit innocent manſion loue heart feare empty things greefe maſter indeede riches bidding mayſt valiant better cauſe coward piſ hence vile inſtrument damne hand imo muſt dye hand art seruant maſters againſt selfe-ſlaughter prohibition diuine crauens weake hand come heere's heart something's a-foot soft wee'l defence obedient scabbard heere scriptures loyall leonatus turn'd hereſie away away corrupters faith stomachers heart thus may poore fooles beleeue falſe teachers though thoſe betraid feele treaſon yet traitor worſe caſe woe poſthumus didd'ſt vp diſobedience king father makes put contempt princely fellowes heereafter finde acte common paſſage rareneſſe greeue thinke diſedg'd tyreft memory pang'd prythee diſpatch lambe entreats butcher wher's knife art maſters bidding deſire piſ oh gracious lady since receiu'd command buſineſſe haue one winke imo doo't bed piſ ile wake mine eye-balles firſt imo wherefore didd'ſt vndertake haſt abus'd many miles pretence place mine action thine owne horſes labour time inuiting perturb'd court abſent whereunto neuer purpoſe returne haſt gone farre vn-bent haſt th' elected deere piſ win time looſe bad employment haue conſider'd courſe good ladie heare patience imo talke tongue weary haue heard strumpet mine eare therein falſe take greater wound tent bottome piſ madam thought would backe againe imo moſt like bringing heere kill piſ neither wiſe honeſt purpoſe would proue well cannot maſter abus'd villaine art hath done curſed iniurie imo roman curtezan piſa life ile giue notice dead bloody commanded miſt court well confirme imo good fellow bide liue life comfort dead husband piſ you'l backe to' th' court imo court father adoe harſh noble nothing clotten whoſe loue-ſuite hath bene fearefull siege piſ court britaine muſt bide imo hath britaine sunne day night britaine i' th' worlds volume britaine in't great poole swannes-neſt prythee thinke there's liuers britaine piſ moſt glad thinke place th' ambaſſador lucius romane comes milford-hauen morrow could weare minde darke fortune diſguiſe t'appeare muſt yet tread courſe pretty full view yea happily neere reſidence poſthumus nie leaſt though actions viſible yet report render hourely eare truely mooues imo oh meanes though perill modeſtie death on't would aduenture piſ well heere's point muſt forget woman change command obedience feare niceneſſe handmaides women truely woman pretty waggiſh courage ready gybes quicke-anſwer'd quarrellous weazell nay muſt forget rareſt treaſure cheeke expoſing oh harder heart alacke remedy greedy touch common-kiſſing titan forget labourſome dainty trimmes wherein made great iuno angry imo nay breefe end almoſt man already piſ firſt make like one fore-thinking haue already fit cloake-bagge doublet hat hoſe anſwer would imitation borrow youth noble lucius preſent deſire tell wherein you're happy make know head haue eare muſicke doubtleſſe ioy imbrace hee's honourable doubling moſt holy meanes abroad haue rich neuer faile beginning imo art comfort gods diet prythee away there's conſider'd wee'l euen good time giue vs attempt souldier abide princes courage away prythee piſ well madam muſt take farewell leaſt miſt carriage court noble miſtris heere boxe queene what's in't precious sea stomacke-qualm'd land dramme driue away diſtemper fit manhood may gods direct beſt imo amen thanke exeunt scena quinta enter cymbeline queene cloten lucius lords cym thus farre fare well luc thankes royall sir emperor hath wrote muſt hence right muſt report ye maſters enemy cym subiects sir endure yoake leſſe soueraignty muſt needs appeare vn-kinglike luc sir deſire conduct ouer land milford-hauen madam ioy befall grace cym lords appointed office due honor point omit farewell noble lucius luc hand lord clot receiue friendly time forth weare enemy luc sir euent yet name winner fare well cym leaue worthy lucius good lords till haue croſt seuern▪ happines exit lucius qu goes hence frowning honours vs haue giuen cauſe clot better valiant britaines haue wiſhes cym lucius hath wrote already emperor goes heere fits vs therefore ripely chariots horſemen readineſſe powres already hath gallia drawne head whence moues warre britaine qu buſineſſe muſt look'd cym expectation would thus hath made vs forward gentle queene daughter hath appear'd roman vs hath tender'd duty day looke vs like thing made malice duty haue noted call vs haue beene qu royall sir since exile poſthumus moſt retyr'd hath life bin cure whereof lord time muſt beſeech maieſty forbeare shee's lady tender rebukes words death enter meſſenger cym sir contempt anſwer'd meſ pleaſe sir chambers lock'd there's anſwer giuen to' th' lowd noiſe make qu lord laſt went viſit pray'd excuſe keeping cloſe whereto conſtrain'd infirmitie dutie leaue vnpaide dayly bound proffer wiſh'd make knowne great court made blame memory cym doores lock'd late grant heauens feare proue falſe exit qu sonne follow king clot man piſanio old seruant haue theſe two dayes exit qu go looke piſanio poſthumus hath drugge mine pray abſence proceed beleeues thing moſt precious gone haply diſpaire hath wing'd feruour loue flowne deſir'd poſthumus gone death diſhonor end make good vſe either shee downe haue placing brittiſh crowne enter cloten sonne clot certaine fled go cheere king rages none dare come qu better may night fore-ſtall comming day exit qu clo loue hate faire royall hath courtly parts exquiſite lady ladies woman euery one beſt hath compounded out-ſelles loue therefore diſdaining throwing fauours low poſthumus iudgement what's elſe rare choak'd point conclude hate nay indeede reueng'd vpon fooles enter piſanio heere packing come hither ah precious pandar villaine lady word elſe art fiends piſ oh good lord clo lady iupiter aske againe cloſe villaine ile haue secret heart rip heart finde poſthumus whoſe many waights baſeneſſe cannot dram worth drawne piſ alas lord miſs'd rome▪ clot sir come neerer farther halting home become piſ oh all-worthy lord clo all-worthy villaine diſcouer miſtris next word worthy lord speake inſtant condemnation death piſ sir paper hiſtorie knowledge touching flight clo let's purſue euen auguſtus throne piſ periſh she's farre enough learnes may proue trauell danger clo humh piſ ile write lord dead oh imogen safe mayſt wander returne agen clot sirra letter true piſ sir thinke clot poſthumus hand know't sirrah would'ſt villain true vndergo thoſe imployments wherin haue cauſe vſe induſtry villainy bid performe directly truely would thinke honeſt man neither want meanes releefe voyce preferment piſ well good lord clot wilt mee patiently conſtantly haſt bare fortune begger poſthumus canſt courſe gratitude diligent follower mine wilt mee piſ sir clo giue mee hand heere's purſe haſt late maſters garments poſſeſſion piſan haue lord lodging suite wore tooke leaue ladie miſtreſſe clo firſt doſt mee fetch suite hither let firſt go piſ lord exit clo meet milford-hauen forgot aske one thing ile remember't anon euen villaine poſthumus kill would theſe garments come vpon time bitterneſſe belch heart held garment poſthumus reſpect noble naturall perſon together adornement qualities suite vpon backe wil rauiſh firſt kill eyes valour wil torment hir contempt ground inſulment ended dead bodie luſt hath dined vex execute cloathes prais'd court ile knock backe foot home againe hath deſpis'd mee reioycingly ile bee merry reuenge enter piſanio thoſe garments piſ noble lord clo long is't went milford-hauen piſ yet clo bring apparrell chamber thing haue commanded third wilt voluntarie mute deſigne dutious true preferment render reuenge milford would wings follow come true exit piſ bid'ſt loſſe true proue falſe neuer bee moſt true milford go▪ finde purſueſt flow flow heauenly bleſſings fooles croſt labour de exit scena sexta enter imogen alone imo mans life tedious one haue tyr'd two nights together haue made ground bed reſolution helpes milford mountaine top piſanio was't within kenne oh ioue thinke foundations flye wretched meane releeu'd two beggers told could miſſe way poore folkes lye haue afflictions knowing puniſhment triall yes wonder rich-ones tell true lapſe fulneſſe lye neede falſhood worſe kings beggers deere lord art one o' th' falſe ones thinke hunger's gone euen point food heere path too't▪ hold beſt call dare call yet famine ere cleane o're-throw nature makes valiant plentie peace breeds cowards hardneſſe euer hardineſſe mother hoa who's heere thing that's ciuill take lend hoa anſwer ile enter beſt draw sword mine enemy feare sword like hee'l looke on't foe good heauens exit scena septima enter belarius guiderius aruiragus bel polidore haue prou'd beſt woodman maſter feaſt cadwall play cooke seruant match induſtry would dry dye end workes come make what's homely wearineſſe vpon flint reſtie sloth findes downe-pillow hard peace heere poore houſe keep'ſt gui throughly weary arui weake toyle yet appetite gui cold meat i' th' caue we'l brouz whil'ſt haue kill'd cook'd bel stay come eates victualles thinke heere faiery gui what's matter sir bel iupiter angell earthly paragon behold diuineneſſe elder boy enter imogen imo good maſters harme enter'd heere call'd thought haue begg'd bought haue took good troth haue nought would though found gold i' th' floore heere's money meate would haue left boord made meale parted pray'rs prouider gui money youth aru gold siluer rather turne durt better reckon'd thoſe worſhip durty gods imo you're angry know kill fault haue dyed made bel whether bound imo milford-hauen bel what's name imo fidele sir haue kinſman bound italy embark'd milford going almoſt hunger falne offence bel prythee faire youth thinke vs churles meaſure good mindes rude place liue well encounter'd almoſt night haue better cheere ere depart thankes eate boyes bid welcome gui woman youth woo hard groome honeſty bid buy arui ile make't comfort man ile loue brother welcome i'ld giue long abſence moſt welcome fall friends imo friends brothers would bin bin fathers sonnes prize bin leſſe equall ballaſting poſthumus bel wrings diſtreſſe gui would could free't arui ere paine coſt danger gods bel hearke boyes imo great men court bigger caue attend themſelues vertue owne conſcience laying nothing-guift differing multitudes could out-peere theſe twaine pardon gods i'ld change companion since leonatus falſe bel boyes wee'l go dreſſe hunt faire youth come diſcourſe heauy faſting haue wee'l mannerly demand story farre wilt gui pray draw neere arui night to' th' owle morne th' larke leſſe welcome imo thankes sir arui pray draw neere exeunt scena octaua enter two roman senators tribunes sen tenor emperors writ common men action pannonians dalmatians legions gallia full weake vndertake warres againſt falne-off britaines incite gentry buſineſſe creates lucius pro-conſull tribunes immediate leuy commands abſolute commiſſion long liue caeſar tri lucius generall forces sen tri remaining gallia sen thoſe legions haue whereunto leuie muſt words commiſſion tye numbers time diſpatch tri diſcharge duty exeunt actus quartus scena prima enter clotten alone clot neere to' th' place meet piſanio haue mapp'd truely fit garments miſtris made made taylor fit rather reuerence word womans fitneſſe comes fits therein muſt play workman dare vainglorie man glaſſe confer owne chamber meane lines body well drawne leſſe young beneath fortunes beyond aduantage time aboue birth alike conuerſant generall remarkeable oppoſitions yet imperſeuerant thing loues deſpight mortalitie poſthumus head growing vppon within houre miſtris inforced garments cut peeces face done home father may happily little angry rough vſage mother hauing power teſtineſſe turne commendations horſe tyed vp sword purpoſe fortune put hand deſcription meeting place fellow dares deceiue exit scena secunda enter belarius guiderius aruiragus imogen caue bel well remaine heere caue wee'l come hunting arui brother heere brothers imo man man clay clay differs dignitie whoſe duſt alike gui go hunting ile abide imo yet well citizen wanton dye ere pleaſe leaue sticke iournall courſe breach cuſtome breach ill cannot amend society comfort one since reaſon pray truſt heere ile rob none let dye stealing poorely gui loue haue much quantity waight much loue father bel arui sir yoake mee good brothers fault know loue youth haue heard loue's reaſon's without reaſon beere doore demand is't dye i'ld father youth bel oh noble worthineſſe nature breed greatneſſe father cowards baſe things syre bace hath meale bran contempt grace i'me father yet bee doth myracle lou'd mee ninth houre o' th' morne arui brother farewell imo wiſh ye arui health.—so pleaſe sir imo theſe kinde creatures gods lyes haue heard courtiers all's court experience oh diſproou'ſt report th' emperious seas breeds monſters diſh poore tributary riuers fiſh heart-ſicke piſanio ile taſte drugge gui could gentle vnfortunate diſhoneſtly afflicted yet honeſt arui thus anſwer yet heereafter might know bel to' th' field to' th' field wee'l leaue time go reſt arui wee'l long away bel pray muſt huſwife imo well ill bound exit bel euer youth ere diſtreſt appeares hath good anceſtors arui angell-like gui neate cookerie arui cut rootes charracters brothes iuno bin dieter arui nobly yoakes smile smile mocking sigh would flye diuine temple commix windes saylors raile gui note greefe patience rooted mingle together arui grow patient let greefe vntwine periſhing roote encreaſing vine bel great morning come away who's enter cloten clo cannot finde thoſe runnagates villaine hath mock'd faint bel thoſe runnagates meanes vs partly know cloten sonne o' th' queene feare ambuſh theſe many yeares yet know held out-lawes hence gui one brother companies neere pray away let alone clot soft flye thus villaine-mountainers haue heard slaue art gui thing ne're anſwering slaue without knocke clot art robber law-breaker villaine yeeld theefe gui art haue arme bigge thine heart bigge words grant bigger weare dagger mouth say art yeeld clot villaine baſe know'ſt cloathes gui taylor raſcall grandfather made thoſe cloathes make clo precious varlet taylor made gui hence thanke man gaue art foole loath beate clot iniurious theefe heare name tremble gui what's name clo cloten villaine gui cloten double villaine name cannot tremble toad adder spider moue clot feare nay meere confuſion know sonne to' th' queene gui worthy birth clot art afeard gui thoſe reuerence thoſe feare wiſe fooles laugh feare clot dye death haue proper hand ile follow thoſe euen fled hence gates luds-towne heads yeeld ruſticke mountaineer fight exeunt enter belarius aruiragus bel companie's abroad arui none world miſtake bel cannot tell long time hath nothing blurr'd thoſe lines fauour wore voice burſt abſolute cloten arui place left wiſh brother make good time fell bel made vp meane man apprehenſion roaring terrors defect iudgement oft cauſe feare enter guiderius brother gui cloten foole empty purſe money in't hercules could haue knock'd braines none yet foole borne head bel haſt done gui perfect cut one clotens head sonne queene owne report call'd traitor mountaineer owne hand heel'd take vs diſplace heads thanks gods grow luds-towne bel vndone gui worthy father haue looſe take liues law protects vs tender let arrogant peece fleſh threat vs play iudge executioner himſelfe feare law company diſcouer abroad bel eye reaſon muſt haue attendants though honor nothing mutation one bad thing worſe frenzie abſolute madneſſe could farre haue rau'd bring heere alone although perhaps may heard court wee caue heere hunt heere out-lawes time may make head hearing like might breake heel'd fetch vs yet is't probable come alone either vndertaking good ground feare feare body hath taile perillous head arui let ord'nance come gods fore-ſay howſoere brother hath done well bel minde hunt day boy fideles make way long forth gui owne sword waue againſt throat haue tane head ile throw creeke behinde rocke let sea tell fiſhes hee's queenes sonne cloten that's reake exit bel feare reueng'd would polidore had'ſt done though valour becomes well enough arui would done reuenge alone purſu'de polidore loue brotherly enuy much haſt robb'd deed would reuenges poſſible might meet wold vs put vs anſwer bel well done wee'l hunt day danger there's profit prythee rocke fidele play cookes ile till haſty polidore returne bring dinner preſently arui poore fidele ile willingly gaine colour il'd let pariſh clotens blood praiſe charity exit bel oh goddeſſe diuine nature blazon'ſt theſe two princely boyes gentle zephires blowing violet wagging head yet rough royall blood enchaf'd rud'ſt winde top doth take mountaine pine make th' vale wonder inuiſible inſtinct frame royalty vnlearn'd honor vntaught ciuility valour wildely growes yeelds crop beene fow'd yet it's clotens heere vs portends death bring vs enter guidereus gui where's brother haue clotens clot-pole downe embaſſie mother bodie's hoſtage returne solemn muſick bel ingenuous inſtrument hearke polidore occaſion hath cadwal giue motion hearke gui home bel went hence euen gui meane since death deer'ſt mother things anſwer accidents matter triumphes nothing lamenting toyes iollity apes greefe boyes cadwall mad enter aruiragus imogen dead beating armes bel looke heere comes brings dire occaſion armes blame arui bird dead haue made much rather haue skipt yeares age haue turn'd leaping time crutch haue gui oh fayreſt lilly brother weares one halfe well grew'ſt bel oh melancholly euer yet could bottome finde ooze coaſt care might'ſt eaſileſt harbour bleſſed thing ioue knowes man might'ſt haue made dyed'ſt moſt rare boy melancholly found arui starke thus fly tickled deaths dart laugh'd right cheeke repoſing cuſhion gui arui o' th' floore armes thus leagu'd thought put clowted brogues feete whoſe rudeneſſe anſwer'd lowd gui gone hee'l make graue bed female fayries tombe haunted wormes come arui fayreſt flowers whil'ſt sommer laſts liue heere fidele ile graue lacke flower that's like face pale-primroſe azur'd hare-bell like veines leafe eglantine out-ſweetned breath raddocke would charitable bill oh bill thoſe rich-left-heyres let fathers lye without monument bring yea furr'd moſſe beſides flowres none winter-ground coarſe— gui prythee haue done▪ play wench-like words let vs bury protract admiration due debt to' th' graue arui say lay gui good euriphile mother arui bee't let vs polidore though voyces haue got manniſh cracke to' th' ground mother vſe like note words saue euriphile muſt fidele gui cadwall cannot ile weepe word notes tune worſe prieſts phanes lye arui wee'l bel great greefes med'cine leſſe cloten quite forgot queenes sonne boyes though came enemy remember paid though meane mighty rotting together haue one duſt yet reuerence angell world doth make diſtinction place high low foe princely though tooke life foe yet bury prince gui pray fetch hither therſites body good aiax neyther aliue arui you'l go fetch wee'l song whil'ſt brother begin gui nay cadwall muſt lay head to' th' eaſt father hath reaſon arui true gui come remoue arui begin song guid feare heate o' th' sun furious winters rages worldly task haſt home art gon tane wages golden lads girles muſt chimney-sweepers come duſt arui feare frowne o' th' great art paſt tirants care cloath eate reede oake scepter learning phyſicke muſt follow come duſt guid feare lightning flaſh arui th' all-dreaded thunderſtone gui feare slander cenſure raſh arui haſt finiſh'd ioy ne louers young louers muſt conſigne come duſt guid exorciſ harme arui witch-craft charme guid ghoſt vnlaid forbeare arui nothing ill come neere quiet conſumation haue renowned graue enter belarius body cloten gui haue done obſequies come lay downe bel heere's flowres midnight hearbes haue cold dew o' th' night fir'ſt graues vpon faces flowres wither'd euen theſe herbelets vpon come away apart vpon knees ground gaue firſt ha's againe pleaſures paſt paine exeunt imogen awakes yes sir milford-hauen way thanke yond buſh pray farre thether pittikins mile yet haue gone night ile lye downe bedfellow oh gods goddeſſes theſe flowres like pleaſures world bloody man care on't hope dreame thought caue-keeper cooke honeſt creatures bolt nothing nothing braine makes fumes eyes like iudgements blinde good faith tremble feare yet left heauen drop pittie wrens eye fear'd gods part dreame's heere euen wake without within imagin'd felt headleſſe man garments posthumus know legge hand foote mercuriall martiall thigh brawnes hercules iouiall face— murther heauen gone piſanio curſes madded hecuba gaue greekes mine boot darted conſpir'd irregulous diuell cloten hath heere cut lord write read henceforth treacherous damn'd piſanio hath forged letters damn'd piſanio moſt braueſt veſſell world strooke maine top oh poſthumus alas head where's aye where's piſanio might haue kill'd heart left head piſanio cloten malice lucre haue laid woe heere oh pregnant pregnant drugge gaue hee precious cordiall haue found murd'rous to' th' senſes confirmes home piſanio's deede cloten oh giue colour pale cheeke blood horrider may thoſe chance finde vs oh lord lord enter lucius captaines soothſayer cap legions garriſon'd gallia haue croſt sea attending heere milford-hauen shippes heere readineſſe luc rome cap senate hath vp confiners gentlemen italy moſt willing spirits promiſe noble seruice come vnder conduct bold iachimo syenna's brother luc expect cap next benefit o' th' winde luc forwardneſſe makes hopes faire command preſent numbers muſter'd bid captaines looke too't sir haue dream'd late warres purpoſe sooth laſt night gods viſion faſt pray'd intelligence thus ioues bird roman eagle wing'd south part weſt vaniſh'd sun-beames portends vnleſſe abuſe diuination succeſſe th' roman hoaſt luc dreame often neuer falſe soft hoa truncke heere without top ruine worthy building page dead dead rather nature doth abhorre make bed defunct vpon dead luc good youth mou'ſt leſſe complaining maiſter bleeding name good friend imo richard du champ lye harme though gods heare hope they'l pardon say sir luc name imo fidele sir luc doo'ſt approue name theſe poore pickaxes digge wild wood-leaues weeds ha' graue century prayers twice o're ile weepe leauing follow pleaſe entertaine mee luc good youth rather father maſter friends boy hath taught vs romaines muſt britaines vs receiue vs barbarous vnnaturall reuolts vſe vs bel sonnes wee'l higher mountaines v▪ kings party there's going newneſſe clotens death knowne muſter'd among bands may driue vs render haue liu'd extort from's haue done whoſe anſwer would death drawne torture gui sir doubt time nothing becomming vs arui likely heare roman horſes neigh behold quarter'd fires haue eyes eares cloy'd importantly waſte time vpon note know whence bel oh knowne many army many yeeres though cloten young wore remembrance beſides king hath deſeru'd seruice loues finde exile want breeding certainty heard life aye hopeleſſe haue courteſie cradle promis'd hot summers tanlings slaues winter gui better ceaſe pray sir to' th' army brother knowne thought thereto ore-growne cannot queſtion'd arui sunne ile thither thing is't neuer man dye euer look'd blood coward hares hot goats veniſon neuer beſtrid horſe one rider like ne're wore rowell iron heele aſham'd looke vpon holy sunne haue benefit bleſt beames remaining long poore vnknowne gui heauens ile go bleſſe sir giue leaue ile take better care hazard therefore due fall hands romaines arui amen bel reaſon liues valewation reſerue crack'd one care haue boyes country warres chance dye bed lads ile lye lead lead time long blood thinks till flye princes borne exeunt actus quintus scena prima enter poſthumus alone poſt yea bloody cloth ile keep wiſht colour'd thus married ones take courſe many muſt murther wiues much better themſelues wrying little oh piſanio euery good seruant do's commands bond iuſt ones gods haue vengeance faults neuer liu'd put noble imogen repent wretch worth vengeance alacke hence little faults that's loue haue fall permit illes illes elder worſe make dread dooers thrift imogen owne beſt willes make bleſt obey brought hither among th' italian gentry fight againſt ladies kingdome enough britaine haue kill'd miſtris peace ile giue wound therefore good heauens heare patiently purpoſe ile diſrobe tongue hauing worke plentifull tooles doo't downe mortally touch'd falling meerely feare paſſe damm'd deadmen hurt behinde cowards liuing dye length'ned lo lane poſt cloſe battell ditch'd wall'd turph gaue aduantage ancient soldiour honeſt one warrant deſeru'd long breeding white beard came for's country athwart lane two lads like run country baſe commit faces fit maskes rather fayrer thoſe preſeruation cas'd made good paſſage cryed thoſe fled britaines hearts dye flying men darkneſſe fleete flye backwards romanes giue like beaſts beaſtly may looke backe frowne stand theſe three three thouſand confident acte many three performers file reſt nothing word accomodated place charming owne nobleneſſe could haue turn'd diſtaffe lance guilded pale lookes part part renew'd turn'd coward example oh warre damn'd firſt beginners gan looke way grin like lyons vpon pikes o' th' hunters beganne i' th' chaſer retyre anon rowt confuſion thicke forthwith flye chickens way eagles slaues victors made cowards like fragments hard voyages became life o' th' need hauing found backe doore open vnguarded hearts heauens wound dying friends ore-borne i' th' former waue ten chac'd one one twenty thoſe would dye ere reſiſt growne mortall bugs o' th' field lord chance narrow lane old man two boyes poſt nay wonder made rather wonder things heare worke rime vpon vent mock'rie heere one boyes oldman twice boy lane britaines romanes bane lord nay angry sir poſt lacke end dares foe ile friend hee'l made doo know hee'l quickly flye friendſhip haue put rime lord farewell you're angry exit poſt still going lord oh noble miſery i' th' field aske newes day many would haue giuen honours haue carkaſſes tooke heele doo't yet dyed mine owne woe charm'd could finde death heare groane feele vgly monſter hides freſh cups beds sweet words hath moe miniſters draw kniues i' th' war well finde fauourer britaine britaine haue reſum'd againe part came fight yeeld verieſt hinde touch great gaoler gao haue lockes vpon graze finde paſture gao poſt moſt welcome bondage art way thinke liberty yet better one that's o' th' gowt rather groane perpetuity cur'd phyſitian death key t'vnbarre guiderius aruiragus piſanio lords cym stand gods haue made preſeruers throne woe heart poore souldier richly fought whoſe ragges gilded armes whoſe naked breſt stept ta ges proofe cannot found happy finde grace make bel neuer noble fury poore thing precious deeds one promiſt nought beggery poore lookes cym tydings piſa hath bin among dead liuing trace cym greefe heyre reward adde liuer heart braine britaine grant liues time aske whence report bel sir cambria borne gentlemen boaſt neyther true modeſt vnleſſe adde honeſt cym bow knees ariſe knights o' th' battell create companions perſon fit dignities becomming eſtates enter cornelius ladies there's buſineſſe theſe faces greet victory looke like romaines o' th' court britaine corn hayle great king happineſſe muſt report queene dead cym worſe phyſitian would report become conſider med'cine life may prolong'd yet death doctor ended cor horror madly dying like life cruell world concluded moſt cruell confeſt report pleaſe theſe women trip erre wet cheekes preſent finiſh'd cym prythee cor firſt confeſt neuer lou'd onely affected greatneſſe got married royalty wife place abhorr'd perſon cym alone knew dying would beleeue lips opening proceed corn daughter bore hand loue integrity confeſſe scorpion whoſe life flight preuented tane poyſon cym moſt delicate fiend is't reade woman corn sir worſe confeſſe mortall minerall tooke minute feede life ling'ring inches waſte time purpos'd watching weeping tendance kiſſing orecome time fitted craft worke sonne th' adoption crowne fayling end abſence grew deſperate open'd deſpight heauen men purpoſes repented euils hatch'd effected diſpayring dyed cym heard women la pleaſe highneſſe cym mine eyes fault beautifull mine eares heare flattery heart thought like beene vicious haue miſtruſted yet oh daughter folly mayſt proue feeling heauen mend enter lucius iachimo roman priſoners leonatus behind imogen comm'ſt caius tribute britaines haue rac'd though loſſe many bold one whoſe kinſmen haue made good may appeas'd captiues haue granted thinke eſtate luc conſider sir chance warre day accident gone vs blood cool haue threatend priſoners sword gods haue thus nothing liues may call'd ranſome let come sufficeth roman romans heart auguſtus liues thinke on't much peculiar care one thing onely entreate boy britaine borne let ranſom'd neuer maſter page kinde duteous diligent tender ouer occaſions true feate nurſe-like let vertue ioyne requeſt ile make bold highneſſe cannot deny hath done britaine harme though haue roman saue sir blood beſide cym haue fauour familiar boy haſt look'd grace art mine owne know wherefore liue boy ne're thanke maſter liue aske cymbeline boone wilt fitting bounty ile giue yea though demand priſoner nobleſt tane imo humbly thanke highneſſe luc bid begge life good lad ye know wilt imo alacke there's worke hand thing bitter death life good maſter muſt luc boy diſdaines leaues briefely dye ioyes place truth gyrles boyes perplext cym would'ſt boy loue thinke what's beſt aske know'ſt look'ſt wilt haue liue kin friend imo romane kin highneſſe born vaſſaile neerer cym wherefore ey'ſt imo ile tell sir priuate pleaſe giue hearing cym heart lend beſt attention what's name imo fidele sir cym thou'rt good youth page ile maſter walke freely bel boy reuiu'd death arui one sand another reſembles roſie lad dyed fidele thinke gui dead thing aliue bel peace peace eyes vs forbeare creatures may alike would haue vs gui dead bel let's piſa miſtris since liuing let time run good bad cym come make demand alowd sir forth giue anſwer boy freely greatneſſe grace honor bitter torture winnow truth falſhood one imo boone gentleman may render ring poſt what's cym diamond vpon finger came iach thou'lt torture leaue vnſpoken wou'd torture cym iach glad conſtrain'd vtter torments conceale villany got ring leonatus iewell did'ſt baniſh may greeue doth nobler sir ne're liu'd sky ground wilt heare lord cym belongs iach paragon daughter heart drops blood falſe quaile remember giue leaue faint cym daughter hir renew rather liue nature dye ere heare man iach vpon time vnhappy clocke houre rome accurſt manſion feaſt oh would viands bin poyſon'd leaſt thoſe heau'd head good poſthumus good ill men beſt among'ſt rar'ſt good ones hearing vs praiſe loues italy beauty made barren boaſt beſt could feature laming shrine minerua poſtures beyond breefe nature condition qualities man loues woman beſides hooke wiuing faireneſſe eye cym fire come matter iach vnleſſe would'ſt greeue quickly poſthumus moſt like noble lord loue one royall louer tooke hint diſpraiſing prais'd therein calme vertue began miſtris picture tongue made minde put in't either bragges crak'd kitchin-trulles deſcription prou'd vs vnſpeaking cym nay nay to' th' purpoſe iach daughters chaſtity beginnes dian hot dreames alone cold whereat wretch made praiſe wager'd peeces gold wore vpon honour'd finger attaine place of's bed winne ring mine adultery true knight leſſer honour confident truly finde ring would beene carbuncle phoebus wheele might bin worth of's carre away britaine poſte deſigne well may sir remember court taught chaſte daughter wide difference amorous villanous thus quench'd hope longing mine italian braine gan duller britaine operare moſt vildely vantage excellent breefe practiſe preuayl'd return'd proofe enough make noble leonatus mad wounding beleefe renowne tokens thus thus auerring notes chamber-hanging pictures bracelet oh cunning got nay markes perſon could thinke bond chaſtity quite crack'd hauing forfeyt whereupon thinkes poſt do'ſt italian fiend aye moſt credulous foole egregious murtherer theefe thing that's due villaines paſt come oh giue cord knife poyſon vpright iuſticer king torturors ingenious th' abhorred things o' th' earth amend worſe poſthumus kill'd daughter villain-like lye caus'd leſſer villaine theefe doo't temple vertue yea spit throw caſt myre vpon dogges o' th' bay euery villaine call'd poſthumus leonatus villany leſſe oh imogen queene life wife oh imogen imogen imogen imo peace lord heare heare poſt shall's haue play page lye part piſ oh gentlemen helpe mine' miſtris oh lord poſthumus ne're kill'd imogen till helpe helpe mine honour'd lady cym world go round poſth comes theſe mee piſa wake miſtris cym gods meane death mortall ioy piſa fares miſtris imo oh get gau'ſt poyſon dangerous fellow hence breath princes cym tune imogen piſae lady gods throw box gaue thought mee precious thing queene cym new matter imo poyſon'd corn oh gods left one thing queene confeſt muſt approue honeſt paſanio haue giuen miſtris confection gaue cordiall would rat cym what's cornelius corn queene sir oft importun'd temper poyſons pretending knowledge onely killing creatures vilde cats dogges eſteeme dreading purpoſe danger compound certaine tane would ceaſe preſent powre life time offices nature againe due functions haue tane imo moſt like dead bel boyes error gui fidele imo throw wedded lady fro thinke vpon rocke throw againe poſt hang like fruite till tree dye cym fleſh childe mak'ſt dullard act wilt imo bleſſing sir bel though loue youth blame ye motiue for't cym teares fall proue holy-water imogen mothers dead imo for't lord cym oh naught long meet heere sonne gone know piſa lord feare ile troth lord cloten vpon ladies miſſing came sword drawne foam'd mouth diſcouer'd way gone inſtant death accident feigned letter maſters pocket directed mountaines neere milford frenzie maſters garments inforc'd away poſtes vnchaſte purpoſe oath violate ladies honor became know gui let end story cym marry gods forefend would good deeds lips plucke hard prythee valiant youth deny't againe gui haue cym prince gui moſt inciuill one wrongs mee nothing prince-like prouoke language would make sea could roare cut off's head right glad heere tell tale mine cym thine owne tongue art condemn'd muſt endure law thou'rt dead imo headleſſe man thought bin lord cym binde offender take preſence bel stay sir king man better man well deſcended hath merited band clotens euer let armes alone borne bondage cym old soldier wilt vndoo worth art vnpayd taſting wrath deſcent good arui farre cym dye for't bel dye three proue two one's good haue giuen sonnes muſt mine owne part vnfold dangerous though haply well arui danger's guid good bel haue leaue hadd'ſt great king subiect call'd belarius cym baniſh'd traitor bel hath aſſum'd age indeed baniſh'd man know traitor cym take hence whole world bel hot firſt pay nurſing sonnes let confiſcate haue receyu'd cym nurſing sonnes bel blunt heere's knee ere ariſe preferre sonnes old father mighty sir theſe two young gentlemen call father thinke sonnes none mine yſſue loynes liege blood begetting cym iſſue bel fathers old morgan belarius baniſh'd pleaſure neere offence puniſhment treaſon harme theſe gentle princes theſe twenty yeares haue train'd vp thoſe arts haue could put breeding sir highneſſe knowes nurſe euriphile theft wedded theſe children vpon baniſhment moou'd too't hauing receyu'd puniſhment beaten loyaltie excited treaſon deere loſſe felt vnto end gracious sir heere sonnes againe muſt looſe two companions world benediction theſe couering heauens fall heads liks dew worthie in-lay heauen starres cym weep'ſt seruice three haue done vnlike tell'ſt loſt children theſe know wiſh payre worthier sonnes bel pleas'd awhile gentleman call polidore moſt worthy prince true guiderius gentleman cadwall aruiragus yonger princely son sir lapt moſt curious mantle wrought th' hand queene mother orbes may reigne oh imogen haſt loſt kingdome imo lord haue got two worlds by't oh gentle brothers haue thus met oh neuer heereafter trueſt call'd brother siſter brothers indeed cym ere meete arui good lord gui firſt meeting lou'd continew'd vntill thought dyed corn queenes dramme cym rare inſtinct heare fierce abridgment hath circumſtantiall branches diſtinction rich liu'd came romane captiue ayre vertuous daughter call mollis aer mollis aer terme mulier mulier diuine moſt conſtant wife euen anſwering letter oracle vnknowne vnſought clipt moſt tender aire cym hath sooth lofty cedar royall cymbeline perſonates lopt branches point two sonnes forth belarius many yeares thought dead reuiu'd maieſticke cedar ioyn'd whoſe iſſue promiſes britaine peace plenty cym well peace begin caius lucius although victor caeſar romane empire promiſing pay wonted tribute diſſwaded wicked queene heauens iuſtice haue laid moſt heauy hand sooth fingers powres aboue tune harmony peace viſion made knowne lucius ere yet inſtant full accompliſh'd romaine eagle south weſt wing aloft leſſen'd beames o' th' sun vaniſh'd fore-ſhew'd princely eagle th' imperiall caeſar againe vnite fauour radiant cymbeline heere weſt cym laud gods let crooked smoakes climbe noſtrils bleſt altars publiſh peace subiects set forward let roman brittiſh enſigne waue friendly together luds-towne march temple great iupiter
